111.title: Canine

He gains powers that should not exist.
1111.content:
You are an honest to god animal lover. But, not any animal would fit you; you were a special animal rescuer. Only taking in animals that were given up on and had little time to live. You tried to give them a life they couldn't have had before until the moment their eyes close as you held them. It was your duty, you felt. You didn't call yourself a hero, but you knew what you were doing was right. Your only policy was that you only rescued once until their time came. You wanted to give your full attention to them and no other. A freak in the eyes of society but you ask those people how high your karma must be by now. They can never give you an answer. It was also how you kept company and had fun. Your novels allowed you to retire early so you had your life to spend with the animals you loved. Your cat Dem died last week.

You walked into the rescue center not even needing to say anything to the clerk as he showed you to the serious case room. You never wanted him to tell you their conditions, they weren't merchandise and besides that you knew. Many of the animals knew you and jumped, or at least tried their best to, to get your attention. As you looked through the group there was a collie that caught your eye, less than a year you could tell. But there was one that made your heart stop in sorrow at the mid-end of the row. A small puppy that could fit in your hand was nestled in the back of a cage. He shivered and could not open his eyes as he smelled your hand over him. He tried to lick your hand but fell back struggling to sit. "Less then a month, two weeks tops," the clerk said.

"I'll take him, how old is he?"

"He was just born three days ago, we named him Cody after his dad. Hid dad died little less than a week ago. And his mother abandoned him.

"He was never breast fed..." you just nodded to him as he opened the cage. You carefully held him after picking him up with the blanket you brought. He was a tiny black mixed dog, you could tell he had a lot of blood mixed. You couldn't go back in your car, the bumpy roads would kill him. You'd have to come back for it later.

"Cody can you hear me?" you softly spoke to him as you walked through your front door. He twitched, not sure what was happening, "this is your new home." He scurried in your arms trying to look around and trying to force his eyes open. "Stop it, don't force yourself." In response he tried to climb up to your face, whining as he did. He was trying to show his affection, but it wasn't helping his health. You tilted your head down to make him stop, he sniffed you and pressed his muzzle to your face. He was cold.

You brought him to your couch and set him down on a cushion and let him scurry around in his blanket. It was too sad, all he wanted to do was play. But, even if his heart were to beat just a little too fats it would be too much. You made sure he was tightly bundled so he wouldn't move. You began your relationship by giving him his first meal.

...

After a few days Cody was finally able to stand on his own, but he still couldn't see. You clapped to help him find you and gave him small pets along with a little treat when he got to you. You felt the same way you did when you were with a pet, but it was always renewed, the joy, love, and finally the sorrow in the end.

...

After a few more days, you knew it was almost time. You always cried when they left, but you also made sure they were happy. Cody was finally able to open his eyes and make small barks. You gave him as much love as you could when he gave you his. He was even able to lick your face on his own now.

...

One night you had nestled Cody in a basket next to your bed. You didn't even hear him as light of a sleeper as you were. It wasn't until you woke up the next day that you found him. Cody was sprawled on the floor laying on his side, not breathing. It must have been late at night, he tried to climb into bed with you...then...

You couldn't...you didn't want to think at the moment, but you still let yourself cry. You couldn't allow your self not to cry, "It's alright...Cody, you can get into...into..." you raised his little body up to your chest lightly kissing him as you took him downstairs. You set him on your couch and grabbed your keys. You had to go get what you needed for him.

You hated this as much as you loved it, the reason why you took in animals that were already given up on. Was so you couldn't feel lonely anymore. And when one died you realized just how alone you were. That's why you were able to smile when you took in the next one. You hated yourself more than you hated burying each animal in your home.

When you got back you took the things you got and were about to open the door. You always hesitated, because you'll find exactly what you left. But you still opened the door.

Something was odd when you stepped inside though. You didn't feel the sad and encroaching feeling you did when you left. Something was on your couch that wasn't Cody, "who's there?" A black figure was laying on your couch. You dropped your things and walked to it.

As you did the figure stood up, it's back facing you. It was covered in black fur and had ears coming off the top of its head, "is this come kind of joke!" The ears folded down as its face turned to you. "Master?"

You saw the same colored eyes as Cody's on the creatures face. It stood up and began wobbling towards you, "master, I finally learned how to walk...you said you were proud of me...didn't you?" You couldn't speak as he walked up to you. Tears flowing down both of your faces. "...did Cody do something bad...did Cody make...make master sad..."

You watched as the figure pull at your shirt, "please...don't be sad...Cody no mean make sad...didn't mean fall off bed..." shock ran down your spine. He cried furiously as he tugged on your shirt. "...only wanted...want to cuddle...cuddle with master..."

You didn't even notice that you were holding him until you spoke, "it-it's okay, Cody I know...I know you just wanted to climb in bed...with me...It's alright...but please, don't...don't leave me like that again..."

"You are an amazing person you know that," a voice came from Cody's mouth that wasn't his. You looked down and saw Cody's grey eyes turn violet as his fur turned white. Wings sprouting from his back. You only watched as Cody rose into the air. "You don't even know just how good of a person you are. You've sent so many of my children back to me with warmth in their hearts. And for that I give you this reward. Cody will be my vessel as I am reborn into this world. He will never leave you even after death."

"Who are you?"

"Hehe...I don't actually have a name. But, for now just call me...Cody...I promise that'll you'll never feel lonely again." After he said this the wings and white fur faded as Cody dropped from the air unconscious. You caught him before he hit the floor, but what were you going to do now. Never lonely again you thought...
1111.title: The Deity's Master

choices: Go to sleep now since it was getting late.
Give him his first bath then go to sleep (but something strange happens).
11111.content:
You looked at his face in your arms as you held him. His body was warm and his heart beat steadily, you could feel it. He was alive and right here with you...thump thump...thump thump...that sound used to be nonuniform, but now it was soft and beating like a birds wings. You didn't know the tears had come until you saw them drip down to Cody's face. And looking at him, you managed to say, "Cody." In your mind and in your heart too.

You lightly dug your face into his soft fur to hear it louder. Sitting down on your couch, it was like hearing a drum. Or hearing a single sentence created by the first thump, the reprieve and the second thump 'I'm Alive'. Before you could listen more you noticed him stir in your arms. Then you felt something wet and warm against your face, it tickled badly and you couldn't stop yourself from laughing. "C-Cody" you tried to say between your gasps. He stopped licking your face and both of you looked at each other smiling. "Master...not mad at Cody anymore..?"

"Cody, I could never be mad at you for something like that. But please..."you held him tightly but not too tight, "please don't leave me again..."

"I won't...I promise master...'We promise'..." the last bit of those words came from the other voice.

You gently pulled back, "We?" Cody looked at you quizzically. You figured it must have been the 'other' Cody. You shook your head, "never mind Cody. I'm just glad you're alright." You got up setting him down gently on the couch looking at him as he looked sweetly at you. "Let me make sure you're completely okay though, is that alright?"

"It okay master." He said as he began panting with anticipation. You smiled as you knelt down to examine him. His body was a halfway point between a person and a puppy. He still had black scruffy fur that was short in some spots from his malnutrition before you took him in. His eyes were still gray and could react well to the light, they curled in delight as you looked in them. You felt his arms and legs, still weak and bony. He could walk, like you saw before, but he probably would still tip over if not careful. His breathing was alright, and you already knew his heart beat was steady. The inside of his mouth was well built and looked slightly more human as well, but his teeth were still weak and probably couldn't handle some foods yet. The largest difference in his new structure were his legs and arms. His legs did not have a bend and was shaped just like a human's as were his arms. His arms even had hands instead of paws. But his feet still looked like paws. All in all when you stood up and looked at him he was still the same little puppy, just a bit healthier and able to live fully. He just needed a little more help and he'd be okay.

"Will Cody be okay master?" He looked up to you hopefully.

You sat back down and gently kneaded and scratched his head as he growled contently, "You'll be just fine Cody, you're much healthier. All you need is a little more rest and lots of good food and you'll be completely okay...gah!" Cody swiftly wrapped his arms around your waist and was nuzzling your chest lovingly.

"Cody really, really happy! Master say Cody okay! Cody be okay!" then he suddenly stopped nuzzling you and looked up to your face, "but master say Cody need to eat good food. And master say Cody needed exercise before."

"You remember what I said before you changed?"

"Cody remember, Cody remember a lot. Cody need get healthy, healthy so master be happy."

"Cody I'm already happy, I'm happy you're alright."

"Master..." Cody's smile widened to the point that he closed his eyes and just lay his head in your arms. Then he said softly to you, "Cody love master..."

You pulled yourself over him and held each other, "I love you too Cody..."

...

After you examined him and talked with him you thought it was about time to feed Cody. Especially when he got embarrassed about his stomach growling. You knew he wanted to learn to walk badly but he still wobbled from his weak legs, instead of carrying him you decided to help lead him. You held his hand and carefully led him to the kitchen. You sat him at the table and filled his bowl with chewy dog food, he still wasn't able to chew hard dog food.

Since he was now more human you felt fine letting him sit at the table and eat from his dish as well as drink from another bowl. But when he saw you use a cup to drink from he wanted to try too. He softly asked if you would show him and you did. He was a fast learner.

After you both ate you decided to do one of two things...
11111.title: Heathy Puppy

choices: "Remember? Cody is Cody's vessel now!"
"Not really sure!"
11112.content:
You quietly carried Cody in your arms as you walked towards your bed. The day may have just started, but you were completely exhausted from everything that had happened. You had believed Cody was gone for good, but now, here he was in your arms again. And after everything that had happened, you didn't know if he was still the same. The arms and legs were obviously new, and he was able to talk now... The thought of it filled your mind with concern as you looked at him.

You hesitated as you arrived before placing him gently onto your bed. There was no way that he would fit on his old bed now, and there simply wasn't any better place to put him. You got a decent look at him as he laid upon it. Though his body was clearly different, he still had the same features somehow. His fur was still ragged, and his limbs were thin and worn. He still looked like the tired puppy that you were familiar with.

You swallowed quietly as you wiped your eyes before moving into the bed after him. You gently pulled him into your arms as you closed your eyes. It wasn't completely clear what was going on, but perhaps the next day would bring you some new answer. "Of... of course... You can be here... with me..."

You fell asleep almost immediately as you held him, careful not to squeeze too tight as he rests. You had kept him on your lap in the past, and even like this, having him against you felt warm and comforting. You carefully pulled the blanket over him before closing your eyes and drifting of.
___________

You gave a small yelp as you finally woke, your face wet as your eyes snapped open. You quickly saw Cody's face right in font of yours, happily licking across your cheek. He smiled as he saw you wake, eagerly nuzzling against your cheek. "Good morning, master!"

"Good-good morning." You hesitate a little, half-convinced that you were dreaming as you looked at the clock. It was already late afternoon, but Cody was gently sitting up next to you, his tail wagging slowly. He smiled as he slowly crept off, a little unsteady, but managing to get to the ground safely. "Are you feeling okay, Cody?"

He nodded as he sat next to the bed, looking at you as you slowly pulled the blanket off. "I slept well! How's master doing?"

"I'm doing okay, too." You smile to him, carefully moving off of the bed. "You shouldn't push yourself too much, though... You're still pretty weak right now." You carefully move, walking close before lifting him up in your arms. He still felt light in your grip, and you were more than a little concerned as you held him. However, he only curled up a little bit in your arms, licking softly against your chest. You couldn't help but chuckle softly as his head gently brushed up against your shirt. "Come on, let's get you some food." You could feel his tail wagging harder as you held him, clearly eager at the thought.

You walked into your kitchen, carefully letting him down on the counter top. Although he had gotten used to the spot, it felt odd placing him there now. However, he cheerfully slipped, sitting up normally against the counter. "Thanks, master!"

You smiled as you gently put your hand against his head, scritching it softly. He gave a contented growl, relaxing as he shakes his head around against your fingers. "What do you feel like for breakfast? Do you think you can try eating something solid?" You turned towards the floor, moving to pick his bowl up for him. It laid on the ground, having little use in the past few weeks. Most times, you had to feed him yourself, and he wasn't capable of using it. You had gotten the bowl just in case, and it had mostly been used for water on the rare occasions that he was capable of reaching it himself.

"I can get it!" He smiled eagerly as he glanced towards his bowl, his eyes flashing a little somehow.

You didn't really know what to expect, but jumped when you saw it give a twitch. It slowly hovered up off the ground, before moving towards him. He happily picked it up, holding it in his lap as he looked at you.

"C-cody?" You stutter a bit, paused in the middle of walking towards him. He saw your expression, and his ears turned down a bit.

"Master? Did Cody do something wrong?"

"Just... Surprised me. I mean, you're a bit different now, but I didn't know that it meant you could..."

"Cody is still Cody..." He gave a soft whine, his eyes softly looking at you, a little depressed. It only took you a moment to realize it, before you moved forwards, gently hugging him in your arms.

"I didn't mean that, Cody... You just look different, that's all. I know you're still the same sweet puppy..." You smile and gently kiss his cheek. He quickly perks up, his tail wagging against the counter top. "Right now, though, you're really something special... I just didn't know you could do something like that!" You slowly release him, turning just to grab something for him. "How did you do that, anyways?"

Cody's smile was back as he looked at you, happily speaking as if there wasn't anything odd going on.
11112.title: New Day

His powers were developing as well.
111122.content:
He responded in his cute voice, shaking his head a little bit before speaking quite clearly. "Not really sure! Cody just know he special!" You couldn't help but pat his his head as he smiled. He gave a contented growl as he wiggled under your hand. You let him relax and flop back onto the counter, careful to make sure he had enough room before you took his bowl and filled it up with water for him, before handing it back to him. He did his best to bury hold it up and push his muzzle in it, splashing water everywhere as he tried to drink.

You only laughed as he made a bit of a mess everywhere. "Alright, Cody. I'll just get you something easy to eat for now. You don't want to push yourself too much, okay?" He just gave a firm nod, his muzzle still buried in his bowl and splashing about. If Cody had no idea what happened, then you wouldn't push him. It was better to just let him learn on his own, and to just take care of him the best you could.

You put his food down onto the ground, and gently helped him down as well. You weren't quite sure if it was okay for him to try to eat at the table with you, but he seemed much more comfortable acting like a puppy than trying to eat like a human. You could only smile as you watched him dig in, before just getting a bit for yourself.

Halfway through your meal, you could feel Cody manage to move next to you. He was still unsteady as he walked, so you quickly put your hand out, catching him and helping to keep him still. "Can Cody sit on master's lap?" He wagged eagerly as he leaned a little against your chair.

"Just be careful, okay? I don't want you to slip or something?" You tried to move for him, smiling as he just tried to wiggle in. It was a little trickier for you to continue eating with him sitting against you, nuzzling in, but you simply took your time with it. He looked comfortable as he rested against you, and there was no way that you would interrupt him. You couldn't help but chuckle a little as he licked a little at your plate when you finished, nibbling down some of the scraps.

"I guess it's okay for you to try to eat, then?"

Cody happily nodded as he gave another lick, before turning to give you a firm lick as well. "Cody feeling lot better today!" You just smiled and hugged him firmly before standing up and carefully letting him back onto the ground. You started to put the dishes away, but were a little surprised when you saw the plates moving on their own. You just turned to Cody, seeing him concentrating and trying to focus. You let him put them into the sink before speaking. "You okay when you do that, Cody? Doesn't strain you or something, does it?"

"No... Cody feel fine! Cody glad can help master!" He just eagerly wagged, and you smiled and nodded.

"Well, we've still got a full day ahead of us... Do you think you can get back on your feet and start walking a little?" You smiled, as you gently helped him up, holding him steadily.

"Yes! Cody always feel better after!" He just smiled, eagerly moving forward. You did your best to keep him steady as you helped him move to the next room.

Although his body was a bit different now, he still needed a lot of help moving. He was doing a lot better, and he could keep active for a few minutes, but you still didn't want to strain him too much. You kept things simple, playing with him, helping him walk around, and he always seemed happy at even the smallest complement. Whenever he wanted to rest, you would just hold him in, and on occasion, he would just play with a small ball you had gotten him, sometimes batting around at it, other times trying to use his powers to control it. It seemed that it was slippery and tough for him to get a good grip on. It was amazing to see him in good spirits, and after the day was through, it was becoming clear that...
111122.title: Innocence

choices: He's growing a lot more than you thought he would.
He's getting too energetic to keep indoors.
1111221.content:
The improvement that Cody made was extraordinary. By the end of the day, he was able to walk around the house on his own, both on two legs and on all fours. Although you still didn't let him wander on his own, or keep active for too long, it was clear that he was able to better take care of himself now. Even during dinner, you were willing to risk giving him solid food, and while you made sure he took it slow, he didn't seem to have a problem with it.

He looked the part, too. Though he wasn't in the best condition, he was certainly looking better than before. His body was filling out a bit, and no longer looked malnourished. His fur was growing out well, and his heartbeat was a little more steady. His development seemed a little bit fast, but you were quite relieved. You thought that the spirit was watching over Cody, but you were more than glad to accept the assistance. It meant that Cody would develop well as he grew up.

You hadn't really given the entire thing much thought. The relief of having Cody in good condition had been in the front of your mind, but the way things were, you didn't quite know how to deal with them. He was developing a healthy appetite, and he obviously couldn't sleep in the same basket anymore. You obviously had to be careful if other people were around, since there was no way that he would avoid attention. There were a lot of things that you had to consider now, and you were starting to get a little worried.

"Master? Is master okay?" Cody's voice shook you out of your thoughts. You didn't know how long you had been sitting down on the couch, just letting him lay in your lap. However, it seemed as though he had noticed your worries.

"Yeah, I'm okay, Cody. Just working out some things in my head." You smiled as you gave his neck a gentle rub, but he whined softly as you did.

He looked at you, and despite the smile that you had managed to keep on your face, he still seemed a little concerned. It seemed as though he was good at reading you, and there was little you could do about it. "Master seems sad... Did Cody..."

"Cody, you didn't do anything wrong." You shifted him a little, holding his back as you tried to sit him up in your lap. You let his head move level with yours before speaking again. "I just need to think of how things might change now, that's all. I promise, it's nothing troublesome, and I don't want you to worry over it, okay?"

Cody stared at you for a moment before giving a slow nod. You just pulled him tight in your arms, rubbing gently. "Okay, Master... Cody no worry with you... But let Cody try help, okay?"

You chuckled softly, not exactly sure how he would be able to help. Still, he seemed eager to try, and you certainly weren't going to stop him. "That's fine, Cody. Just don't push yourself, okay? Focus on getting better first." You gently stood up, carefully lifting and carrying him in your arms. He gave a small bark as he wiggled around, and you shifted to make sure you had a good grip. "How about we get some sleep?"

Cody nodded, eagerly wagging as you brought him to your bed. You were just thankful that your bed was large enough to comfortably fit the two of you, and as you laid him down, you saw his blanket float up before laying over his body. You helped to tuck him in before laying down nearby, giving a relaxed sigh. You watched him wiggle around under the sheets before you felt your eyes drift closed as well.
_____

A couple of days had gone by, and you had finally gotten used to how things had changed. Feeding Cody became less of a problem when it became clearer that human food was okay for him now. He had even tried to get up before you to get you breakfast, and while he could only just get out cold foods at the moment, it always brought a smile to your face whenever you saw him trying to help with the little things.

He had improved enough that you no longer had to worry too much about him. You still did whenever he was walking around the house, or trying to do something on his own. However, he always took it slow like you had asked, and he seemed to keep out of trouble.

But while you were glad that Cody was doing well, his development had presented a new problem...
1111221.title: Recovery

choices: You have to leave Cody alone for a while
Soon enough, Cody's having a hard time fitting in your house
11112211.content:
"Good morning, master!" You shook yourself awake as you felt Cody eagerly licking your face. He had turned from his part of the bed to yours, and was eagerly snuggling in against you. You could only laugh as you felt him licking eagerly, and did your best to pick him up off of you.

"Alright, I'm up, I'm up!" You smiled as you barely managed it, shifting a little bit and just holding him against your lap. He happily wagged in your lap, looking down at you as you reached up a bit to scritch his head. He happily sat against you for a moment before slipping onto the ground, walking out the room, bending his head down as he left the room.

You smiled as you saw him carefully moving through. He had grown a surprising amount over the last few days, and it was becoming difficult to keep up with him. It was odd waking up with him next to you, seeing him a few inches taller each night. You were a little bit worried that it was dangerous for him to be growing that much, but thankfully, it didn't seem to be straining his body or his health. It did give you a few new problems. The first time he was tall enough, he hit his head on your door frame, and you spent a good deal of time checking up to make sure he wasn't injured.

It also meant the spots he had found comfortable before were starting to get cramped. He still fit on your bed, but he had to curl up, or else his legs would hang off of the edge. It was difficult for you to try to reach around and hug him tightly, and if he ever sat on your lap, you would have to crank your neck up to look at his face. He couldn't easily bury his face in your chest when he was against you, though he happily did it when he was on all fours. It took some getting used to, and every day, by the time you had gotten used to handling it, he seemed to shoot up another few inches.

It was the same today, though you did your best not to show anything. He had to crouch a bit to make it through the doorway, and it looked like he was close to having his shoulders brush against the sides of it. At the rate things were going, you would have no choice but to keep him in a larger space, and the thought of that worried you a little bit. Whatever happened, you wanted to be close to him when he was sleeping.

Thankfully, his face cheered you up when you made it to the kitchen. It seemed he had managed to prepare breakfast for you again. However, this time, he was giddy. It seemed like he had managed to get the toaster to work, and he was excited at the prospect of being able to use man-made devices now. He had made a rather large amount, but you knew his appetite was developing as well. You were just grateful that it seemed to be growing slower than his physical growth.

After breakfast, Cody eagerly ran into the next room. He was more energetic now, and it seemed tough for him to hold still. You did your best to keep up with him, but you simply didn't have the energy to play every time he wanted to. Thankfully, he was able to entertain himself. However, it made you a little guilty. You always did your best to take care of your pets, and this time, Cody was getting to be more than you could handle. By now, you were even a little nervous about what you'd do if he kept growing. Although he tried to be cautious, he was still a little careless, and some pieces of furniture had some bumps on them when he got overzealous.

Still, it brought a smile to your face when you saw him running around. First and foremost, you were glad that he was able to run around by now. Even with all of the changes, you still couldn't complain. As he grew, his body developed and recovered from all of the problems that he seemed to have. He could easily move around now, his sight seemed to be okay, and keep active without too much strain. His powers seemed to be developing as well. He surprised you once when you found him hanging in mid-air, and he was happy to lift you up whenever you had trouble reaching something. He seemed to prefer to practice those in private, and he was always eager to surprise you when he had a chance. When he was with you, he just enjoyed being physically active, running around you, bouncing onto his ball, and anything else he could think of.

"Okay, Cody, just calm down for now, alright? We need to get you cleaned up." You heard him whine a little bit, but you shook your head as he walked up to you, dragging his legs and doing his best to give you puppy-dog eyes. You smiled softly and shook your head. You had been near animals all of your life, and while you found them absolutely adorable, there was no way he was going to convince you like that. "Now, Cody. You've been running around all the time, and you're a bit of a mess. You have to stay cleaned up, okay?"

He gave a soft whine, but followed you as you went to the bathtub. You were just grateful that he would come of his own accord. If he didn't cooperate, you knew you'd have a hard time getting him into the room, much less giving him a bath. Though he didn't seem too fond of the bathtub, he did his best to hold still for you when you washed him. You did your best to make it quick and painless, but there was a lot of him to cover. You made sure to be thorough, and though he blushed and whined the entire time, he did his best to make sure you could reach. It seemed a little odd that he was embarrassed to have you bathing him, despite you taking care of him all the time.

You didn't really think about it too much. It was enough of an effort to make sure he was completely clean. It took a while, but after, you helped him out of the tub. Before you had a chance to grab a towel, you had to gasp, water spraying everywhere as he tried to shake himself dry. You couldn't help but laugh as you saw his fur spread everywhere, trying to wipe yourself dry as he stood there, still dripping water onto the floor. He just whined a little bit, awkwardly trying to hold still before you helped him dry off completely.

It didn't take too long to finish up. He had managed to get most of the water off of him, and he was able to hold still much better now that he was out of the tub. "Cody?" You just smiled as you worked, the towel caught over his face as you worked.

"Yes, master?" He managed to grab the towel, doing his best to finish on his own. He was a little awkward when he tried to reach at the back of his neck, but he seemed more focused on your words than on getting himself clean.

You just smiled and hugged him tight. "Thanks. I know you don't really like this, but thanks for not arguing or anything. I mean, you probably could make a really big mess if you wanted to, so... I'm really lucky to have someone like you here." He blushed a little bit, but comfortably let his arms move over your shoulders, hugging back.

"Cody never do that... Cody is the lucky one." You couldn't help but wipe your eyes a little bit, holding him as tight as you could.
11112211.title: Growth

choices: Cody followed you out!
You heard Cody's voice in your head!
111122111.content:
"You're going away, master?"

"Just for the night. I have to take care of some business. Do you think you can take care of yourself?"

"Cody think so..."

"Good. You know where the food is, and you can entertain yourself, right?"

"Yes... Cody just no like being alone..."

"Aw... Come here." You couldn't help but smile as you pulled him in tight. He gave a soft whine, but seemed to relax under your grip. You were just grateful that his growth seemed to have settled down. It had been a couple of weeks, and thankfully, Cody's growth seemed to have peaked. He still had trouble getting through doorways, but you were just grateful that he could stay inside. He was still a handful, but he did his best to take care of himself as well. You could trust him alone, and since you had to go out a fair ways for some business, there really wasn't anything else you really could do. You doubted it would be safe for other people to see him, and as much as you hated the idea of leaving him alone, you knew you couldn't always keep your eyes on him. "Promise me you'll stay out of trouble, okay? If you do, I'll make sure to bring you back something as well. "

"Cody promise." He sad it a little sadly, but he seemed to know. You gave him a firm pat on his head before heading out.
__________

You sighed quietly as you laid back in your motel room. The day had gone back quickly enough, and you couldn't help but think of Cody along the way. You had made sure to get him a new toy and some food for him, but you never felt comfortable driving during the night. Things always distracted you during the night, and having Cody certainly didn't change that. You always just stayed at a cheap place and woke up early the next day.

You hoped that Cody was already asleep. He liked to stay up later than he should, and most times, he would only head to sleep when you did. While he was alone, it meant he might stay up all night or something. It did make you worry a little bit.

You had to chuckle to yourself. Here you were, worrying about Cody sleeping enough, when you knew his health had been in good condition. If you had to compare him to any normal dog, he would be just as healthy, if not better. Maybe you had just gotten too used to worrying about your pets. You just couldn't shake any of your old worries. You had spent a good deal of time making sure that Cody could be okay. You even went into the trouble of trying to teach him how to use your house phone, in case he needed to call you. It had been awkward for him to try to dial the few times, and before he had started using his powers to do so, you had a few random calls you had to handle. You hadn't heard from him yet, and since you told him not to answer, you couldn't just call to check up on him.

There really wasn't anything you could do about it. You just shifted around in the bed, closing your eyes as you tried to rest. You could hear Cody's voice as you thought of him, imagining him greeting you eagerly upon your return.

"Master! Here you are!"

You couldn't help but chuckle as you heard him. You quietly muttered to yourself. "It's only been a little while, Cody!"

"Cody didn't want to bother Master... Cody felt lonely..."

"Aw... I'm sorry, Cody. You know that I'd never want to leave you alone..."

You shifted a little bit. Something felt off, though you couldn't tell what. Sure, your imagination was good, but it was never that vivid. Still, as your eyes opened back up, you knew that something was going on as you heard his voice again. "Cody understand... Cody just glad to talk with master now!"

You snapped wide awake as you realized...
111122111.title: Left Alone

choices: Cody vanished from your sight
Cody looks like an average dog now
1111221111.content:
"C-cody? What are you doing here?" You couldn't help but sit up urgently, shaking your head and looking right at him. He was sitting on the ground in front of your bed, but his face was close to yours as you felt him trying to shift onto the bed.

“Cody tried staying at home... Cody even got to explore the house a little bit! But... It still lonely...” He turned and shifted, his muzzle lightly pressing to your chest. You let your arm around him as he spoke, and he seemed to cheer up a little. “So Cody came out after you! Cody could follow Master's scent really easily!”

“Y-you followed me? Cody, don't be...” You stammer out, having trouble finding the right words. You just sigh and shake your head a bit before pulling him in tight. “Cody, please... You know you shouldn't take any risks, right?”

“Cody understand! That's why Cody make sure it okay before he left! Cody was careful to lock door before he leave... Good weather, and short distance, so Cody could run it! ”

“C-cody, you ran here? You shouldn't be... I know you've been doing a lot better, but you shouldn't be pushing...” You sigh quietly, just shaking your head a little. “Never mind... You're here now, right... Please don't overdo it...”

“Cody is fine, see?” He just sits in front of you, happily wagging and pushing at you and licking at your cheek. “Cody is careful!” You took a quick glance over his body, quietly noticing that although he certainly look like he had just come from a long run, he was still in good condition and his heartbeat and breathing were still steady. It was difficult to believe, but he seemed okay.

“I'm glad... Really, though... I'm glad that you're okay... I mean, you could've been seen... It would've been bad if someone else spotted you, and-”

Cody shook his head vigorously, almost lifting you up as he did. “No, no... Cody make sure nobody see him like this...” He pulled back for a moment as he heard the concern in your voice. “Cody was really careful to hide on his way...”

“H-hide? You sure? I'm not sure how you could...”

Cody nodded eagerly. “Cody figured it out while you were gone! Cody know that it would be trouble if he got seen... So Cody figure how to avoid problems! Cody can show you, if you like!” He just smiled gently as he climbed off the bed, still on all fours as he looked at you.”

“S-sure...” You try to stand up, just keeping your eyes on Cody. You take care not to blink or close your eyes, making sure that you understood what he's doing. However, before you could even realize it, Cody seemed to shift from your field of vision. There wasn't enough time for you to even properly react, before you noticed that...
1111221111.title: In Front of You

choices: The next morning, after you get home, Cody seems to be getting a lot stronger.
The next morning, after you get home, nothing new has arisen as of yet.
11112211111.content:
You are suddenly gripped by a sensation of light-headedness before you collapse back onto the bed in total shock as you vision blurs and spins. Above the sound of ringing in your ears, you can hear Cody yelp out in alarmed concern.

"Master!"

Then there is nothing but darkness and silence.
__________

You awaken to find yourself still lying on your back in the bed of your motel room, except now you are also in Cody's tight embrace as he runs his muzzle over your face, licking you in an attempt to get some form of response out of you, as the sound of Cody's desperate, terrified sobs fill your ears.

"Master! Oh Master, please, please, please wake up! Cody's sorry, Master! Please wake up!"

"C-Cody? Cody? I'm alright!"

The sobs abruptly stop and Cody pulls back, allowing you to see that his eyes are wet and glistening with fresh tears.

"Master! Oh, Master!" Cody joyfully exclaims before leaping to his feet, yanking you up with him as he lavishes his adoration upon you. You are gripped by an odd feeling of the floor falling out from under you as Cody pulls you up so that you are face to face, leaving your legs dangling at least a foot and a half above the floor. Before you can even vocalize your surprise at being lifted so high and so easily by a dog who only just a month ago was barely had enough strength to live, Cody speaks again, pulling you into a massive embrace.

"Master, Cody so glad that you're okay! Cody was so scared!" He suddenly stopped and pulled back, silent, eyes wide and ears folded flat against his head. "Di-Did Cody do something wrong?" He whispered, so softly and so full of distress, it actually hurt to witness.

"No Cody, no! Not at all, you did nothing wrong!" You immediately tell him, almost unable to stand the pain in his eyes. "I was just taken off-guard by... well, by that. Cody, you just turned invisible!"

Cody's tail begins to wag rapidly. "Cody sure did Master! That was what Cody did to hide from other people and get in here to see you again!"

It's at that point that you realize a few things, now that your thoughts are in a clear, logical order.

"Erm, Cody? Can you put me down?"

Cody let out a quiet whine of embarrassment and quickly but gently lowered you to the floor.

You tilt your head far back in order to look all the way up into Cody's gray eyes, which stare back at you intently. Even with having just been picked up by him, it really hits you again as to just how much Cody has grown over the past three weeks, going from a tiny, dying puppy who could fit in your hand, no more than 7 inches from nose to tail, to a huge, towering dog, who on two legs was at least 7 foot and 6 inches from the base of his paws to the top of his head.

You let out a deep sigh and try to focus your thoughts so that you can get started on asking some important questions.

"How long was I unconscious for?"

"Oh, only for about twenty seconds Master. But it was so, so scary because Cody was so afraid that something bad had happened to you, and when you started swaying Cody got a shock and then you fell unconscious and wouldn't wake up and oh Master, Master, it was awful!"

You felt a tug at your heartstrings and immediately leaped up to embrace Cody, wrapping your arms around the middle of his abdomen. "Aw, Cody. Don't worry, everything's alright. I know it must have been scary but you don't have to worry now. I'm okay! And I'd never abandon you!"

You hear Cody sniff above you, clearly struggling to hold back a flood of emotion.

"Thank you." Cody manages to choke out without breaking down into hysterical sobs. "Thank you."

Upon hearing, the pure, raw emotion in that statement, you can't help but smile, as it's times like this that you remember the real, tangible good that you do for the animals you care for. That is what makes this line of work worth it, even with the sorrow and loss that comes with it.

As beautiful and heart-warming as this moment is, however, you feel that you should probably get back to asking those questions before the both of you get lost in the moment.

"Say, Cody? Before you told me that you... you ran here, you said that you locked the door behind you?"

"Oh, yes Master! Cody was very careful when leaving the house."

"Okay, that's good Cody, that's very good. Now, I take it you have the key?"

"Cody does have the keys, Cody put them on the bedside table with the room key!" Cody affirmed, pointing to said bedside table. Your gaze followed his outstretched arm and sure enough, on the bedside table, laid your house key, along with your car key, your motel room key, and another key that you deduced must have been the key that Cody used to get in.

Well, that explained a lot.

"Cody, where did you get the key you used to get in?" You asked, suddenly concerned that someone might notice a missing key.

"Cody borrowed it from reception, Master."

That presented a problem. Fortunately, in about five seconds you had a solution.

"Okay Cody, I want you to do something for me. I want you to go and put that key back exactly where you put it, and then come back here and knock, and I'll let you in and you can spend the night with me. In the morning, well, we'll figure that out when the time comes. Understand?"

Cody's tail began to wag and he beamed, "Cody understands, Master!" With that, he stepped forward, grabbed the key and pulled the door open, turning to give a final goodbye.

"Alright, Master. I'll be just a minute!"

Then, Cody simply disappeared.

Or at least, as you now knew, seemed to disappear. The door closed and you were left alone in your motel room. You laid back down on the bed and stared at the ceiling as your mind wandered off with the thoughts of how incredible your current situation was.

However, your thoughts were abruptly interrupted by a knocking at your door. You shot up and rushed over to the door and pulled it open to see an empty hallway. You moved back to the end of the little passage, past the door into the bathroom.

When you stopped moving, the door closed and Cody materialized in front of you.

"Hello again," Cody said in a voice that was not his own. The voice is so striking that you immediately recognize it as the voice of the being who spoke to you three weeks ago when Cody first began to develop his new powers.

Before you can say anything in response, Cody's eyes shift from gray to violet and his fur shifts from black to white as a pair of wings sprout from his back.

"Hello," You manage to mumble out, unsure of what else you could say, to which Cody laughs in response.

"Don't be afraid, I just want to talk. I'm interested in hearing how you are coping with your new situation directly from you in your own words."

"Well, I never imagined that my actions would lead to this. I'm taking care of a dog who has powers that until three weeks ago, were exclusive to fiction and it's all thanks to you. Who are you anyway? And I don't mean what is your name and what do I call you, you answered that already; I call you Cody. I mean who are you?

Cody smiled and said, "Well, I think you know the answer to that already but I'll happily clarify for you. I am a God."

You felt the air leave your lungs in a gasp of not-quite-surprise. It was something that you had suspected since the beginning but it was still quite a shock to have it confirmed.

Cody stepped over to you and placed a hand on your shoulder, looking down into your eyes. "Are you alright? I understand that this is quite a shock for you."

"I, I'm okay." You assure him. You had never been a religious person but you had always kept an open mind as to the possibility of the existence of a divine being or divine beings. Now that that had been confirmed, it opened up so many lines of questioning.

Again, Cody's muzzle lifted in a warm smile. "If you say so. I know this is a lot to take in so I'll leave you and Cody for the time being. I'll see you later."

And with that, Cody removed his hand from your shoulder, as his fur returned to its usual color and his wings seemed to fade away. Cody's eyes closed and when they opened he suddenly looked incredibly tired. You were just relieved that he hadn't fallen unconscious like last time.

Cody's jaws parted in a huge yawn. "Master? Can I sleep with you tonight?"

You smiled and wrapped your arms around him in a hug. "Of course, Cody. Let's go to bed."
11112211111.title: A New Power

choices: You said it's good to be big and strong, so Cody's visibly bigger and stronger!
You said it's good to be healthy, so Cody's grown 'healthier' in an unusual way!
You said it's good to surprise you, so Cody surprises you with a new power!
111122111111.content:
It's still an experience waking up with Cody every morning. Though the changes should've been small, you always wake up with the dog strewn over your sheets, the change always visible whenever you wake. Even in your unfamiliar surroundings, you can spot the shift in his posture as he awakens. By now, his form was comparable to that of a runner, a healthy sheen to his fur and yet another inch of height clear even as he curls up to your side.

The moment you shift up off the bed, he jumps to attention, his tongue over your face in moments. "Master! You're up! Is it time to head out now?"

You chuckle as your hand moves over his muzzle, rubbing at him for a few moments before you manage to nudge his weight off of your body. "Alright, alright. Just calm down, there. I was going to stop by breakfast, but I suppose we should just head home instead." Your eyes pass up and down over his body for a few moments, searching for any hint of stress. Though you had no idea what to expect, Cody had still run for miles to follow you, and then done something to turn himself invisible. It would be best to keep an eye on his health, just in case his new abilities had other consequences.

"Aw, so no food yet?" Cody whines as he scootches to the side of the bed, sliding off but placing his paws at the edge, eyes begging for something.

"I don't think I can take you out for meals yet, Cody. You can turn invisible, but it's still going to look odd if food starts to disappear off my plate, or if someone bumps into you. Let's just get home first, alright? If you can be invisible, I think you can ride in the car."

"Really?" The dog jumps back on, the bed creaking as his mass slams back onto you. "Yay! Cody doesn't think he's gotten to ride yet," He laughs as he scrambles over you.

"Alright, alright! Just let me get my things and check out from here, and we can get going!" You laugh as he bounces against your body, muzzle pushing about before he jumps off, pacing at the base of the bed. He paces more and more laps through the small room, bounding off the bed, peeking in the closet, and dipping his head into the bathroom as you throw everything into your luggage.

By the time you're out the door, he's vanished from sight. It only takes a few minutes for you to check out, and when you get to your car, you can hear his paws padding against the ground, impatient to climb in. You step over to your small vehicle, opening the back door for him. "You'd better get in here - I don't know if I have enough room for you up front."

"Okay, Master!" Though you can't see his form, it's weird to watch the car seat shift around, seat belt shifting under and creases showing as Cody slides into place. An indent shows he's in, the slight whapping of his tail visible as it nudges against the back. You chuckle as you reach forward, giving his lap a pat. "Do you need any help with the seat belt? Are you going to be able to sit still for that long?"

"I'll try, Master," He murmurs, the belt shifting as he grabs at the buckle. The metal thing swings and shifts all about, and you watch the indent shift before it clicks into place. "Like this?"

"Close enough," You chuckle as you get into your seat.
__________


"We're finally home!" You hear the click of the seat belt releasing, and the air shifts as Cody bounds out the open window. His paws trod all over the lawn and across the pavement before you hear the shuffling settle in at the door.

You can't help but chuckle as you picture him scampering around - even invisible, it's far too easy for you to picture him fumbling on all fours, padding through your yard, dashing around the house before settling in. It's a miracle that he was able to sit still for an hour and a half of driving. It had helped when you let him stick his head out the window or when you took a rest stop just so he could stretch out, but the long drive must've done a number to him.

"Easy, there," You laugh as you unlock and open the door, Cody's form visible as he scrambles in, skidding into the couch. "I take it you don't like driving too much?"

"It was okay, but running's better," The dog responds, already spread out, his body laying across the full length of those cushions. "Wind felt nice on Cody's face! It's just a shame it was kind of slow!"

"Slow? But we were on the highway the entire time, right? I mean, we're going faster than..." Your mind pauses for a few moments as you try to process things. Sure, the distance was runnable, but you assumed that he took most of a day to find you. If he was calling the car slow, then... "Um... Cody? How long did it take you to run to where I was staying?"

"Huh? Um... Cody didn't look at the time," He murmurs, turning to face you. "But the time... The sun was going down when Cody left. Does that help?"

You pause as you process it. Did he leave after sunset? You thought he had taken all day to run to you, but it sounds like he had managed it in less than an hour! Was that even possible? You had been worried about his health, but there's no way around it by now - Cody was doing things far beyond what he should be capable of. New powers aside, the thought of him running faster than a car was... alarming.

"And... And you definitely feel okay, right? Heart's steady and all? No pain or anything?"

"Of course, Master! Cody knows to tell Master if anything feels wrong!"

You nod. If this was really the new 'normal' for Cody, you couldn't keep treating him like the same sickly pup he was. But... Just what would that entail? Curiosity and concern both swirl through your thoughts, and you steel yourself to ask for more.

"O-okay, then, Cody. If... If that's the case, maybe we should see about letting you exercise a little more. It sounds like you're already running fast. Um... Then, what about other parts of your health? Do you know how strong you are?"

"How strong?" The dog scritches at his chin for a few moments, tilting his head. "Um..." He shifts off from the couch, before sliding his paw under. He holds his breath, his body shuddering for a moment, his arm at work, holding in place for a few moments. For a moment, you step forward, ready to tell him not to push himself. But as he continues, his arm subtly shifts, its shaking stopping, replaced by a smooth motion. With a steady lift, he hauls the entire couch up in one arm, hoisting it over his head. "This strong?"

You gape at the sight. Sure, Cody was a lot bigger - even toned enough that you'd compare him to a runner. However, even a strength-focused athlete would be impressed by what Cody's doing. Picking up a massive piece of furniture in one arm, and holding it like it's nothing? That was beyond just 'strong'. You stare at him for a couple of moments, eyes passing over his arm, processing the image as you try to confirm you're not dreaming. His firm arm still holds in place, even shifting and tensing as he continues. "Um... M-master? Is something wrong?"

"N-no, just... Just... Can you put the couch down? Gently?"

The couch is brought back to the floor, crooked but in place. Cody's smiling when he finishes, but when he turns back to you, his own expression drops. Cody's staring back at you, head tilted, a whine escaping his lips. "Did Cody... Was Cody bad?"

"No, no, you weren't!" You wave your arms for a few moments, before you rush over to Cody, arms wrapped around to comfort him. "Y-you just..." You murmur, fingers patting over his back. "It's great that you're big and strong and healthy," You hurry and say. "I was just worried that you were pushing yourself or something, or that you'd hurt yourself trying something like that! As long as you're healthy, there's no problem with being big and strong," You continue. "Honestly, it's probably a good thing," You mutter. "You just... You keep surprising me, you know," You mutter. "B-but it's fine. After all, it's a good thing if I'm surprised by a healthy dog every morning!"

"O-okay," Cody stammers out, his breathing easier when he catches your words. "Cody understands! Cody will do his best for Master!"

"I couldn't ask for more," You murmur. You manage to smile, even as your mind continues working, still struggling to process just what you're dealing with. The rest of the day goes by in a blur as you care for Cody, the rest of your energy gone as you try to keep up with the energetic dog. You know that you had prepared food for him, taken him to the backyard for play, given him a bath, and done everything else you could think of, but your actions never really register in mind. It's all you can do to try to handle the fact that Cody was possessed by a god, or sharing a body with one, or something equally unique. You knew he was special, but you hadn't expected the consequences to be this extreme. By the time the evening comes, your mind and body are both completely exhausted. It's all you can do to tuck in, hoping a night of sleep will give you a fresher perspective on things. You don't even notice when Cody shuffles into his usual spot on the bed.

You may have thought about a lot of things, but in your conscious mind, you never thought about what Cody was up to now. You had no idea just how much Cody had taken your words to heart.

That becomes clear the next morning.
111122111111.title: Appreciating the Difference

choices: Cody can lift the car over his head with one hand, without any effort at all!
Cody can lift the refigerator over his head effortlessly!
1111221111111.content:
You let out a quiet, contented moan as you slowly wake up, blearily opening your eyes to the sight of your room, as the warmth of the covers and Cody's form suffuse through your body, leaving you all cozy and snug. A smile tugs at your lips. It'd be nice to stay like this, but you have things to do, and with all the changes Cody's been going through recently, you can't waste time in bed.

You let out a breath as you think back to the events of yesterday. You still struggled to wrap your head around it all, Cody was sharing his body with a god, or something like that, whatever it was, it was almost impossible to believe and if you hadn't seen Cody change like that and develop all these new powers you probably wouldn't have believed it at all. With what you'd seen, however? It was undeniable.

A shiver ran through your body as the implications struck you again. If he was... if he was a god, then... was he able to do anything? Could he warp time and space without even the slightest bit of effort? Could he change the laws of physics on a whim? You shudder as the questions race through your mind. The thought of a being so powerful as to be able to completely defy or change the very laws of reality... you couldn't deny it, it was terrifying.

What scared you, even more, was the question of what would happen to Cody? Since he was being possessed by this god... or however it worked, would he start developing power on that scale too? He was already so much bigger and stronger than the vast majority of humans and he could outrun cars with ease without seeming the least bit winded. The thought worried you, would Cody be able to handle all that power? He was such a sweet, pure-hearted soul, the thought of him achieving literal godhood was more than a bit concerning. As fast as he was learning, you doubted he'd be ready for such power.

Well, at least Cody would undoubtedly be a benevolent god if that were ever the case. Thinking about it, you had to concede that the god who was inhabiting Cody's body certainly seemed like a genuinely good soul too. He had praised you for your care of so many of his 'children' as he had said, and he had been nothing but polite and supportive throughout the few conversations you had had. You let out a sigh, shaking your head. This was all a bit too much for so early in the day. You hadn't even gotten out of bed yet!

As you haul yourself up, pulling the covers off, Cody immediately jumps up, fully awake. "Master! You're awake!" He beams, leaning over and eagerly lapping at your face, drawing a chuckle from you.

"Yeah, I'm up, I'm up." You smiled, gently guiding his muzzle away from your face, grinning as his tongue lapped over your palm for a few licks before he stopped. "You have a good night?" You asked as you gently nudged Cody's weight off you. You couldn't help but note that it seemed that he was quite a bit heavier than last night.

"Oh yes, Master! Cody had a wonderful night! Cody has a big surprise to show you!" He exclaimed excitedly, backing up off the bed so that you could get a proper view of his whole body.

You froze at the sight, your eyes going wide as you saw exactly what it was that Cody was so eager to show you. He was bigger. A lot bigger. As he stood to his full height, it struck you just how massive he was now, utterly dwarfing even his previous height. He had to have been well past eight feet tall now, probably going on nine, judging by the fact that his head was close to the ceiling. Stunned, you look over Cody's towering frame. He's massive, there's simply no other way to describe him. That fact alone boggles your mind. It's still hard to comprehend the fact that he's so huge when he was so small and vulnerable when you first met him. Just yesterday you had compared his form to that of a runner - slender with sleek, powerful muscle. Now, however, he was built more like a bodybuilder. His chest and abdomen were packed with thick, solid and surprisingly well-defined muscles and his limbs had filled out quite substantially - his biceps were impressively large even when relaxed, as where his calves and quadriceps.

As you took in the stunning visage of Cody's new, bigger stature, you could only blurt out the obvious. "Cody! You're... you're huge!" You yelped, grimacing inwardly. It was hardly insightful, but with the shock, it was the only thing you could think of to say.

Cody's face lit up with joy as his tail began to whip around behind him. "Yes, Master! Cody's all big and strong now! Just like you want!" He beamed proudly. You started as you were struck by the realisation that Cody had considered what you had told him yesterday, while you were comforting him, and he had taken it to heart, and taken it much further than you could have ever expected!

"Oh... I... I see. Right, uh..." You stammered out, to which Cody tilted his head to the side, concerned.

"Master? Is something wrong?" He asked anxiously. "Cody... Cody thought getting bigger and stronger was a good thing?" He whimpered, which served to snap you into focus.

"Uh, it is! It absolutely is Cody, I'm just surprised, that's all! I wasn't expecting you to grow so big so quickly... But, you're totally right, it's good that you're getting bigger and stronger, it means you're healthy! And I want you to be as healthy and as happy as you can be!" You smiled warmly, your mind flashing back to when you first met him. A tiny, shivering little thing who was so weak his body could barely sustain itself. It was such a far cry from the tall, muscular humanoid dog standing in front of you, the very picture of health.

As your reassuring words drew a smile from Cody, you couldn't help but find it sweet that Cody had done this simply in an attempt to make you happy, that still didn't explain what was perhaps the most important question of all. As you began to come to terms with the fact that Cody was now so much bigger, that question came to the forefront of your thoughts, and your lips. "Cody... how exactly did you grow so much?" You asked although you suspected you knew the answer already. So much growth in such a short time span simply couldn't be natural.

The big dog brought a paw up to scratch at his chin for a moment as he tilts his head, brow furrowed slightly as he thinks. "Well, Cody's not sure how, but... Cody wanted to be bigger and stronger for Master, so Cody got bigger and stronger!" He explained, smiling brightly.

That confirmed it. You let out a breath, trying to figure out what your next course of action should be. After a moment of thought, you decided it was for the best to simply carry on as normal, although you were going to get a full checkup done soon. Well, as full a checkup as you could, given what you had.

Shaking your head to refocus your thoughts, you look up at Cody, smiling softly at how eager he looks. "Heh, that's really sweet of you Cody. You're really growing up into a big, strong dog, aren't you?" You ask rhetorically, prompting a happy whine from Cody.

"Come on, let's go get breakfast!" You smile, unable to resist chuckling as Cody enthusiastically heads for the kitchen, ducking to allow his enormous frame to pass under the doorframe as he steps through at an angle, allowing his broad shoulders to fit through without difficulty.

Breakfast thankfully passed fairly uneventfully. It was somewhat disorienting to be in the kitchen with Cody now that his immense frame took up so much more space, but you made it work. Cody, for his part, was as eager as ever. Using his power, he had levitated everything he had needed and prepared himself a massive bowl of cereal, proudly demonstrating his capability to you. You had to admit, it was truly fantastic to see him like this, especially when compared to the condition he had been in at the beginning. It was a wonderful change compared to the all-too-common sorrow.
__________
"Uh, Cody?" You asked, drawing his attention away from his breakfast.

"Yes, Master?" He replied instantly, his ears perked and his eyes focused, giving you his full, undivided attention.

"Just, uh, just wanted to check, you're okay? No pain in your joints or anything like that?" You inquired, unable to keep the concern out of your voice.

"No, Master, Cody's fine! You don't need to worry Master, Cody would tell you if something was wrong or if Cody was in pain!" He reassured you. Nodding slowly, you relaxed, letting out a heaving breath.

"Okay, good, good. I just want to make sure you're okay, that's all. After, well..." You trailed off, shaking your head. "You've gone through some really big changes since then!" You mused, to which Cody nodded enthusiastically.

"Say, uh, Cody?" You asked suddenly, as you came to a realisation. "You, er... You're a lot... bigger than yesterday, so, you must be a lot stronger now then." You noted.

Cody frowned for a moment before nodding again. "Yes, Cody does feel a lot stronger now!" He smiled proudly.

Nodding as you look back down at your now slightly cold toast, you press your lips together. "Cody... could we... could we check how strong you are after breakfast?" You asked. You had to know, things were bizarre enough already.

"Sure Master!" He beamed, drawing a slight smile from you. As sweet and innocent as always, even if he looked like a professional athlete. You picked up your toast and began to eat. The quicker you were done with breakfast, the faster you could test Cody's new strength.

11112211111111.content:
You couldn't even taste your breakfast with your mind so preoccupied. It was too distracting watching Cody nibbles through his cereal, and though he does his best with a spoon, he's unable to resist digging his muzzle into the bowl and chomping down everything within. Even bent over, his shoulders and back still rise over your gaze, a testament to his new height and mass. His crunches echo through the kitchen, the dog munching through it all. It only takes a matter of minutes before he's done, and you realize your own meal is gone, the toast already chewed through without even realizing it.

The dog shifts up against you, muzzle brushing against the top of your head. "All done, Master?" He asks, voice rumbling out when he nuzzles in against you. You shudder as your balance is pushed, the nuzzle alone enough to make your body stumble. "So, how should Cody test his strength?"

"A-ah, yeah, I'm set," You say, holding your breath as you look over the dog. "Well, um... We should probably just find something for you to lift, right? I don't think we can really go to a gym, though. What do you think you're capable of lifting?"

"Um... Probably a lot!" The dog shrugs as one hand moves to the chair, his grip shifting before he casually lifts it up, hoisting it up to his waist. It didn't look like he was taking any effort to bring that high enough that it could nudge into the ceiling. "This is light," He murmurs, before you hear the scratch of wood against the ceiling. "A-ah," The dog murmurs, fumbling with the chair for an instant.

"It's okay, it's okay," You say, doing your best to reassure the dog even as your heart pounds harder and harder. "Let's just do this outside, alright? You'll have a bit more room to move there," You murmur.

"Sure!" A few eager wags preface the dog's eager wags, and in an instant, he's dashing off to the front door, wagging loud enough that you can hear his thumps from the kitchen. You swallow and peek outside first, already wondering whether it would be safe.

"To the car, Cody. We should find a better place for that. I think my neighbors might panic a little if they saw you lifting everything nearby," You murmur. The padding of paws shifts, heavy footsteps now moving to the garage instead. You swallow as you follow, the dog following behind the moment you go through, even sprawling into the back seat when you open it for him. As much as he's able to, at least - the dog needs to curl and shift just to fit inside, all of his mass squeezing in as he settles in, it impossible for him to sit normally in the seat anymore.

The car starts up, though its movements are a bit more sluggish than you're used to. Your mind goes over places where Cody could run free for a while - up in the mountains and into the hiking trails, perhaps? It would be a bit less busy, at the least. With your mind as numb as it is, you simply go on your first impulse and start driving along that trail. Cody is out of sight by the time the car takes off, though from your view, it's impossible to ignore the massive crease that the dog makes in the seat, or the thump of his tail against whatever it's impacting on its most recent swing. The minutes pass by with his eager pants sounding out, mixing with the rumble of the car.

It's almost an hour before you arrive, but your mind's so busy that you barely even realize the time ticking by. The parking lot and the start of the trail only had a few cards parked nearby, and it didn't look like anybody was in sight. You swallow as you step out, before you open the back door for the dog. His paws hit the ground, the sound of four firm limbs touching the ground sounding out. You hold your breath for a moment, before nodding down towards the door. "Okay, if... If you don't smell anybody still here, you can appear for a little," You murmur, holding your breath. "This should mostly be wilderness and there are only a few hikers, so we can probably find a few rocks or something for you to lift," You mutter.

If you weren't expecting it, you would've jumped when Cody suddenly flashes back into your sight, a thick chest pushing right into your vision. The dog blinks a little and tilts his head. "Rocks? But... Won't they be too light, Master?"

"Too... light?" You blink at those words, mind trying to process just what he said.

"Yeah," The dog responds, before he bends down. "Rocks aren't any heavier than your car, right?" He asks. One hand brushes along the metal frame, trying to find purchase underneath. Before you have a chance to respond, his hand find a good grip and the car goes up, a simple and smooth motion hoisting it upwards, that arm alone lifting and keeping it right above his head. "See? The car's really light, so rocks are probably just like it," He says.

"C-cody... Could you please put my car down now? Gently, please," You say, your voice almost cracking at the sight. You knew Cody looked strong, but this was beyond what his size should allow. He was strong, but even he should struggle a little bit. Instead, you could barely see the tension in that arm, the pump of his chest - any sign that he was even trying! He didn't even look like he was flexing that arm, the bulge of it still similar to the other hanging at his side. "They... Cars can break if you're too rough with them," You say.

The dog's muzzle goes up and down, his smile never leaving his face. "Ah, got it!" The car lowers down, inch by inch, the dog careful to let it touch the ground slowly. "See? No problem!" So, Cody will need something heavier than that to test his strength!"

"G-got it," You say, doing your best to keep your tone even. Maybe you were getting used to Cody's changes - if you had known he could lift cars a couple of days ago, you'd probably already be blabbering again. But after the last few days, after worrying him so often, you don't want to make the dog drop his smile so soon. Without a moment's pause, you say the first thing that comes to mind.
