"...we're going to need to run some... tests on Likax. For his own safety."
122132122222111222222212121121211.content:
The group walked along the dirt path in silence, traveling the quarter mile or so until the paved road came into view. Parked on the side of the road was what looked to be a box truck, about the size of a small U-Haul. It was painted completely black nearly all over, except for the windows, the tint of which was darker than the legal limit. Of course, if this was a vehicle of an organization like the Enlightened Cabal, then that probably wasn't a concern.

Two of Grant's people, one man and one woman (the first female you had seen in the group) were sitting in the cab of the truck. As Grant walked closer, he stopped for a moment, listening and glancing from side to side. "We're clear," he whispered, then signaled with his hand towards the two in the truck. They nodded, and the truck's lights came on and the engine came to life, though it seemed to be much quieter than any truck engine you had ever heard, more like something you'd expect out of an electric car.

Grant walked around to the back and slid open the door, revealing a surprisingly spacious interior with small bench-like protrusions on either side. "Likax, you climb in first. I want to make sure that my men are between you and anyone that might decide to-- well, you know."

Likax's eyes narrowed but he didn't say anything, climbing into the truck and sitting down. The fur at the tips of his ears brushed against the ceiling, but luckily he could sit straight up without bending over. You climbed in next to him, sitting close enough to feel his body move as he breathed. Grant and the rest of his men climbed in behind, and as soon as the door slid shut, the truck jerked into motion, the motor nearly as quiet as when it was idle.

"What kind of truck is this?" you asked Grant. "I've never seen anything this big run so silently."

Looking down at a tablet computer, it took a moment for Grant to respond to your question. "It's an advanced electric transport originally developed for the US Army. They rejected the design for cost overruns, so the Comradity was able to pick it up. Our two groups use it whenever we have to transport something without attracting much attention."

Advanced military equipment? The Comradity must have more resources than you had thought. Looking around, though, you realized that all of the funds must have gone into the purchase of the vehicle itself, as there was little visible equipment inside.

"So," Grant continued, still staring down at his tablet, "you'll be issued an entry-level rifle in two or three days, once we can get it allocated from our supply back at base. In the mean time, the pistol you have should be sufficient."

Both you and Likax exchanged glances. You didn't think that Grant was watching when you grabbed the gun, but obviously he saw more than he let on. At this point, you realized that if the Enlightened Cabal turned out to not be on your side, then you were in a whole lot of trouble.

"It should only take us about ten minutes to get to our destination," Grant said as he turned to look up at you, but then stopped, as if he was unsure about what he was going to say. "In… in the mean time…"
122132122222111222222212121121211.title: A Nice Ride

choices: You're in the middle of an underground bunker.
You're inside what appears to be a massive hanger.
1221321222221112222222121211212111.content:
“...If you have questions, I'll answer them-- Within certain limits, of course.” Grant had a look of disapproval, but his voice didn't waver as he spoke. You could hear a few “tsk”s and saw a few disapproving looks from around the vehicle, but nobody argued.

“Let's start with the basics, then.” Likax's voice almost echoed in the back of the truck, filling the room. “All you told us was that you wanted to help anthros 'achieve their destined superiority to humankind', whatever that means. What, exactly, do you do?”

“A lot of things,” Grant responded evasively as he kept tapping at his tablet. Likax raised an eyebrow at it, but Grant sighed and shook his head. “In general, we watch the important targets on both sides and gather information about them. See if there's anybody who would help to support anthros in society. Try to put anthro-supporters in a good place, and discredit detractors.”

“That hardly scratches the surface of it.” Likax was almost staring at Grant now, his ears perked and his body a little tense. “If you were only a political group, there'd be no point in hiding everything like this, and no reason to be handing out weapons to everybody.”

Grant quietly evaluated Likax's statement before speaking again. “Our means can be... Less than pleasant. We have... a number of eyes out and about, and we deal with more than just public figures. We try to figure out who's important, what inventions and developments might assist anthros more, which humans are willing to help and which influential ones need... persuasion. Weapons are for when we need to protect important targets, or watch potential threats. We try to avoid violence when possible. Much more difficult to try to conceal, and the Comradity is better-equipped for it... But I won't deny that it occurs on our part, too.” Even as he spoke, Grant's eyes never moved from off of the tablet in his hands, too busy with work to take his attention off of it.

You shivered at the thought, a bit of concern entering your mind as you hear it. Likax's arm moved around, reflexively pulling you a little closer. You only gave him a small nod as you look back at Likax, holding his arm firmly. "It's alright." You mumble out your words, doing your best to convince yourself as well as Likax. You were a little worried, but it wasn't anything beyond what you had been expecting back when you agreed to try to meet Mujexa.

“Fine.” Likax's voice was a little gruff as he spoke, but he seemed to accept the answer. “Next question, then. Why is Mujexa so interested in me, and why are you guys so interested in me? I've never been anybody important enough for this much trouble. ”

“Because you're still alive somehow.” Both you and Likax look at each other in confusion, but Grant nods his head a little. “You know the experiment you were in? We found out about that a while ago, and Mujexa's been paying attention to what details he could gather while he was stuck in prison.”

Likax's body shook at the mention of it. You could feel his grip around you tightening, even pulling your body in against his as he tried to comfort himself. “Easy...” Your hand brushes gently over his arm, feeling it tense and press against you. You could tell that Likax had grown more since the last time you checked, and it was all you could do to try to hold him and comfort him. His breathing was still a little strained, but it looked as though he was in better condition when his head looked down at you. You managed a small smile back at him, pulling his arm a little closer and almost hugging it. As you keep holding him in as tight as you can manage, you look back towards Grant and nod. “Go ahead.”

“That experiment, to turn anthros into humans?” Both you and Likax hesitated, but you both nodded in response. Grant raised his eyes for a moment to see the two of you, before turning them down again and speaking as he worked. “So far, every anthro who's been experimented on has ended up dead. Some were half-mutilated by the time they died, some died before the first changes started to show on their bodies... Even the ones that were pulled out of the program after the first few sessions fell ill shortly after. By all of our accounts, you should've died late yesterday. We heard that you had been found in bad condition, but somehow, you're still here with us today.”

The two of you look at each other nervously, and you only give a small nod to Likax, confirming what you remember. It was impossible for you to forget how Likax looked when his heart had stopped, back when Javier had proclaimed him dead. You're not sure if Likax knows what happened back then, but you could feel your heart pounding as you thought back on it.

“As far as we know, you're the first one to still be up and moving after their experiments.” You're not sure how long you've been quiet, but Grant's voice interrupts your thoughts. “The growth might've been an unintended side effect. We don't know. What we do know is that for some reason, you went through whatever they're subjecting to anthros to, and though you should be dead by now, you're still a healthy anthro... As far as we can tell, anyways. We want to know why, and we want to make sure that the people in charge of the experiment don't find out about you. But I can't speak for Mujexa, so I can't say if he has any other plans in mind besides just watching over you.”

“I... I see.” Likax's voice was quiet, and you could tell that he was a little perturbed by what Grant had said. However, you couldn't see any way of discussing it with him without drawing too much unwanted attention to the two of you. You just held tight to Likax's body, your mouth dry and your heart still beating firmly as you just look back at Likax, your grip as tight as you can manage against his fuzzy arm.

You felt a few bumps before your body shifts, pressing firmly against Likax's side. You shuffle a little awkwardly as you glance up at him before turning towards Grant. “Did we arrive already? I thought we had more time...”

Grant gives a small nod to the others as they get up and begin to open up the rear of the vehicle. You squint your eyes, expecting to have sunlight shining in and blinding you. But instead, you notice...
1221321222221112222222121211212111.title: Why

choices: There's only one thing you want to do with your bobcat, and it involves that bed
It might be good to review what's happened so far, and start to plan ahead
12213212222211122222221212112121111.content:
The truck you were in seemed to have parked in a room, if it could even be called that. The ceiling stretched high above, at least sixty feet in the air, and the wall opposite yours had to be at least two football fields away from where you were. The walls appeared to be made of rock, jagged and dark, like the space you were in had been blasted from inside a mountain or something. Several desks and planters were spread throughout the open floor, and doors and windows lined the walls, as if someone had tried to model this place off of some sort of office building.

"Welcome to the Comradity's Atlanta Base," Grant said as he got to his feet.

Leaning over towards you and looking out the back of the truck, Likax whistled a little. "This place looks huge! I had no idea the Comradity had anywhere near enough power or resources to have a base like this."

Nodding, you grabbed Likax's paw, or more like his finger, and gave it a squeeze. "I know. I'm not sure if it's a good thing or a bad thing, but it looks like they at least might have the means to help us. Just… be careful. Watch your back."

Smiling softly, Likax placed his paw on your shoulder, covering nearly your entire torso, and patted it gently. "I think you might want me to watch yours."

Chuckling, you rubbed the side of your face against the side of his wrist. "Hey, I'm the one with the gun, remember?"

"Don't worry," Likax replied, smirking. "I pack a little heat of my own."

The other men of the Cabal slowly filed out of the truck, followed by Grant, you, and Likax. The bobcat had much more of a struggle exiting the truck than he had getting in, and by the time he stepped out and stood up to his full height, the top of your head barely came up to his knees. He had grown well past fifteen feet and had to be pushing twenty. Gulping, you can't help but stare in awe at his imposing form, his slim but powerful figure, and, between his legs, the impressive--

"Fischer! Rufallo! This way!" Grant barked out orders, motioning with his hand to follow him. Turning away from Likax, you jogged and caught up with the group, while Likax was able to move much more casually with his significantly longer legs.

The bunker you found yourself in seemed surprisingly busy, with dozens if not hundreds walking, and sometimes running, from one end to the other. It didn't take too long to realize that all of them were anthros. Some appeared to be much like the prison-tough types you imagined Likax was familiar with, while others looked more like regular office workers. You noticed, with some dismay, that most of them wore some sort of firearm, ranging from small pistols strapped to their belts to large-barreled rifles slung around their backs.

As you walked through the room towards the far end, most of the anthros didn't seem to pay any attention to your group. A few, however, seemed to narrow their eyes as they looked at your group, growling slightly. Many who did look your way, though, seemed to back off when they saw the towering nude bobcat that followed at the rear of your group, and turned and walked away rather quickly. One large, muscular wolf pulled out his pistol as you passed, holding it to his side while glancing between you and Likax with his teeth bared, as if to say, "Don't try anything."

"Ignore them," Grant leaned over and said to you, low enough for the others not to hear. "Many of the Comradity's members have been mistreated by humans for so long that they instinctively distrust any humans, even those allied with them." Out of the corner of your eye, you noticed Grant grimacing slightly, as if recalling some painful memory. "It's… part of what we as a group are striving to overcome."

You nodded in agreement. "I understand. I-- I know all too well how cruel some humans can be." Looking into Grant's eyes for a moment, you begin to reassess your opinion of him. Behind the tough, grizzled demeanor, he seemed to be hiding some inner turmoil, something that had happened to way in the past. You decided that it might be worth your while to have a one-on-one talk with him at some point; he might have more in common with you than you presumed.

"It's okay, though," Grant continued, "while Mujexa doesn't exactly have a whole hell of a lot of respect for humans, he at least respects the history between our organizations. He'd flay alive any Comradite who so much as lays a finger on us."

"Sounds like a charming individual," you muttered. With every detail that you learned about this Mujexa, he seemed less and less like someone you would want to meet. You hoped that your stay with the Comradity would end up being a short one, as unlikely as that sounded.

Your group arrived at the far wall and stopped, right in front of a large steel door nearly reaching the bunker ceiling. Two armed guards stood on either side of the door, one a lion nearly seven feet tall, the other a smaller (but no less equally menacing) alligator. Both wore heavy-looking body armor and helmets, and carried two very powerful-looking rifles.

"Okay, Likax," Grant said, motioning towards the crocodile, who nodded and turned to open a panel on the wall, causing the door to start sliding open. "This will be your room during your stay."

Likax glanced back and forth between the door, the guards, and Grant, gritting his teeth and clenching his fists. "Why all the security? Am I being held prisoner… again?"

Closing his eyes, Grant started to rub his temples with his fingers. "No, Likax. You're free to go anywhere within the bunker. Not that there's that much you'd be able to see besides what you've already seen. There's only three or four rooms in the base you'll be able to fit in now, you know. This room is just the one we've prepared for you to sleep in."

Crossing his arms, Likax continued to frown. "What about Mujexa? When do I see him?"

"Not for a few hours." Likax didn't seem to like that answer, starting to growl. "Hey, don't blame me!" Grant threw up his arms, exasperated. "He's a night fellow, and sleeps during the day. It's just past oh-nine-hundred, so he probably will have gone to bed about an hour ago or so. And, believe me, neither I nor anyone else in this base has the power to wake him."

The bobcat started to tap his footpaw impatiently. Standing next to him, you placed your hand on the side of his knee, causing him to look down at you. "Likax, neither of us got very much sleep last night. I think it might be a good idea to relax for the day until Mujexa's awake and ready to see us."

After a moment, Likax nodded. "Yeah, you're right."

"Good, I'm glad the two of you understand." Grant said, turning and walking into the room, and the two of you followed. The room seemed large but rather empty, about a third the size of the main chamber that you had just come from. The walls appeared to be stone but much smoother-cut, with some odd-looking stains and burn-marks visible every so often. "This used to be a laboratory," Grant explained, "until Mujexa decided that the Comradity's experiments needed to be completed… elsewhere."

Only a few pieces of what you could call furniture appeared throughout the room: the most prominent of which was a huge bed against the far left wall, the mattress almost fifteen feet off the ground, thirty feet wide, and fifty feet long. "As I mentioned earlier," Grant continued, "we didn't know quite how quickly we would find Likax, so we prepared for him to be a little larger than he is now. Of course," he said with a wry chuckle, "you might end up growing in to it, right?"

Rolling your eyes, you continued to look around at the rest of the room. A table and single chair, both to scale with the bed, sat pushed up against the back wall, and on the far right side you saw what looked like a crude sink and faucet. "This… actually doesn't look too bad, Likax," you said, smiling up to him. "Kind of like your own little apartment."

Likax seemed to soften his demeanor a bit and nodded slowly. "Well, it's certainly better than prison."

"Thanks for the compliment, I guess," Grant snorted. "As for now, I have to go debrief one of Mujexa's aides on just how our operation went." Glancing at you, Grant sighed. "I hope, for your sake, Carson, that they don't have a problem with my… improvisation. You two can stay here. I'll try checking back with you in a few hours."

"Thanks, Grant," you said as he turned and began to leave. "And, good luck, I guess."

Grant stopped for just a moment, and you could swear you saw what looked like a smile forming on his face. Shaking it off, though, he continued out of the room, the rest of the Cabal behind him. A few moments later, the steel door started to slide shut.

"Well, I suppose things could be worse," Likax said as he kneeled down next to you so he could look you face-to-face a bit better. "Still, I'm not entirely thrilled about having that big steel door there that they could lock at any time."

"I know, Likax," you said. "But for now, we just need to trust that they mean what they say. It's all we really can do. And… at least we're still together."

Likax's eyes softened. "Yes, we do. And I'm truly grateful for that, Carson."

The two of you stared into each other's eyes for a moment, not wanting to do anything to ruin this moment. Finally, Likax stood back up to his full height and took a deep breath. "So, what do you want to do now?"
12213212222211122222221212112121111.title: Arrival

choices: "Checkup. We have the equipment to start checking out what happened to you."
"We need Carson for something. Part of his duties for the Cabal."
122132122222111222222212121121211111.content:
"You know..." You smile up at to him, taking ahold of one massive paw in both hands. "This is the first time we've been alone ever since we woke up..."

"Yeah..." He takes a moment before something clicks, his cheeks suddenly reddening. "Um... We should take it easy, right? I mean, there's a lot of stuff to get used to. The organization... The new room... And..."

"And your new size," You say, reaching a hand out to try to hold onto his paw. He tenses before bending down completely wrapping your hand in his grip, squeezing it firmly.

"Yeah... I know I've been growing ever since this whole thing started, but now..." He swallows, his tail slumping a little against the ground as he looks to you. "If this keeps up, it's only a matter of time before I end up a literal giant..."

You step closer, your forehead touching his chest. "Hey... I'm never going to say no to having more of you around. It just means there's more of you to love, right?"

You could swear you felt his heart skip a beat. He pulls back with a hesitant expression, almost flabbergasted as he looks at you. "Carson... You... You mean it? You love me?"

It takes you a moment before you realize what you just said. The words just slipped out of your mouth, but you know you meant them. Your cheeks began to burn as you awkwardly fumble for a few words, Likax pulls his paw away as he watches, the hesitation in eyes turning more and more into worry as each second passes by. You force yourself to look up into his eyes, the two of you both shaking from your nerves (him more than you). You swallow as you try to brace yourself, before you nod.

"Well... Grant already noticed something between us, right? And even Javier said something before. There's no denying it now... And I'd probably regret it if I didn't tell you while I still have the chance. Yeah... I love yoooouwoah!"

Your words are interrupted by Likax sweeping you right off your feet, into what must've been the biggest hug in history. You feel two arms completely wrapping around your back, pressing your body in tight against his fur. Your breath is squeezed right out of you as he holds you in tight, before shifting you up enough to press his mouth to yours.

His kiss firmly pushes in, shifting between your lips effortlessly. You barely have time to begin returning it before it breaks, leaving the two of you staring right at each other. Your pulse is racing, and as he starts to lean back, the two of you tumble onto the bed. The bobcat falls onto his back, smiling widely as he holds you up in a couple of paws.

"Carson... You don't know how much I wanted to hear that... I just..." He shakes his head a little, holding you tight. "This is real, isn't it? You're really... I'm really..."

"Yeah... It is." You reach forwards and press a hand to his cheek, holding him close.

"Carson... I love you, too."

You're pulled close, your body relaxing in his grip. You move enough to shift upwards on him before letting your lips meet his again, resuming your earlier kiss. The two of you hold against each other, letting the feeling of it linger as you embrace. You're not sure how long it goes on, but the minutes fly right by as you hold each other, kiss each other with the passion you've been reserving for days.

For all you know, minutes or hours go by. All you know and care about is the fact that now, the two of you are together, doing more than you ever considered doing since so long ago. And through it all, your feelings for the cat... for your cat... are only growing stronger. Every time you press your fingers through his fur, you're brought deeper and deeper into a passionate fervor. And from the way he presses his paws against you, from the way his whiskers brush over you, you know he feels the same way about you.

"Hey... Carson?" His voice finally speaks out, breaking the silence the two of you shared.

"Yeah, Likax?"

"I... I guess you like how I look, right?" The slightest blush tinges his cheeks, but he still looks at you with a relaxed smile.

"Y-yeah..." You blush deep as you stare over him, your eyes passing over his bare body. His new size only gave you a better look at him, and your eyes still enjoyed every inch they saw.

"Well," He quietly growls, a paw nudging at you, "I think I deserve a full look at you, too." He lightly bats at you, the gesture making you shift a little on him.

"W-wha?" You swallow and stare at him, not quite sure what to respond.

"C'mon... Pleaaaaaase?" He pouts, the slightest shift in his lips as he does. You can only take it for a few moments before you give him, tugging at the bottom of your shirt.

"Fine, fine... But I'm not much to look at. After all, I'm-"

"You're wonderful, Carson." The moment your shirt's off, you feel a paw pressed directly to you. Likax slips his grip over you so gently, a shiver of delight passing through your body the moment you feel it. You almost freeze, but you can only smile when you see Likax beaming back at you. "Go on, Carson... I want to see all of you."

Your mind starts to fill with images of what it might lead. You holding close to Likax, pressing up to him, maybe even seeing what the catch's like when he gets a little eager... You mumble a little to yourself as you wiggle in his gentle grip. Your hands fumble down to your pants next, tugging a little and letting them slip down. They're at your ankles...

When a booming voice echoes through the room.

"Carson. Likax. Need your attention."

The sound of Grant's voice interrupts the two of you, bringing the moment to a grinding halt. You hear the bobcat growl in irritation, and you shout back into the air, "What, Grant? I thought we were supposed to have some privacy here! I thought you didn't need us for hours!"

"Mujexa's still resting, but things have changed. We need your attention now," Grant says, his irritation starting to show. "Oh, and in case it wasn't clear enough, let me remind you of something. It's important that we keep an eye on Likax. That includes at least putting a few cameras in his room. So I wouldn't do anything you don't want us to see."

If he had killed the moment before, that was just burning the body.

You're not sure if you want to blush, shout, or just try to hide somewhere in all of Likax's fur now. You only manage to stammer out a little, as Likax replies with an irritated tone, "What do you want, Grant?"

There's silence for a moment before he responds...

This story is a tribute to one of my favorites here that I believe was taken off writing.com. If not excuse me for writing this but I have not been able to find it. I don’t know the name but I do know the story.



It was a cold winter’s night in Canada; you weren’t sure what city the resort you were staying in was a part of. Tomorrow is your parent’s anniversary and they were down in town enjoying themselves at a party for the night. You live with your older brother while going to college, this semester you’d taken off for the winter vacation. He is a hard worker at a good paying job. You got loan money when extra came in as well as getting small bits here and there from favors and short jobs.

You didn’t want to go to the party and stayed at the resort cabin, a nice two floor building fit for a group of people; although it was only you two. There was no reason for you not to go. No ill blood between you and your parents besides general family problems. You just didn’t feel like going and thought that since you’d see them the rest of your time here there was no reason to go.

The TV was off, not like you watched it very much. You preferred to read, which you were now, in front of a nice warm fire. A blizzard fell heavily outside making the windows rattle loudly. It knocked at your attention, especially when the wind blew hard making them rattle louder. The last time they did you snapped your book shut and grieved out a sigh as you slid up from the quarter circular couch. You went to the back into the kitchen where you left the pot on for boiling water. You made yourself some hot chocolate and sat back down to try and read again.

You got through 27 pages of the book when you heard another loud rattle on the window. It hadn’t done so that loudly in a while which made you look up to it shaking. And when you went to look at them and see if the latch was coming off the wind died down, and a quiet tap came from the front door. You thought it was your brother and stated, “Did you lose the key?”

There was no answer. And after a long pause of confusing silence another low tap on the door, with long pauses between each until it ended at a fourth tap. You were a bit worried, thankfully it was a lodge so the area had patrollers to deal with trouble. Maybe it was your parents and they didn’t hear you. Either way you walked towards the door and opened it.

Outside it was pouring snow, freezing too, your eyesight was filled with white and yellow coming from the street light and the end of the path yet no one there. You were about to close the door until you noticed through the thick white a red trail followed by fresh tracks in the snow leading up to the door. You gasped as you looked down to the source.

Someone had collapsed on the porch and was bleeding terribly. It was a person in shape but, it was also animal. It was a large white animal in the shape of a person. You almost mistook it for just an animal if it weren’t for how large it was. You almost left it there until you looked down to its wounds. They were round, definitely gunshot wounds. You didn’t just want to leave it there, so you carefully tried to lift it into your home. But it was very heavy so you had to lift it by it’s head then feet before managing to get it inside.

You realized that the loud rattling from earlier was probably the gunshots. Which was why the window didn’t move, so after you got the creature inside you stepped out. You examined the prints and the red in the snow. The prints were already covered up, but the red trail leading into the woods was still noticeable but short. You quickly cover them in more snow then ran back inside, closing and locking the door. “The blizzard should get rid of those tracks quickly. Phew…” you slid down from the door as your back was against it.

The you looked down and stood back up, examining the creature you left inside. It was unconscious and probably collapsed after knocking on your door. You slid it to your couch and managed to lift it up onto your couch after getting a towel to put under it. Then you ran upstairs and got a med kit, it was heavy duty in case of extreme emergency like the phones being down or the snow being too high. Looking at it closer, it was definitely male; and it looked like a snow fox.

There were three gunshot wounds in all; two on his back and one in the back of his leg. Only one still had a bullet left in it, the others must have dropped out, thankfully they weren’t that deep. And none had punctured an organ. If they had he would need surgery that you couldn’t provide. “This is going to hurt a lot, sorry. But bare with me. And stay alive.” You removed the bullet and cleaned the wounds making him quietly yowl even while unconscious. After cleaning them you padded them with cotton and then dressed them. The leg shot was very close to the bone, even if it hadn’t though he’d still have trouble walking.

You turned him over with as much care as you could. You were a bit afraid before and your heart was racing. But you thought for a while as you treated him. He wasn’t a scary creature coming to kill you. He had managed to clamber up to your doorstep. And with the last of his strength, knock. There was a human side to him, maybe not all, but some.

You took a good look at him now in the light to see how he looked. His face was just like a snow foxes, with long hair around his fluffy ears trailing down to his bushy tail. You carefully opened one eye, it was twitching wildly so he was definitely sleeping. And probably having a very bad nightmare you wish you could comfort him from. He had bright turquoise eyes. You shut his eye and looked at his hands, they were just like human hands except with black pads. Then you looked at his legs, they were just like foxes legs except larger and with more muscle. His body wasn’t muscular; in fact you could feel his bone through his fur. Wherever he was he wasn’t fed well.

“Who would create something like this? It’s like some science fiction clichÃ©.” You felt his fur; he cringed at your touch and whined in his sleep. You always wanted some strange thing to happen in your life. This was a good amount of strangeness at that. You just hoped that when he woke up it would still be to your liking…no…no matter the state he’s in, violent or otherwise, you’d still care for him. You did let him in.

1232.content:
It was a cold Friday night in autumn, you forgot the day but it was the first week of October. Right now all your attention was drawn to a single person. You passed him by in an alley where he smoked a cigarette bright enough to illuminate his face. You could smell the fact that it wasn't tobacco. The night air was damp but his visage made the oxygen a drought. Which is why you found yourself in this disgusting and horrifying place. Watching him from a lone seat near the door.

He stepped lightly down the walkway, the smoke from the many lit cigarettes creating a sort ethereal fog around him. The crowed was in awe. Even members who had seen him before were still enthralled. Maybe even those who lay with him. He was truly a sight to see. His body was athletic and well fed, his work gave him just as much, but it also curved and swayed with the femininity of a great dancer. His dark, charcoal fur, was just close to black enough to see his fully black tribal tattoos plastered on his skin. His tail, hands, and bare feet were much darker of black. But the two things that drew in the night of his body was his bright pinkish red hair and bright yellow eyes. Besides his features were his clothes; gold hoop earrings, dark red pants, fishnet gloves that were finger-less and reaching up his arms with many holes and tears.

You were not drawn by the show or the ideals of sleeping with the attraction. You have never thought that way before. At least not to the point to bring yourself to a place of sweat and desperation. What had really brought you was his large collar that didn't touch his neck and reached out to the edge of his shoulders, for good reason. The front and back had plates with his stage name on the front carved in black reading 'Scarlet', the back having the word 'Slut'. But the part that had caught your attention, what shined in the gleam of his cigarette, was a bell attached to the end. It shined brighter then anything else he wore, the studs and earrings could not compare. Not even the silver stud on his open tongue.

You were drawn by this bell because you were the one who gave it to him, four years ago at Croncite Orphanage. His name is not Scarlet, it's Ferion, Ferion Vermilion. You and he had grown up in the same orphanage till you both turned eighteen. You went on to be a musician; you could play the: cello, piano, a little bit of the flute, but you specialized in the violin. You were sometimes called to auditoriums to play in orchestras for your skill. Even being invited to Venice to watch a concert, a place you only dreamed of going and now wish to live in. You also taught children to play instruments in personal lessons. You were also offered a job as a music teacher, but turned it down due to the amount of time it would have taken from you. And when extra money was needed, you'd take a part-time job.

Tonight was the night of a concert in the city's main hall. But it ended too late for you to catch a bus back, which lead to you walking back to your home. Thankfully the new furry police kept the streets incredibly safe; morning, noon, and night. So you felt safe to carry your violin back with you. That's when you saw him and that's why you're here. Among the smoke, the drunkenness, the screams of pain and ecstasy, and many of the things you ignored. The only attention you gave was to the dim stage that began to glow from dark blue spotlights.

What you were waiting for was one sign that it was definitely him. And as he walked down the runway a third sign came to your ears. 'Oh my darling I love you...and the kid who just stands tonight...' The opening words of the ending theme of a favorite show you both watched, 'Sorcerer Hunters'. It echoed into the chorus and his show began. He divided his steps into the song. Wording out the song as his body snapped and thrust into many positions with the sounds. Even tying in the runway pole with his motions. He must have practiced for a long time, on a dancing point of view he was flawless. And you knew this well from the many shows you were invited to.

And as you watched, what you had been waiting to see came into play with the dance. His baggy jeans tightened as the collar inched over his shoulders. His body thickened as it climbed up the pole's length. Bringing more awe to the crowed, some writhing in painful enjoyment as their pants grew tighter then there could stand and their mouths drooling seventy percent alcohol. But you only watched on, clutching at your shirt and holding back your emotions.

As the song came to it's close you saw him twist around the pole, his height about a third up it's twenty-five foot length. That's when you saw in full what you'd come to see, what proved it was him. And the same reason police laws could be easier enforced. Ferion suddenly shot up in size with a heaving breath. His earrings were now only the size of regular rings to him. His collar fit to his neck. And his baggy pants were ripped to tatters that fell to the floor leaving only a new pair of ripped shorts holding back a bulge that could have easily torn through them given the strength. It disgusted you even more, but it was the final shred of proof that he was Ferion.

Because one thing that made it certain, his contacts fell off when he grew revealing their original blue color that you knew very well. Then he took a pose around the pole and asked in a booming voice, "Alright My Little Chiketties. Who's Brave Enough To Ride The Big Kitty Tonight? I Bite, A Lot..." His voice was a giant tease, with all the sarcasm of an old actress hardened by the stage.

Before the crowed of nervous and drunken people could make up their minds, you had already rose from your seat with your hand in the air, "I will."

Everyone looked back to you and Ferion spoke again, "Ooouuhhh, A New Toy For Scarlet. I Like New Toys...Meet Me In Room 302 In Back...Don't Keep Me Waiting..." he exited through the large curtains as his tail flicked and fluttered. And when he left you picked up your carrying case and leaving as well. You'd gotten the perfect chance to meet him despite the circumstances...

...

It was sad that even with the new laws that were possible to be enforced, prostitution was not against them. Unless it was not what they called 'licensed'. The qualifications of which made as much sense as encroaching death being the same as living a normal life with an incurable disease. It was alright because there was nothing to be done about it. And with the inclusion of human and anthro size-changers like him, the palette of possibilities were only growing.

Those were your thoughts as you found yourself at the door of room 302 of the apartment complex behind the club you left, and never wanted to return. You knocked on the door and a habitual, "come in," called to you. A song was playing inside, you didn't recognize it. 'I'm not a princess (a lot of anger in it)'. He was wording out the song as well while snorting a new so-called 'safe drug', the law was not without it's limits. Especially when said law does not enforce to not do wrong on some accounts. He turned back smiling with slanted eyes, "a little something to keep the fun going. Speaking of which, since you're new and a cute newby at that, you get a discount."

"..."

"And unlike most of the lazy bitches here, I can go all night. Now tell me, what do you want to do tonight? I do a lot of fetishes; and you look more like the foot type. I like that type most, an old friend used to give me rubs all the time and it felt so fucking good. But I don't do extreme role playing shit, I hated Lord of The Rings," he was mentioning many things you already knew. Which made you clutch your violin case, then you shook off and closed the door. He had made his way into his bed against the poster covered wall.

You grabbed the chair in front of the desk he sat in before, "may I sit here?"

"Ouh, a gentlemen...I don't get a lot of those. Do whatever the fuck you want as long as you can pay for it," he kept up a sarcastic front. Behind it you could see what little care he actually had, what little was there was amplified by the powdered happiness. You sat in front of the bed. "So what will it be, shy little guy?"

You gathered the courage as you looked down to your hands, "...Ferion..."

"...and you know my name too, now it'll cost you a third of the usual...hell we can have all weekend if you want now..." he was now lying on his chest with his legs in the air. His head stood on one arm, and his eyes still narrow with little more care then before along with his black ears.

He was just older in features. His hair was neon red instead of black, he never had tattoos, and he wore gold contacts. You could even tell his species which no one could, being that his real parents were both a cat and dog anthro. Making him end up with cats eyes and mostly tail except the silky end, and dog like muzzle. After looking him over you picked up your violin case and opened it.

His face became perplexed as you spoke, "...four years, and you still look the same...we'd both were running late to the train...you were later then me and I was stepping on as it was about to go. That's when you came running, growing too so you could move faster...and you gave me this..." you showed him the violin. You're name in gold letters inside the frame. "Just like the inside of your bell that I gave you before the train left station..." Then you played a song, a song only for him. That you knew he could not forget with as many times as you played it. And tears welled in his eyes.

12323.content:
"Meet me on the roof." Ferion did his best not to show a trace of emotion as he spoke, and his voice seemed steady. However, you could see the uncertainty reflected in his twinkling eyes. He looked at you for a moment, before breaking away, his body moving in a quick stride as he moved through the doorway. Even as you watched him go, he didn't seem to be rushed. His walk was the same steady, practiced shifting he always seemed to use, and his posture maintained the same grace he always had.

You quietly packed your violin back in its case, before standing up slowly. Whatever you were expecting, it certainly hadn't been this. You weren't even sure if Ferion was acknowledging you or not. However, there really wasn't any choice for you to make. You had to follow him, and to talk to him. Now that you had confirmed it was really him, there was no way you could simply leave.

You moved back through the building, his tail catching your eyes as he waited near the top of the stairwell. He pushed the door open when he noticed you, quietly slipping through it. It was a bit of a climb for you, with one hand carefully holding onto the case. You were a little out-of-breath when you reached the top, before pushing the door open.

A small gust of wind brushed over your body when you made it outside. You took a quick glance around, only to see other, taller buildings surrounding the area. It felt a little crowded, and you tried to glance around the area, looking for where he might've gone. You couldn't see his figure anywhere, and he was certainly capable of making himself known if he wanted to. However, you did notice a rather small room, so you walked towards it quietly, opening the door and peeking inside.

Ferion was waiting for you there. He sat on a small bed quietly, his head turning to the door as you entered. It looked like he had put a little bit more clothing on while he was waiting, but it was all loose on him. His shirt was baggy, though it barely covered his stomach, and his legs were still clearly exposed. You could only look for a moment before turning away, trying not to stare too long. You were a little surprised as you looked around the room. Compared to where you had been, the place was rather sparse. It didn't have the same dim lights, the gaudy decorations, the music in the background...

"This is my real room. For when I don't need to put up with some random, desperate guy." You heard his voice, but kept yourself from looking right at him. Instead, your eyes seem to bounce around the sides of the small space. The walls were pained a faded shade of red, and had a couple of photographs around. There were a couple of chairs, and on his desk was a small TV, and...

Your heart seemed to pause when you saw it. It was an old photograph of the orphanage, and of you two. You had gotten it taken when you were both going to leave together. You couldn't really say anything, and only took a minute to get a good look. Ferion followed your gaze to it, and let you look for a while, but his voice eventually broke the silence.

"I was wondering when I'd see you again..." You felt him take your arm and pull you in against him, hugging you tight. You had to give a small grunt as you felt him, his fur brushing up before sliding you sideways, sitting you next to him. He had a wide grin on his face as he spoke, staring at you. "It's really been... four years? Hard to keep track..." He simply held your hand firmly, and while your mouth was a little dry, you did your best to speak.

"Longer than I would've liked..."

He shook his head as he stared at you. "Better late than never." You felt his hand shift gently over your leg, leaning in closer as he held tight to you. "I was surprised to see you, though... Never thought you'd ever end up coming to a place like this..."

You shook your head quietly. "I wouldn't. Just... You're an exception. I thought I saw you, so... I wanted... I had to make sure."

"Did you enjoy the show?" He asked with a mischievous voice, his tail flickering over your lap.

"Hard not to. You always were a good dancer, and you were good at... expressing yourself." You tried to dig around for the right words, but he didn't seem satisfied. You could feel his hand reaching around, slipping a little under your shirt. You held his arm in place, your voice still steady as he moved. "I... can see why people would be interested in a night with you."

You heard a quiet chuckle, before his tongue lightly flicked up your neck. "Oh? So..." His voice made you pause, the sound of it somewhere between a growl and a purr. "Are you interested?" You had to swallow as you felt him eyeing you up quietly. His tail seemed to slip against you, and his leg slid along yours. You tried to back away a little, hesitant on what he was doing, before he suddenly just burst into laughter. He held onto your shoulder with both of his hands, pressing you down onto the bed as he held tight.

"F-ferion! What's the big idea?" You couldn't help but stutter it out as he shook his head, trying to steady himself as he quieted down. He wiped his eyes a bit, before sitting up and grinning.

"Oh, man... Still the same... I can't believe you're still like that!" He grinned as he looked at you, his tone finally settling back on the cheerful one he always seemed to have in the past. Even in the roughest times, he had managed to keep a smile on his face, and it was the first time that you had seen a genuine one tonight.

"I can't believe this! You were acting that entire time?" You tried to keep your composure, but he kept laughing as he tried to look back at you.

"Maaaaaybe. Maybe not." His laughter finally quieted down as his hands slid down, settling on the side of the bed. "I really am glad to see you again, and I have to admit, I'm interested in what you think about me." He shifted his hand onto the back of yours, giving a light squeeze. "But if it really was you, there wasn't going to be any way you'd let me do that without dinner and a movie first, right?"

"Y-you!" You firmly pulled his head in, wrapping your arm around and just running your fingertips through his fur. He kept laughing as you tried to hold him, just letting you dig for a moment before you felt his head drag your arm down, his whole body swelling up for a moment as he shifted into you.

When you finally let go, he sat back down, though he didn't bother to shrink again. He did his best to keep looking at your face as he spoke, though now you were firmly seated on his lap. "I really am glad to see you, though. I've only heard bits and pieces, but it sounds like you're doing well. I'm... glad you got to put my gift to good use."

"I... didn't think you'd end up using my gift in something like this, though..." You reached up, giving the bell a small jingle. His whiskers seemed to droop as he heard you speak, but he quickly responded.

"I didn't plan on this, either. It only happened when I caught some guy's eye... One thing lead to another, and..." He swallowed and shook his head. "Look, I know it's not the best thing. But I am happy here." His voice almost had a pleading quality to it, and he hugged you tight against his stomach as he spoke.

"You... You like this job?" Your tone was incredulous, but he seemed to give a nod.

"Not all of it, I'll admit. There are some people I'd rather not meet. But... But I enjoy doing a lot of this." He picked you up easily, holding you gently against his body. "I like being able to do something like this... To have this kind of freedom with my size and my body..." He shifted you slowly, turning you to look you straight in the eyes. "I like being able to show off my skills a bit..." His tail gave a small flick as he turned, your eyes unable to help staring as he gave a bit of a pose, his once-baggy clothing tight against him and exposing most of him to you. "And I like knowing that people..." He growled playfully, one of his hands brushing over the front of his crotch. "Enjoy this..." He slowly let you down, his voice a little concerned as he spoke. "I didn't have too many options after we left, but... I'm content with things. It may not be what I planned on, but I like being able to do this..."

His voice seemed to fade a little. He certainly seemed confident on stage, and while he was alone with you, he didn't really seem to be acting. He genuinely felt comfortable with his life right now, but you couldn't help the part of your mind that seemed to be nagging you. You closed your eyes and gave a quiet sigh as you tried to think of what you'd say.
