1411.content:
Waves roar and gnash against the weathered cliff-side miles below your feet. You see colored lights in the distance; stark reds, blues, and yellows that proclaim dominance over the quiet star-light above. Such a sight, the Boardwalk nightlife. A soft sigh looses your lips and your eyes peer over the edge of the cliff.

You ponder the fall. Smashing into the torrents, getting sucked beneath the undertow. Torn asunder and dashed against rocks. Not the "easy way" out you once deluded your mind into accepting.

Gravel crunches and scuffs behind you, pulling you from your thoughts.

Your new visitor shuffles past you with his eyes pressed forward, never blinking. You're first caught off guard by a most distinguishing feature: his physical resemblance to a Siberian Husky dog. The initial shock wears off when you realize what he's planning. He pauses for a moment, then moves closer to the edge. He peeks over, then steps back.

"Having a bad day, stranger?" You say.

The Husky goes rigid.

"Jesus H-" He bit his tongue. "I, uh, didn't see you there."

"I suppose it isn't my business to pry, but it's hard not to notice the way you're looking at that drop." You say.

He says nothing and just pants in an attempt to catch his breath. A small bit of furred flesh protrudes beneath his ill-fitting green polo shirt with each movement of his diaphragm. One lazy bit of double chin oozes over the highest button by his collar. A patch that reads "Sturges Pastry Shop" is skewed atop a generous deposit of adipose on his chest.

"I'm not here for a lecture." He says between defeated breaths.

"Nor am I."

"Good, I'll just be on my way." He steps back to the edge.

"Tell me, first."

"What?"

"Tell me why."

There is only the sound of crashing waves in the distance. He steps away from the edge, plants his hands on his hips, and bends over at the waist. Pearls of sweat dribble down his cheeks. He wheezes a little and looks over to you.

"Just look at me. I can't even keep up a damned jogging pace anymore without falling apart." He said. "I wasn't-" he paused to breath, "wasn't always like this, you know."

You put your arms behind your back and listen patiently.

"I never should have bought a box of Sturges pastries. I swear that's where it all went wrong." A low gurgle fills the air, the husky rubs his gut and sighs. "Oof, just thinking about them is enough to trigger it these days."

"Trigger what?"

"The hunger. It's something else. I feel like there's this little monster inside of me that's always wanting me to eat, and if I don't listen..."

His stomach growled louder, as if to emphasize the point.

"I see." You stroke your chin.

"I tried out Sturges last year, back when they first opened. God, it feels like so long ago now. The moment I took one bite of their cinnamon buns, nothing ever satisfied me quite the same again. I had to eat more, and when I ran out, I had to go get more. When I couldn't get more, I tried to eat to fill the hole those buns left in my stomach. Fifteen pounds later, and I knew something was up."

"So you tried to get off the sweets, but that didn't work out so well."

"Of course." He sighs. "The hunger became so demanding that I lost two jobs for eating on the clock, and a third for stealing burgers at a fast food joint. So I'm on my last leg, My body demands another cinnamon bun, but I need to save money for rent. I fought the urge the whole way to the shop, and I almost won too."

The husky anthro buries his face in his paws.

"The manager says to me 'there's my favorite customer, I have a batch of buns hot n' ready,' and I say not today because I got laid off at my other job so I need to save money on rent. Wouldn't you know it, out of the kindness of his heart, not only does he give me the buns for free, he hires me at the pastry shop right on the spot."

A bitter, humorless chuckle slips his lips.

"Today was my first day. They let me sneak a consistent supply of my favorites, so long as I didn't touch anything else. Closing time happens, I want to go home, when they tell me I can have the buns we didn't sell that day. All of 'em for free. I gorged like a pig. Just one straight hour of eating. I knew how wrong it was, but for the first time in a long time my body was happy."

He looks back up at you with his helpless, pleading eyes.

"I ran the moment I took back control. I lugged my fat, disgusting self as far away as possible. I don't know what they did to me, I don't even know if I can prove it, but if I hang around any longer I'm going to need a forklift just to get around. And the worst part? The only reason I hesitated was because I realized I would never taste another Sturge's Cinnamon Bun if I jumped."

In a surprising gesture, the husky throws his arms around you. You feel the entirety of his heft envelope you. Every supple, warm roll of pudge on his body presses against you. It's a strange feeling, like being hugged by a mattress.

"So I gotta jump, before I lose all control of myself. I wanna die on my own terms. I don't want to explode, or drown in my own fat..."

His words devolve into sporadic sobs. You pat his back, unsure where to go from here. Not exactly what you expected to find on the scenic route to the Boardwalk.

"I'm sure there's a way you can take control again." You say. "No need to throw yourself off a cliff to fix it."

"You think so?"

"I'm positive." You say. "Perhaps we should get you to a doctor?"

"They just tell me the same thing. Diet, exercise, that deal."

A thunderous rumble emanates from his stomach. The husky winces in pain and wraps his arms around his gut. He lets out one sorrowful whine.

"Ohh why won't it stop."

"Alright, let's get you something to eat first, then figure out what to do." You say. "Oh, jeez, where are my manners. My name's Calvin."

"Juneau, like the town." He gives you a slight nod.

"Right, uh, my car's this way."

You stumble down the hill with the hefty husky in tow. His pudgy body wobbles with each step along the way. Somehow you were going to help him, at least you hoped.




Choices
Bigger is Better!: Hit up a nearby burger joint and let Juneau indulge himself. Show him the upsides of his growing waist-line, starting with some prize money from a burger eating competition and eventually World's Largest Anthro gigs at Carnivals. Be wary, for what if Sturges secret ingredient has him grow more directions than wide and books the husky a tank in Seaworld? (Half-Ton Husky or Four Tons of Fun )

Beefy Beast: Raid a nearby supermarket of all its protein shakes and protein bars to sate his appetite. Convince him he's going to have to get used to his size, and beefing up a little will improve his chances of getting better. However, the new diet might have some interesting side-effects when mixed with Sturges' secret ingredient. (The Beast Within or Huskier Husky)
1411.title: One pastry too many.

choices: "I can't believe it. I feel full."
Juneau's body starts to shift right before your eyes.
14112.content:
You open the door for Juneau, the husky out of breath from the brief walk. He huffs and puffs as he sits into the passenger's side, hand pushed on his chest and bracing himself against the door. It stings a little to see him winded from that walk, his entire body jiggling and straining as he struggles to tug the seat belt around his mass.

Your old clunker starts up with a rumble, and you pull out, a smooth turn before you hit the road. Another rumble resounds from Juneau's gut, the bulge shifting with the sound. "Oooo... Starting to hit again," He murmurs, rubbing firm against himself. "I can't believe it's already back."

"We'll get some decent food in you, see if that'll help." You drive down the familiar roads, used to the familiar streets, turning down a corner as you make your way to the supermarket.

"But it won't be enough," He murmurs, rubbing his gut in an effort to calm it down. "No matter how much I ate, I wouldn't get full. There's no point when I won't be able to-"

"You said that you overate before, right? What'd you normally eat?"

The husky pauses before hanging his head, shame written across his face. "Sweets, soda, fast food... Anything I could get my hands on."

You give a little nod. "I figured. I know it's hard, but doctors suggest diet and exercise for a reason. We'll get some better food in you and see what we can do from there. It doesn't sound like you've been eating very well, so getting some better food will help a little. I take it you haven't tried working out, either?"

"I didn't know what kind of food to get. I couldn't cook while my stomach was demanding anything and everything," He mutters, still refusing to look at you. "And as for exercise... Well, just look at me," He mutters, hands grasping at his squishy chest. "I'm a mess. It's a struggle to move around! I can't work out like this! I can barely run a few feet!"

You and reach over, eyes still on the road while you push your hand to his arm, squeezing the soft flesh. "Hey, don't sell yourself short. Your endurance might need some work, but you're stronger than you think you are. You have to be to move all of that..." You pause for a moment, spotting him as he stares out the window, avoiding your gaze. "You have to be to walk at all. It might be covered up, but you've probably got a bit of muscle under it all."

"You think?" He doesn't turn back, but the edge of a smile rises to his face.

"I know," You respond, giving him a squeeze. "One thing at a time, though. I don't think we can put a damper on your appetite, but we can at least make sure you eat the right things. Then, we can worry about shedding some fluff and putting on some mass instead. Hell, if you put on a little more muscle instead of just packing on fat, I bet you'd get all sorts of attention." The husky's face turns flush at your words, his hands twiddling together as he sits there. "What do you say? Shall we start by filling your belly with something a bit better?"

He nods, turning quiet for the rest of the trip. You focus on the drive, and in a few more minutes, the car stops near the back of the half-full parking lot. Juneau winces as he sees the long walk into the supermarket, but when you take his arm and help him out of the car, he nods. The two of you move forward, slowed by Juneau's mass but making your way in.

When you enter, Juneau gets a couple of looks and mutters from the others around. He hangs his head in shame, but you ignore it as you guide him along with you, refusing to leave him on his own.

"Do we have to do this?" He mutters, avoiding every eye as he walks. You nod when you grab a cart, taking one slow step after another, Juneau still struggling to keep pace.

You nod as you pass by a few aisles, going right towards the health and nutrition portion of the store. You stop as you look over the aisles of things, working to make heads or tails of the label. You haven't heard of some of the terms written on the front of the protein powders and meal-replacement shakes, so you settle for throwing in some of everything. "It may not be the tastiest thing in the world, but I figure this'll fill you up. Maybe once your belly's full with something other than sugar, you'll feel a little better."

"But isn't this all... You know... Expensive stuff?" His face is flush as he continues to stare at the ground, waddling a little as he follows you. You continue piling on the things in your cart, not sure which brand to get and tossing them all in instead of overthinking it. "I can't just ask you to do all that for me, it wouldn't be-"

You shake your head. "I can afford to splurge a little. Besides, it's still cheaper than going out to eat all of the time. If you want to repay me, then you can do it by putting your effort into this, okay? Really giving it your all on this particular round of diet and exercise. I'll even join you if it helps motivate you. What do you say?"

The husky's eyes start tearing up as he turns back to you, a small smile on his face. "Thank you... Thank you so much, Calvin. I'll... I'll do my best."

You grin and take his hand before you start heading right for the check-out. The lady in line, an older-looking swan, raises an eyebrow at the two of you, but she bags everything without a stray word. You're still hauling the cart back to the parking lot when you dig through the bags for a shake, and toss it to Juneau. "Here. Try this for starters. Vanilla protein shake. Pretty straightforwards, as far as this kind of thing goes."

The husky struggles with the sealed cap, but he manages to pop it open. Even as you're walking, you stop to see him slam down the full shake in an instant. You expect him to start making faces, but you're more surprised by his reaction.

"Huh... Not bad."

"Really?" You keep pushing, but you're still thinking about how you had to struggle to force down some of that stuff. The husky's already working on getting another shake open, but he gives an eager nod.

"Yeah. It just tastes... Satisfying, in a way." He slams the next shake down as well, He moves on to a pack of protein bars, ripping the wrapper off before stuffing his mouth with it. Hie eyes pop open at the taste, before hauling the box out of the cart, starting to tear through each of the individual ones. You walk ahead and start to pack everything into the trunk, while the husky continues to chow down like a ravenous man.

"You weren't kidding when you said you're hungry." You wince a little as you see him tear through the full box. Just how many calories was he going through? That would be enough to last you all day, and he's just getting started with his meal. By the time you're almost done packing, he digs into the last bag and tears out the tub of protein powder, digging his muzzle into it and chomping it down raw. You get queasy at that sight, wondering just how anybody could stand that stuff without mixing it into a drink, but Juneau goes through it like a desperate man, still carrying it with him as the two of you climb into your seats.

You're starting up the car when something incredible happens.

1421.content:
Rain. A uncommon occurrence in Arcadia. You've always liked rain, hearing the pitter-patter of the droplets and watching them trickle down your window. It's very relaxing. Granted, you prefer to enjoy rain from the comfort of your own home. Driving through it, on the other hand, is not your idea of relaxing. Yet that is the situation you find yourself as you head home from campus.

Today had not been your day. Right now, you wanted nothing more than to head home, slide into bed and sleep. But there had been a big accident on your usual route home, so you had to take a detour. An unexpected phone alert--something about a flash flood warning--and a few missed turns later, and you were kinda lost. So you took it slow, idling around winding suburban streets, trying to get your GPS to work for longer than two minutes--gah! You knew you should've thrown that thing out a long time ago but never really got around to it.

You cautiously round a corner, trying to avoid a repeat of the 7-11 incident, and spy something that doesn't seem quite right. Up ahead, a lone catboy walks down the sidewalk, striped tail dragging through puddles on the concrete. You catch up to him quickly, slowing as you approach to try and get a better look. He's a little on the short side, a little on the heavy side. The outline of his belly is just visible through his grey hoodie, and his jeans look a little too small. His hands are jammed into his pockets, and he appears to have cut holes into his hood for his ears to poke through. He looks to be about the same age as you--18 or 19, probably.

He's staring at the ground and hasn't noticed you yet. You can't just leave him to walk around in this weather. How do you get his attention?
1421.title: Axel

choices: You take Axel back to his house.
You take Axel to get some food.
14212.content:
"Excuse me?"

He turns with a start. His eyes look reddish. He sniffles. "Y-yes?"

"Hey. Yeah, I was, y'know, just in the area, and I was wondering if you...like, I'm not trying to be weird here, but do you--are you going somewhere? Do you need a ride, or something?" Gah, that was awkward. And he looks so flighty, too...

"Um..." He hesitates, looking down for a few seconds. "Y-yeah, that'd be nice..." Apparently that worked.

You give a little smile and unlock the side door. "Hop on in."

He shimmies into the passenger seat, his fur sopping wet. He grabs the seat belt with one hand and reaches it across his belly into his other hand. Now that you can get a good look at him up close and personal, you realize he's ever cuter than you thought. You've known you were bi since freshman year of high school--man, those were some awkward times--but you haven't had much luck with finding your kind of guys: cute and a little twink-y, but with a big bear belly. Ok, to be fair, you didn't have the purest of intentions in giving this guy a ride, but hey, it's still better than walking around in the cold rain, right?

"So, what's your name?"

"Axel."

"Axel, huh? Cool name. Your parents Guns 'N' Roses fans?"

"I-I dunno..." He seems to be shivering. You turn the heater up.

"Alright, so, where to?"
14212.title: Straight to the point

choices: Axel's craving tacos.
Actually, you've got a place in mind: your cousin's burger joint.
142122.content:
Axel leads you around the neighborhood sprawl: a left here, a right there, another right down that way. It isn't long before the rain starts to ease up. And after that, it isn't long before you hear a loud gurgling noise. You know that noise; you turn and look at Axel. His guilty look seals the deal.

"I take it you're hungry?"

"Um...a little..."

"Ok, what do you wanna eat? On me."

He looks flustered and protests, "N-no, it's fine, it's fine..."

You can't help but grin. "C'mon, it's not a big deal. Matter of fact, I could go for something, too," you lie. You're not actually hungry, but you know this kind of guy; it'll take some persuasion out of his shell. "Craving anything specific, or just, whatever?"

"Um..."
142122.title: Rumble Feature

choices: Let him be, no need to scare him off.
Persuade him to eat some more, help him live a little.
Order for him, you know he won't say no.
1421221.content:
You know the perfect establishment to sate such a craving. It's a simple matter of navigating the roads, which are thankfully empty at this hour. The occasional stoplight gives you ample time to steal a glance at your portly passenger. He stares forward, unaware of the attention you give him. His glazed eyes are that of a man whose thoughts lie elsewhere.

Must be bewildered by a complete stranger feeding him, you muse.

Eventually you pull into the parking lot of a Mexican-themed fast food joint. Beef, cheese, and taco-seasoning blasts your nose the moment you enter the glass doors. That familiar rumbling sound returns. Seems you couldn't have arrived soon enough. You step to the counter with him, and prompt him to order first.

"I'll take a soft-shell, hold the meat and cheese please." He said.

Now that didn't sound right. The catboy licks his lips once, his hunger further betrayed by a hint of salivation on his lips. No way Axel's spare tire survived on such meager portions. You decide to get something a little hearty for your order: an entire box meal.

Moments later, you are sitting with Axel at a booth for two. He's stripped his hoodie to reveal a forest green t-shirt that cradles the overhang of his paunch. At first he picks at his meal, his will to exercise restraint dwindles with each minuscule mouthful. Finally he caves and horks the whole thing down in a few bites.

Just as you predicted, the tiny portion dents his hunger about as well as a pebble to your car. You peel the paper from your first taco; his begging eyes zero in on the loaded wrap. A smile crosses your lips.

"Go on then, you seem like you want it more anyway."

He demolishes your food, leaving you to wonder if he even tasted it. He suckles his fingers for any taco residue. Ravenous. He looks ravenous. You push the rest of the meal to the plump catboy. Happy to indulge his appetite.

No surprise, he empties that box. A telling rumble emanates from his midsection once more. You exchange looks with one another, a nervous frown on his face.

"You need more?"

Continuing with the task at hand, you open the door, and as promised let him go first. Despite the uncomfortable topic, you had to know.

"Great! Well, not great because your parents..but I'm glad you could stay"

And so it continued, Axle practically living at your apartment, only leaving when you did. And it was true, not a single person called or seemed to even notice his disappearance. Heartless bastards. 1511.content:
People simply couldn't understand anthros. Ever since their discovery, people had tried to question anthros about their habits and ideas. It was difficult to tell when they would behave like animals, and when they would behave like people. The differences seemed non-existent sometimes, and staggering minutes later. When anthro lands were first discovered, the language barrier proved to be a great problem, and human's attempts at non-verbal communication insulted anthros more than it did to help. The first humans were driven out in a matter of days. Even the best diplomats that were sent only managed to calm things a little bit. It was clear that a large effort would be made before people and anthros could really communicate and understand each other.

However, that didn't stop the few odd stragglers from trying. A few humans managed to visit anthro lands, and were permitted to stay for a short while. Only a few would last longer than a week before getting kicked out. Those that remained for long periods of time were rare, but they did occur. So far, nobody who had remained with the anthros had been able to fully grasp their language, or report back about what they had learned. Progress had clearly been slow.

The opposite was almost true as well. Anthros occasionally ventured into human lands. However, things didn't tend to work out quite as well for them. A few were captured as exotic pets, and numerous injuries were commonplace whenever there was a scuffle involving one. The anthros that were lucky enough to venture into the more peaceful human locations rarely spoke much, and very few anthros remained in human lands before deciding to go back.

To you, it was a bit of a disappointment. If people acted that way, it wasn't any surprise that anthros were hesitant to trust humans. You did have an interest in them, but besides the occasional spot on the news or photograph, you had never seen one before. You didn't quite know how you would react if you saw one, and it was impossible to tell whether or not you'd be able to communicate with them at all. However, it was still something that dragged in the back of your mind.

You couldn't imagine meeting an anthro. Your job only required you to head out occasionally, so most of the time, you just remained at home, devoted to your work. You did head out on occasion, but there were only a handful of friends who really visited you often. The trip to anthro lands would cost you more than you could afford, and it was too much to hope that an anthro would end up where you were, deeper in human lands than they would be able to travel.
__________

The day had started like any other for you. Early morning, breakfast, and a bit of work. You only needed to take a break in order to try to pick up some groceries before lunch. With your schedule, it was quite simple to put your work on pause and head out. The store was close enough that you normally walked the distance. Looking up at the sky, you grabbed an umbrella before heading out.

When you arrived at the store, something had caught your attention. A few shoppers were standing around, talking about the rumors that an anthro had been spotted in your town. They couldn't agree on the exact species, but it seemed to be something like a wolf or dog. It had apparently been close by, but always ran before anybody could get close to it.

You didn't think too much of it as you grabbed some food. There have always been numerous rumors of anthros, and there's always been some fantastic confusion between meeting an anthro and an ordinary animal. You took care of your shopping fairly quickly, and made sure to get extra in case the weather was going to be rough soon. There was only a light rain on the moment, and you didn't feel like using your umbrella with a minor sprinkle, so you began making your way back home. It seemed like it was going to be another peaceful day.

15111.content:
The walk back was only a few minutes, but it passed by a few hidden streets along the way. The town was generally clean and safe enough, but few people bothered to remember where the back streets ended and began. Cutting through them always saved you a couple of minutes, and you never ran into trouble.

However, this time, you had to stop along the way. Something had caught your eye, and you paused as you thought you could spot something lying behind a dumpster. You could only make out the head of it, but it seemed as though there was a Doberman hiding behind it. You slowed down a little bit as you approached. It was hard to see, but you didn't spot a collar on it. If the dog was a stray, then you didn't want to get too close. However, you noticed that its eyes seemed to be drooping, and that it seemed half-asleep. You quietly approached, planning on walking by, hoping you could make it without any incident.

The creature didn't seem to move as you approach. You let out a sigh of relief, thankful that the dog seemed to be relaxed. However, as you passed the dumpster and got a full view of the creature, you had to stop. Your eyes widened as you spotted the limbs on the creature, clearly longer and stretched out a bit. His body was in decent shape, and his fur was short, but it definitely wasn't a normal dog.

You're about to speak before noticing his hand held firmly over his chest. You nervously move your hand closer, a little afraid of making contact. You gently lift his hand up, trying to take a look at what he was covering. His hand was odd, still furry but like a human's. However, your attention quickly went to the wound he had on his body. Though it was red and bloodied, there seemed to be very little still coming from it. However, the fact that the Doberman didn't react meant that he wasn't in very good condition.

You swallow, a little uncertain of what to do. However, you didn't want to leave him outside. You carefully tried to shift him a little bit. You saw his eyes suddenly snap open, and half-expected him to lunge at you. However, he only managed a weak growl. You hesitate for a moment, but quickly make up your mind. Without giving him a moment to do more, you just pick him up quickly, doing your best to not move him too suddenly. "Come on... It's going to rain soon, and you shouldn't stay out here." Though you feel him struggling a little, it only takes a few moments before he seems to give up, his body leaning into yours. He was heavier than you expected, but you managed to hold him steady over your shoulder as you tried your best to carry him back.

You were just grateful that there was only a short distance back home, and you didn't encounter anybody on the way. It would've been a huge problem to try to explain the situation, and you were just glad to bring him in quickly. You laid him down on your couch when you arrived, and got your first aid kit out, doing your best to patch his wound up. He winced as you cleaned it and disinfected it, but was clearly too exhausted to do anything else. It took a fair amount of time, but you finally managed to get him bandaged up.

You sighed and sat on the floor as you finished. Now that the anthro was taken care of, you had a chance to rest, but the break meant gave your thoughts a chance to fully hit you. Here you were, with an injured anthro resting on your couch. You had no idea how to react, and you had no idea what had happened to the guy. For all you knew, he could've been a convict or something. However, you couldn't bear the idea of leaving him alone in human lands. It just seemed like a bad idea, and you thought you could at least keep him while he recovered. Whatever the reason was, it didn't seem right to leave him outside and injured.

You sighed as you stood up. You couldn't keep your eyes on him all the time, and your stomach was constantly reminding you that it was time for food. You considered making something for the anthro, but had no idea what he would eat, or when he would be awake and able to eat. You sighed and just began cooking something simple. It didn't take long before you had a small plate of food.

However, you heard a soft growl from the couch. You stood up suddenly, only to see the dog trying to get up. You heard a soft growling, and quickly rushed over to him. "Easy! You're still badly hurt..."

He glared at you, snarling and trying to lunge at you, but wincing as he moved. You quickly held his arm, and just helped him sit up on your couch. "Look, just rest, okay? You can do whatever you want after you're better, but if you try now, you're just going to make it worse!"

He kept moving a little, but after a few weak shakes, he just sighed, looking down at the ground. He seemed resigned to it, and quietly sat on the couch, looking at the ground. You sat down next to him, a little uncomfortable with speaking at the moment. You simply sat there, not sure how to best break the silence. However, as the seconds passed, it only felt more and more awkward. You couldn't stand the silence for much longer, so you simply spoke again. "So... A-are you okay?"

He turned slowly to you, his expression still a little crestfallen. He tilted his head as he looked at you, and it took a few moments before it became clear that...

You saw him shaking his head furiously, growling furiously at you. He gave a couple of fierce barks, doing his best to hold himself against the top of your couch. He managed it, but nearly collapsed, and you tried your best to catch him with your free arm. "Fine, fine... Just relax... I'll get you some food. Just try to rest, okay?" You simply pointed out the bandages on his wound, and he seemed to get the message from that. "Like it or not, you can't move right now. I don't know what happened to you, but just get some rest, okay?"

He struggled as you held him tight. While he was certainly stronger than you, his would was clearly too much of a distraction. With a bit of effort, you forced him onto his back and did your best to keep him down. He seemed to struggle, but held against his would halfway through, the pain in it clearly acting up.

"Tsk... This isn't going to work... Please, just rest." You sighed as you released him. "I'll go get you some food." You sighed as you moved back, looking over the small plate of food you had prepared for yourself. While you were hesitant to offer it too him, it seemed more important that he got something. You really didn't know what he could eat, so all you could do was keep everything separate and see which ones were okay.

You placed the plate in front of him, on the table in your living room. He quietly growled at you the entire time, but seemed a little surprised as you placed it in front of him. "Here. I don't know what you can eat, so don't push yourself, okay?" He seemed to have a questioning look as you dropped a couple of bits of silverware nearby, but never took his eyes off of you.

"I'll let you eat in peace. I've got my own meal. Just try not to move too much, okay?" You sighed as you left him alone. He seemed to have quieted down, and while you wanted to keep an eye on him, it didn't seem like a good idea to keep staring the entire time. As you left, you could hear the sounds of him just digging in at the plate. It seemed he could eat all of it, but he either was too hungry right now, or didn't want to bother with the fork you had left him.

You sighed as you sat down at your kitchen, just popping open a box of cereal. You weren't in the mood to try to make something else, and you weren't feeling that hungry after everything that seemed to have happened.

You heard him struggling a little, his head pushing over the seat of the couch to try to take a look around. He seemed to stare at you as you ate. It made you feel a little awkward, but there really wasn't anything you could do but continue eating. It continued for a few silent minutes, nothing but the crunching of food filling the air.

"Finished? I'll clean up for you." He seemed to stiffen a little bit when you went to pick up the plate. While you still heard him growling, he seemed hesitant to move more than he already has. You quietly picked up the plate before walking off. He seemed to keep his eyes on you the entire time. It felt a little awkward when he watched you clean the dishes, move off to try to do work... He even seemed to have kept his eyes on the bathroom door the entire time you were in it. You supposed he was still suspicious, but there wasn't much you could do about that.

However, as time passed, you couldn't help but worry a little. He had certainly been more active than you would've liked, and while he looked okay, you wanted to make sure. He certainly seemed to relax, but by now, you were worried that he was too distracted by the pain to do anything else.

You quietly got your first aid kit out again after time had passed. His expression had gotten more and more pained along the way, but it was clearly not improving. You opened it up, and he hesitated as he saw you pull out some bandages and some disinfectant.

"I'm going to change your bandages, okay? I promise, I'll do my best to be gentle." He seemed to swallow as you approached him, and shifted uncomfortably as you did, his throat clearly growling as you got closer.

1511112.title: Understanding

choices: "You are my first concern."
"I must speak with my brethren."
"Osiris will perish by my hand."
1512.content:
Pulsing, drifting, twisting, at you, awakening you in a daze of confusion and fear. Your mind was a trampling mess of compressed thoughts spilling out over it. The dust storms had risen faster then your people had seen. Sand was ripping apart your world, not the golden sand that surrounded it though. Black sand. Then there was you running with the faint voices of your family screaming to get away. You were caught in the gusts and then there was black. And finally gold in the eyes of some wandering beast; gold that shimmered like the sun but was surrounded by darkness that made night seem like day.

Your body suddenly burst upward and your breath was a loud huff. Everything in your sight was blurry. There was white. You were lying in blue and black, lifting up the colors. They were warm and soft to the touch. Almost weightless yet comforting and thick, covering you wherever you were.

You got up and uneasily walked to the edge over the soft sheets. You were wearing nothing but black shorts, you had no idea where your patched robes were. Stumbling through the cream wall, they were sheers. You had to tug on them to keep your balance but managed to not pull them from their attachments. Your body was thin thankfully, not scrawny yet not well fed. The deserts were home to many like you.

After exiting the sheers you tried your best to focus on your surroundings. Your eyes drifted from shapes to bland colors as they focused. Your breath was still uneasy. As you looked around your eyesight gained slight clarity, slowly, shapes were easier to see and what you could was strange yet beautiful. As you tried to inspect the far white walls a voice destroyed the silence, “I’m sorry you did not sleep well, young one.”

“Wh-who…who’s there?!” you snapped your gaze to the right where the voice came from.

There were bright lights in the direction, between dark shades and tall columns. And between two was the source of the voice who solemnly spoke back to you. “…hhhhhhhhaaa,” he steadily breathed out a sigh. “Last night was quite the ordeal for you…for us both…you would have forgotten, that’s why your dreams of those events turned to nightmares.”

You stumbled away from the sheers breathing heavily as your dizziness returned, “wha-what do you mean?! What happened last night?!”

“Please don’t try to move yet, the strain of the ritual would have taken it’s toll already!” the figure snapped out of concern and equivalent order. He spoke gently yet firmly. You immediately listened to him and tried to focus all your sight on him.

And as you did your eyes went wide. He was a tall and thin man, but had a heavily built back even harder and more muscular than you've ever seen. He wore long sheer robes that trailed across the ground over a short staircase leading up to the pillars, and opaque ones beneath around his waist and reaching his knees. Gold trailed off many parts of his body as did his hair reaching out of his head piece.

But what struck you were not his clothes but him. His skin was deepest black, it looked silk like from a distance. But strangest of all were the tail that protruded from the back of his robes. And two tall ears that stood proudly on his head. He leaned against a pillar on one arm, his other hand pressed against the opposing pillar and his legs were crossed. His tail flicked majestically as its ornaments rang.

A bird flapped above him staring down to him, “go, tell the men. Also, bring back food for my vassal.” He said before turning to you as the bird left with a flock flying past the pillars. That’s when his gaze met yours. The same golden eyes from your dreams, and the beast; a jackal, “Anubis.”

“Many know of my names. Few left who know of my true purpose. But can you remember last night. What pain you brought upon yourself?”

“…no…”you managed to say.

“The let me explain…I also should tell you of what you have gotten yourself into. Do you know how brash and foolish you were? How selfless?! But you may have made the right decision if all goes well.”

“Please, just tell me what’s going on!” you sputtered due to the fact of realizing who you were talking to.

“Hah, do not fear me. Also forgive my words, being trapped in that form for so long left a cold bitterness on my actions and words. We, the controllers of your land really do exist,” he stepped down towards you. “However some of our history has been misconstrued. I, as you know, am Anubis. The Presider of death, and Measurer of life; my existence upon birth has required me to give people the honor of dying. Then sending souls to either by purified or tortured.” He was near you now. You weren’t sure what to do. ‘Is this…’

“This is no dream. Last night you made a pact with me. Osiris cursed me long ago. Not of his own faults but nonetheless his cause. He placed me in that form you met in the storm, an ill nurtured and decrepit black jackal. Forcing me to steal food out of hunger and ravage other animals for sustenance for the past 873 years…that was until…” he kneeled down before you. His face was now eye level with you, being as tall as he was.

You were unable to speak and crossed your brows in bewilderment as he spoke again. “You joined in pact with me. And for that…I thank you…” He lifted your hand and placed his lips on it.

You slowly stepped away, he let your hand pass from his. “No…I don’t even know what happened. Tell me. I can’t remember.”

“True,” he stood back up, “as I said it was Osiris’s doing. Where as I am in charge of the process and honors of death, he is in charge of what comes after. When a soul dies I weigh it to either be purified or tortured until purification after their time of judgement ends. Purification allows for the soul to be reborn. But due to so few needing to be purified, his land was filled with vile torture and eternal damnation.” Anubis walked back to the pillars

“He invaded my land and declared himself true ruler of death. He sealed my power into the once lush land, turning it into the desert that spread to the lengths it is today.”

“You mean, Egypt was once covered in forests besides near the rivers?”

“Yes, until my power over death was placed into it. Killing it…and to my horror…killing the people. I cannot forgive him for that most of all; whether or not those tortured souls rage within him. He was the one that summoned the black sand. In order to declare himself the true ruler he believes that destroying all of Egypt and taking the souls of its people into himself to be purified in despair will make him a true king. Unwilling to accept his own mistakes in destroying the balance.”

“Then what about me?”

“You ran from your home in that storm. I watched from a distance with my servants, also cursed. You came to me and in your mind weakened state allowing to speak through your thoughts. You begged me to save your people. I told you power came at a price. You said you were willing to give any price and I named it.”
You were worried now, you had nothing of value to give. “What did I give you.”

“I needed a large amount of power to even come close to regaining my position. Therefore I needed a soul to bond with. To give me that power I asked for half of your life. And you gave it to me…for your family and for your town.”

“Did you save them? Where are they?!”

“They’re gone away from the desert and it’s influences until this ordeal is over. Osiris can easily kill many outside other of our brethren’s domains.”

You were scared yet relieved, “Thank you Anubis...When you said that I gave up my life, that's why you said vassal to the bird. Half of my life is giving you power. But what can we do now? I can't fight a..."

"Don't say that word...we are a part of this world, not it's rulers."

"Sorry...this is hard to..." you weren't sure what you had gotten yourself into. Standing before you was the king of death who you had apparently saved the night before in a blur of your memories. "I don't know how, or even if I can fight. Still what is it that you intend to do. You saved my family even at my cost."

"You are most welcome. As for what to do; when we bonded you received part of my power. You can command my powers to some small extent. This leaves many options open to us."

"I don't feel very different, but I believe you...then what's our main priority?"
1512.title: The Kind Eyes of Death

choices: "We must bond more, the shared relationship will develop into strength."

15121.content:
"You said that before but I'm not sure what it means."

"I am only able to use a small fraction of my strength from my body alone till the day I achieve my full strength. You are the one that can give me the rest in short intervals. Even controlling your own new power. Being able to control the passing before death. Servants!" Anubis called out to a group of smaller jackals, two brought forth a fern from the wall.

Anubis stood next to you as the fern was placed before you both. "Watch," he waved his hand and the plant began to wilt to a curling brown. "Now...here..." he held out his hand as you watched the dying fern, mesmerized. He held your hand gently as your focus came together.

"Wh-what do you want me to do?"

"Believe that the plant can still live. Focus on it and believe that it still can be green..."

"Is that all?"

"Yes, for something as small." You listened to his words and thought of the green plant it used to be before. The edges flicked lightly then wilted back, half-crumbling. "Do not think of what it once was, that form is long lost. Think of the plant living." You looked into his eyes in disbelief, and near protesting. But his gaze told you 'I believe'.

You tried again to focus on the plant's life. To make yourself not think of what it looked like before, you closed your eyes. You just envisioned a fern, not remembering what the one before you used to look like. Just a new plant similar to it. It formed in your mind and you felt something odd and warm coming from your hands. Then Anubis's voice "good, you did well." When you heard this you opened your eyes to find that the plant had formed to a similar shape to the one you envisioned, beautiful green leaves and all.

You stepped away, partly afraid but also interested to say the least. "That's the power I have from you?!"

"Yes, you can control how near to death a living thing is or even reverse the process. Giving it life. Only I can truly kill with my power, but you can come close. I'm proud of you, my vassal," he had a very warm face. He was really happy you were able to use the power.

"Uhm, I'm glad...I could do it. It felt strange, but I kind of liked it."

"I am very happy you like my power even if it is a mere fraction. Although there is much more you may be able to do in time. A first step must be made anywhere to begin."

"Speaking of your powers, you said you needed to gain strength? I would like to help that as well if I can. What must I do?"

choices: You kissed each other(He stays kind but something strange happens at his agency)
He grits his teeth(He gains a mean demeanor towards others, but not you)
1531.content:
You both met in middle school five years ago. He was being mugged by some students for his lunch money, but he didn’t have any. His lunch was packed, so they were going to beat him. Everyone knew he wouldn’t fight back so they didn’t gather around him. You wouldn’t let them do it then and you’d still fight for him now. You rushed the kids and managed to fight off their boss as the others left calling you ‘fag lover’.

You hated to admit it but it was obvious. Those sweet, gigantic, turquoise eyes, his button nose, droopy ears, snow white fur, and cotton tail of his. Ciel was the picture of adorable. Thus he was easily picked on and made fun of and almost forced into a life he would have never been happy in. So you chose to protect him, not just because he needed it, but because he was your friend. Even though he never fought back he never ran, knowing you’d be there.

Ciel got through junior year before he realized he couldn’t be weak anymore. But he also made a resolution. He wanted to be strong like you, maybe even more than you. He didn’t want to stand behind you when you protected him. He wanted to shield you now. To be with you and prove to everyone he wasn’t weak. Even though you told him often that he was strong in his own way. He understood what you meant, but did not believe it was enough.

You were both in college now, the same one, even in the same dorm room. You were training to be a chef while he strived to be a model for muscle magazine. He had a well-shaped body now but you were still taller. He could lift you up now even though you can remember a day when you could lift him up and toss him in the air. You could still lift him though, just not throw him. You both even talked about now and back then and laughed.

It was odd that he wanted to change so badly. You never argued against him trying to be strong, you even encouraged him. But you had to ask one day, "Ciel, I know you want to get muscle. But are you really doing it for you?" you made sure to bring this up during dinner and also made sure to tell him the subject was serious.

He was silent and only managed to meekly say, "...yes, I am..." He tried to sound positive. You didn't push but you knew that it wasn't all the truth. You also knew something he tried to hide, but was more obvious then him liking men. Of all the men in the world he loved you. You didn't mind it, you were a bit intrigued by the thought too. You were always attracted to woman naturally but were never in anything serious of a relationship. If there was any man in the world you felt comfortable with, it was him.

As for how he made his way, you let him as he pleased. He is too innocent a person to force or even think of forcing himself upon you. He did do a few accidental things, some he never noticed. One in particular he did almost every day now since he started sleeping over at your house. He started this the third time he spent the night at your house, it was strange but cute and warm beyond words. You'd always let him sleep in your bed as you slept in a bag on the floor. But on that night you felt something odd curling against you as the bag unzipped. You never said a word, but when you woke up in the morning there he was warmly laying next to you with the tip of his thumb in his mouth. Even to this day with his 187 pounds of thin muscle he did this in the night. And you always made sure to wake earlier than him to get into the other bed across the room.

You never told him about it and he always wondered how he'd end up in your bed. Honestly he would never know unless you told him and were thankful he never found you next to him. You didn't want his innocent act to be spoiled by his remorseful thoughts, so you never told him.

"Uhm..."

"What's wrong Ciel..? Don't tell me they rejected you?!"

"No...I...I got in!" he cried out the day he was accepted into the agency, digging himself into your arms. His pictures were posted online the day of his first shooting and you were more than proud of him. that night you took him out on the town, it was only a few days after you moved into the dorm and one of the greatest nights of your life.

Everything was going smoothly at your end too. You were invited to a restaurant to attempt a dish for the head chef. You were even told that depending on hot good the dish was you may even be offered a position at the restaurant. Four other students were also asked to come, two of which were two years ahead of you and could be told were professionals. In the end however you managed to gain second placement which was due for a part time position. One of the older students gained the first and you became fast friends with him. But the other was a problem. He didn't take his defeat graciously.

He could accept the other being in first but not you. You could never tell directly but you saw it clearly in his gaze at you in class on occasion or his ignoring you in passing each other. The gaze became more and more angry and dark to the point that you never saw it again. It was strange but the man just never came to class. He seemed to disappear off campus. People even asked if you had seen him. Sorry to tell them you had not.

Then the day came that you could not think about without your heart sinking deep in your stomach to this day. It was on the way home from work you had invited Ciel to come with you, he'd come sometimes either way when not at work just to see you and taste the food; vegetarian that he is. You and he were simply walking home on the weekend when a man in a long dark jacket came from around a corner blowing out breath in hard unsteady puffs. "I've been waiting for you. You never came, you never even accepted my invitations," the man was clearly deranged and you could tell who it was as he came to light, the student that went missing. "I left it in your mail to see but you never looked at it, you never looked at me!"

Before you could react and as you tried to back away he jumped on you, knife in hand. You held his arm back as it neared your face. "Even at the judging...you never looked at me! You purposely destroyed My Dish Didn't You!!" the knife was being brought down with more force. Ciel could only back away in terror gasping and wondering what to do. That's when you managed to free your right hand and knock him in the face with your elbow. The knife slid across the pavement. As you reached for it his hands clenched around your neck and your breath slowly left your lungs. "No no, No No NOOO!!! You don't get to win twice!"

He said this as your sight slowly went dark and the outlines of objects became fuzzy. Your last words before nearly loosing complete consciousness were, "...run...Ciel..."

Within minutes, you only saw as a sudden flash of events half faded but burned into your memory. Ciel shot his fist into the man's throat, the blow knocking the air that left your longs into his out into the open night. Ciel was trembling and he picked the man up by his collar. Before the man could gain his composure, Ciel kneed him in the stomach. His body coughing and writhing on Ciel's side as he held onto Ciel's sleeve. Ciel knocked him aside, then dropped to the ground and pummeled him until the man's face was red and blue.

Between the darkness and fading scenery you could barely see through your eyes, Ciel managed to nearly kill the man that almost killed you. When he got up from his hate filled daze Ciel was breathing heavily looking down at him. The he gasped and stepped back putting his hands on his mouth and screaming behind them. He then dropped back to the ground and looked to you and shook at you, calling your name. When your eyes opened fully all he could do was break down on your chest. You slid your hand up and pet his fur softly, "you...did great Ciel..." That was when you heard the sirens. And red flashes filled your vision.

After that day Ciel became quiet and would come home early asking where you had been often then going to your room and working out. On the third day you just found him sweating horribly and nearly fearful staring at himself in the mirror. You stood behind him and he gasped when he noticed you and almost broke down. You came behind him and turned him towards you. You stared into his eyes, they were filled with fear, hate, and sadness. All you managed to do was slowly wrap your arms around him and let him cry. You even managed to carry him to bed.

"I...I...he...I couldn't l-let..."

"Ciel..."
1531.title: Buff Lapine Love

choices: Inspired, Ciel works out more than he had before
His attitude has started to cause trouble
15312.content:
Ciel grit his teeth as he pulled you in tight. He sat on the bed, and you leaned in a little to try to hug around him. You were a little surprised as you felt him squeezing tight, holding you closer than he ever had before. Tears were still dripping down his face, but his expression was stern, and his teeth were clear as he held you. "I... I couldn't let so-something happen to you..."

You gently held him, wiping his eyes softly. "I'm okay... I'm still in one piece. I'm glad you are, too..." You do your best to try to smile, wiping one of his eyes. However, before you could do more, you felt him squeezing, a bit more firm than before.

"N-no... I want to be able to protect you... You know that... If something ever happened to you, I wouldn't be able to stand it." His breathing was a little heavy as he did his best to hold you tight. You slowly held him, uncertain of what to say. However, you knew that you had to say something. Whenever something happened, if you weren't there to comfort him, Ciel was likely to break down.

You took a seat next to him, turning gently to wipe his eyes. "Ciel... I'm safe... You took care of me..." You blushed softly as you held him, your hand patting his back softly. He suddenly stopped, his expression finally relaxing a little bit. There was a light blush on his face as well, and he slowly pulled his head back, looking at you.

"R-really?"

You smile as you see his face finally smile as well. Your hands slip across his back as he pulls away from you, getting a good look at your expression. You give him a firm nod, confirming it for him before speaking again. "Yeah... You've gotten stronger than me..." You just smile and give his shoulder a firm pat, his blush growing deeper.

"D-do you think so?" He just nervously smiled as he lifted an arm for you, doing his best to flex a little bit. He had gotten better at showing himself ever since he had gotten his job, but he never let you catch him practicing. Even knowing you had seen all of his pictures did little to help him relax when he was face to face with you. However, he seemed to have worked up the courage to do so, and you could only nod at him as you looked.

"You've really been at it, haven't you?"

He swallowed, unable to hold himself very well as he just sat up on the bed, next to you. "Y-yeah... I... You got hurt, and I wasn't strong enough to completely protect you... I've been looking at myself, and I know I'm not the biggest... I was worried you would think I was-"

"You are not weak." Your voice was serious, and it made him jump a little bit. You gently held his head, making sure he was looking right at you as you spoke. "No matter what size you are, you've always been stronger than you think. You've been working hard, and you've always been improving. And no matter what, you've always done your best. You are definitely not weak. "

"B-but I've never been... There's no way that you'd-"

"Ciel. I'm here with you now because I care about you." His eyes widened as he heard you speak, and you thought your face would turn as red as his, but you continued to speak. "If there's any guy I'd be with, it's you, okay? So I don't ever want you to think you're weak."

"Y-you knew?" You could tell his heart was racing, and you only gave a small nod in response.

"Yeah... Yeah, I knew." You swallowed, uncertain of if it was okay for you to say it. He shifted a little bit, but you firmly held him in place. There was no turning back, so all you could do was tell him how you felt. "Ciel... I... I really don't know, okay? I don't know how I feel, and... And I don't know if I'm ready for you yet. But... But whatever happens, I promise... I care about you, okay? I'll always be here for you, as friends, or... Or as more..."

Ciel only managed a weak nod as looked at you. The seconds passed before he broke into a wide grin, holding you tight, leaning his head against your chest. He had his eyes closed, and he just hugged you as tight as he could. "T-thank you…" You only managed to keep your balance for a moment, before falling back onto your bed with him curled tight into you. You chuckled softly as you held him, just laying back and staring at the ceiling a little bit.

The minutes passed without either of you saying a word. You were too busy thinking of what would happen now, and Ciel seemed too busy holding in tight to do anything. You let the minutes passed, and when you simply grew too nervous to let it continue, you tried to stand up. However, by that time, Ciel was already asleep. He had pushed himself for days, and now that he had finally gotten a chance to talk to you, he simply couldn't hold it anymore. His body held tight against yours, and this time, you didn't think you could get him to let go without waking him.

You sighed, and just chuckled a little as you saw him curled up, his thumb tucked in his mouth as he slept. You just shifted the best you could, getting the blanket over him before closing your eyes as well.

____________________


The two of you were lucky. Ciel had barely managed to avoid trouble with the police, and it was only because of a couple of witnesses that the two of you managed to get through the night without legal trouble. However, the entire thing still hung heavy on his mind.

Whenever the two of you were home together, he seemed as cheerful as ever. He had grown a little more confident with you around, and while he was still nervous, he was able to happily talk to you about all but the touchiest subjects. He seemed a little less worried, and he was more relaxed whenever you saw him working out. He even seemed to push himself a little more whenever he saw that you were nearby. You thought he might be trying to show off for you, but it was good to see him giving it his all.

However, whenever he was outside, things were a bit different. Though he had gotten more confident when he was dealing with other people, he had also grown mistrustful of them. He was still able to talk to others, but he snapped rather easily, and whenever he thought someone was being threatening or upset, he tended to respond the same way.

Combined with the rumors of the fight, it meant that people were hesitant to trust him. The both of you were new to the area, and now, one of the first things that people know about him was that he had beat someone half to death. Though people had originally thought he was meek, it meant people now tried to avoid him when they saw him. It made him rather tense, and he still did very little to try to talk to others. When he worked now, there were only a few people that were willing to talk to him unless it was necessary.

It was the same whenever he visited you. While he was still as cheerful as ever while talking to you, everybody else nearby hesitated to talk to him. You did your best to keep him relaxed, and he did his best to stay cheerful around you, but it was a bit difficult to see people keeping clear of him. You knew he was still the same wonderful person, but the way everybody was acting simply made things worse for him. The fact that he shot glares at almost everybody who got close to you also caused some worries. Though he was simply being protective of you, most people simply couldn't understand why he almost always had a scowl, and thought he disliked most people.

Still, the days passed without too much incident. Ciel had finally started to talk a little more to others, and work was going well for you. It seemed as though things were going smoothly once again...
15312.title: Hiding His Soft Side

153121.content:
"Hey, Ciel! I'm back!" You dropped your backpack on the ground as you arrived home. You could hear the sound of weights from Ciel's room, and just smiled to yourself as you walked into the kitchen. "Want me to make dinner?"

"Yeah, thanks!" You heard a tired yell from his room. You just chuckled to yourself as you began. Somewhere in the last few weeks, it had become a habit. Since you had classes and work later than he did, he was almost always working out by the time you got home. His appetite had increased a bit, and since you were planning on cooking, you generally took care of the meals for you two. It meant you were a little busy when you got home, but you didn't mind. Lately, it seemed Ciel was even busier. Whenever you got home home, he was working out. It had been tough to find time between his classes and work, but he seemed to have made it.

You heard the shower running as you cut up a few veggies for him. You hurried as you worked, knowing he was quick whenever he was finishing up. He seemed more eager to meet you whenever he had a chance. It was just a relief for you to know that he had gotten a bit more manageable when he was out in public. Although people were still hesitant to approach him, now that he had met most of the people nearby, he was at least a little more willing to let others approach you. He still snapped whenever he was meeting new people, but he would at least take care of himself.

And, thankfully, it meant he was doing better at work. Now that he had become a bit more outspoken, it meant he was more confident when he worked. He had gotten a lot more work, and apparently he had gotten a bit of popularity as well. The number of views his pictures had were rising, and you really weren't surprised at it.

"Ah... here we go." Ciel barely had anything on as he stumbled into the kitchen. He had gained at least 10 pounds in the last few weeks, and it showed whenever you looked at him. You had been a little worried the first couple of times, wondering if it was healthy for him to be gaining at that rate. Although a few anthros were able to gain at a faster rate, Ciel certainly wasn't one of them. You had urged him to the doctor, and you had only relaxed after you had been assured that it was okay.

He still blushed a little bit as he sat down at the table. Although he was doing his best, he still couldn't keep calm when you were seeing him. You both remembered what you had said to him, and it looked like he was taking every opportunity he could to show off for you. But, though he had gotten the nerve to do it, he couldn't stay calm when he knew you were looking.

"Looking better every day, Ciel." You smiled as you dropped his food in front, before sitting down near him. He seemed to blush deeper, staring at his food for a moment before focusing on it. You just kept looking at him as he began to eat. Although he was still working, you could see his shoulders a little broader and his chest pumped out from his workout. He was definitely looking better now, and although he knew it, he still seemed eager to work more at it. You couldn't help but smile before turning to your meal as well. He never took long to eat, but he was always happy to wait for you and talk to you while you finished your meal.

The two of you always had a few hours after dinner. No matter what, you always did your best to make sure you could spend it with each other. Although it was pretty casual for you, it always seemed to mean more to him. Even if you were just watching TV, he always ended up snuggling up close. Although he was always nervous when he realized it, you didn't mind. It wasn't any more than what he seemed to do in his sleep, and you always felt warm with him that close to you.
153121.title: Peaceful Days

choices: He tries to ask you out.
During the night, he wakes up in your arms.
1531212.content:
You were starting to get a little worried about Ciel.

He seemed as healthy and content as ever. Whenever he was with you, he was more than happy to just to stay close. He was certainly devoted, and he worked as much as ever. He was certainly developing, and his weight was steadily increasing. He was able to spend enough time with you, and you were honestly surprised that he could still keep up with classes and his work with everything going on.

However, that was what worried you. It had only been a couple of weeks, and he had somehow managed to get another 10 pounds on him. You had been keeping your eyes on him to make sure he was okay, and he was certainly willing when you wanted to get a better look.

Other people were noticing, too. He was getting more and more attention, and he had even been asked out by a couple of girls. He had apparently been too embarrassed to even give a proper response. He had gotten a bit of mockery at work. Of course, he had shouted a bit afterwards, and had gotten chewed out on the scene he had made. You were a little concerned about his job, but you were just grateful that people were even willing to talk to him now.

Still, you couldn't help but worry about him. You had to swallow your worries and just ask him. You were concerned that he was doing something extreme, and more than anything, you didn't want him to end up hurting himself.

You had decided to ask him yourself before bed. He was already half-asleep on the couch, and you couldn't blame him. The TV was on, but neither of you were paying too much attention to it as some movie played in the background. You felt him shift a little, and his body was leaning in.

"Come on, Ciel. We'd better get you to bed. You're really too tired right now." You did your best to put his hand against his arm, and shifted a little to try to pick him up.

He snapped awake a little as he heard his voice, and gently nodded. "O-okay... Thanks..." There was a light blush on his face as he leaned in, stumbling a little bit towards the bedroom."

"Of course, Ciel. I'm always here to look out for you, remember?"

"I wanted to be able to look out for you..."

"Ciel... Please, take care of yourself first, okay?" You paused to look straight at him, a serious look on your face. "Don't do anything to hurt yourself, okay?"

"I'm not... Why would you think-"

"Ciel... It's been a week, and you've put on ten pounds. I know you want to look good, but not if it means you're taking-"

"I'm not!" You looked at his expression, and while you expected him to be mad or upset, he had a worried look. "I'd never do that!" He had pulled you in tight against his body, and while it was a little uncomfortable, his voice was starting to panic. "I know you'd hate it, and I'd never want you to worry about me even more..."

"Ciel, I believe you." He stopped as he heard you speak, letting go to try to look at you face-to-face. "Ciel, you've never lied to me about something this important. I believe you, okay?"

"T-thank you!" His expression had brightened suddenly, squeezing against your sides and happily lifting you up into the air. You were a little surprised, but held still. "I know it's fast, a-and I can't tell you why, but... But I promise, I won't do anything to hurt myself, okay? Y-you'd worry too much about me if I did..." You were starting to feel a little uncomfortable, but your arms gently wrapped over his shoulders, returning the hug.

"Ciel... Thanks. Really." You gently leaned in, your hand brushing against one of his ears. "I'm... I'm really glad you're thinking of me." You couldn't resist leaning in as he looked back at you. He always looked so sweet whenever he was this close. You hesitated for a moment, but gave him a soft kiss on his forehead. His eyes widened as he held you, and he simply didn't know what to do. He simply held you there silently for a couple of minutes, blushing deeply before slowly letting you back onto the floor. Every motion of his body was clear as he moved, and being that close made it incredibly clear that he was really growing.

"Y-yeah..." He just blushed softly, slowly beginning to walk to his bedroom, holding onto you for as long as he could.

15312122.content:
The night was one like most others. You had climbed into bed rather early, getting comfortable in your bed. It didn't take too long before you could hear the sound of Ciel stumbling through the hallway and pushing your door open gently. It creaked open and you could hear a couple of mumbles coming from him as he slipped in closer. It always amazed you that he was so quiet in his sleep, even when he was creeping up that close to you.

You could feel him move onto your bed, crawling in against you. In a few moments, he had his body close to yours, a small smile on his face as he shifted in. His thumb pushed up close to his mouth, and you gingerly held him as he seemed to relax. Your eyes gently closed as you felt his body in. At night, when he was inches from you, it was always clear how much he was growing. You could easily reach every inch of him, and even when your hands were a little firm, he barely shifted and moved.

You gently pulled him in, holding around and squeezing as you drifted off. His fur brushed lightly along, and he curled up in your arms, his body shifting to try to remain against your grip. His thumb was now pressed between his lips as he shook and pressed into your body, almost still as he slept in your arms.

A loud bang suddenly drove your eyes open. Maybe a car had backfired somewhere nearby, or someone had fired off something. You didn't really have too much time to think about it when you saw Ciel's eyes wide open as well. He seemed to be confused for the moment, but with one of his arms pressed against you, there really wasn't that much else he could make of it.

"D-did I... Oh, no..." Ciel pulled his hand away, covering his mouth a little bit as he backed away from you. You tried to sit up as you saw him moving to the doorway, his confusion quickly turning to horror. "I-I'm sorry! I never meant t-to... I-I'll leave you alone!"

"Ciel, wait!" Before you could say anything else, he quickly dashed out of your room, the door almost slamming shut along the way. You sighed, clenching your fist and cursing to yourself. Ciel always came in his sleep without any bad intentions, and somehow, because of some accident, he was forced away from you.

You swallowed as you got up, trying to shake the last remnants of sleep off of yourself. It was clearly something that you had to talk to him about. It seemed as though he was worried about what had happened, and that was the last thing you wanted. You did your best to keep him in the dark so he wouldn't worry, and even if he knew, you still didn't want him to worry.
