choices: "I've been... getting off on those dreams..."
"I'm going to grow even more..."
153121221.content:
You sighed a little bit as you stood up, opening the door quietly. The hallway was still dark, but it didn't take long for you to fumble your way towards Ciel's room. The two of you called it his, but all it really had was his exercise equipment. He had always slept in the same room as you, and until today, it had never been a problem. However, now...

You shook your head, trying to suppress your worries as you approached. It was the only place he would run to right now, and as you got closer, it became clear that he was in it. It became easier and easier to find your way to him, a soft, rhythmic noise coming from his direction. You moved to his door, but the noise seemed quiet muffled even when you got that close.

You swallowed a little, trying to keep yourself calm as you knocked on his door. You heard a slight gasp and the noise seemed to stop as he heard it. "I-is that-"

"It's me. Can I come in, Ciel?"

"P-please don't... I know that I was making a huge mistake, but p-please, don't c-come in and yell or-"

"Ciel, you know me. You know I'm not mad, don't you?" You did your best to keep your voice straight. It was hard enough to do when you were worried about him, and hearing him as worried as he was did nothing to reassure you.

"I didn’t think so, b-but this..." Your heart sank as you heard his voice. No matter what happened, you certainly didn't want him to be depressed at it. "This might be a-an exception... I n-never meant..." He paused for a moment, and you heard the noises resume. "I-I'm kind of distracted working out... Can we talk about it later?"

"Ciel... Will you please open the door? I want to talk face-to-face with you."

There was no noise for a minute, but it was all you could do to wait there. You were about to speak again, when you heard the doorknob slowly turning. Ciel's eyes were a little watery, and he was sweating a little bit. It looked as though he was trying to work off his feelings, but he wasn't having much luck with it.

"T-the door was open, you know..."

You immediately reached your arms around his chest, stepping in to hug him tight. He nearly jumped back, but you kept your grip on him, closing your eyes as you leaned in gently. "I didn't want to say anything until you were ready..."

You could feel his pulse racing, and he seemed to hesitate before letting a hand pull you away. You didn't do much to resist him, and by now, it didn't feel like there was too much you could do. He easily managed to get out of your grip, and looked right at you as he spoke. "B-but... But I'm not ready... N-not for this..." He blushed as he sat down on a bench, and you quietly took a seat next to him. "Y-you mean the world to me... But I don't want to... I won't push that on you..."

"Ciel... " You moved your hand onto his, holding it firmly. He took a breath as he tried to keep speaking.

"Y-you said you weren't ready yet, and I don't want to force you... I t-thought I would be able to c-control myself, but... But even while I was sleeping..." He tried to lean into his hands, shaking a bit as you felt it rising. "I... My body didn't want to wait... I... I really wanted to be with you at night..."

"Did you enjoy it?" He had a surprised expression as he turned to look at you. Whatever he thought you'd say, that certainly wasn't it. He stared for a moment, but you cleared your throat before repeating yourself. "Did you enjoy sleeping there with me?" Your voice was steady as you spoke, and you gently held against his hand as you waited for his response.

"Y-yeah..." He lightly blushed as he looked at you, shifting a little awkwardly. "To be honest, when I was there, I was... I was dreaming about it..." He blushed deeper, doing his best to keep speaking as his voice continued shaking. "About when I would be able to really be with you..."

"Mmmm..." You chucked softly, letting a hand shift over his shoulders, thinking quietly to yourself. Ciel was definitely calming down, and you had to wonder if it was time to let him know. Now was as good of a time as any, but you certainly didn't want to put more pressure on him now when he was already so nervous. However, in the end, you quietly asked. "Was it the same dream you've been having for a long time now?"

His eyes opened wide as he heard you say it. His blush was completely red, and he barely managed to stammer out a few words. "H-how d-did you... Oh, no..."

"Yeah... This isn't the first time." You felt him trying to back away, but this time, you kept a firm grip on his hand. You knew he could easily get loose, but he seemed hesitant to let your grip slide off. "You've been sliding in with me for a while now."

"I'm sorry! I can't believe-"

You pressed a finger to his lip, quieting him down as you moved in close. "Ciel. I know you. And I know you have the purest intentions when it comes to something like this." You moved in closer, his pulse racing as you pressed in. "I trust you. Completely. I didn't tell you because I didn't want you to worry about it. I don't mind. "

His ears seemed to stand up a little as he heard those words, and he slowly straightened up from his slouch. "Y-you don't?"

"Ciel... I've seen you coming in a couple of times. You always looked so cute and peaceful in your sleep..." You took the time to lightly brush around a bit of his fur, his body finally relaxing as you remained close to it. "I know right now, you're just my friend, but... I've never had a problem with you being close to me."

"Not even with... Sleeping with you?" He seemed lost for words, but you gave him a small nod.

"I trust you, Ciel. Even when you're sleeping with me... I know it's okay. I'm always safe and warm with you... And I know you wouldn't ever do anything extreme without letting me know. So... It's okay."

You felt his face close to yours, his breaths pushing against you. His every breath seemed to be a little slow, and his body shifted as he finally let his arms hold against you.

"I-is this okay, too?" He blushed and nuzzles against your cheek before finally planting a kiss there, his arms gently wrapping around you. His fur seemed a little wet as he held you, a little sweat along his body as he held around you.

You had to hesitate a little bit. But, seeing his weak smile and his waiting eyes, you couldn't help yourself. "Yeah... It's okay." You just held him tight, before slowly leaning in and returning the kiss. He seemed to be content, and you could see his tail shifting and wagging a little as he held you in.

"I-I'm really glad... I've... I've wanted to do this for a long time..." He slowly leaned down along the bench, keeping you tight in his arms as he fell. You were a little surprised when he did it, but you did your best not to let it show. Despite his strength, his arms were still warm and gentle as he held you against his chest.

"I'm glad you can." You let your arms shift over his shoulders, lying against his body. He rubbed over your back softly, and you were content to rest against him. You couldn't help smiling as you saw him curling up a little bit, turning sideways to gently hold to you.

"Thanks... For telling me everything..." He blushed softly as he held you in. "I've always been so worried... I mean... It's always been enough that you've been living with me, and taking care of me... I'm... I'm going to do my best to take care of you, too...

"Ciel... I told you before... Take care of yourself, okay?"

"I do. But... I want to be strong enough to really take care of you, no matter what happens. So... So I have to be able to say everything to you..." He blushed a little bit as he held you, his voice quieting down as he barely managed to eek out a whisper. "Y-you told me things that you were nervous about, so I have something to tell you, too..." He tried to keep calm, but you could see the excitement in his face.
153121221.title: Interruption

choices: On his way home, Ciel ends up in a fight.
One day, Ciel visibly grows in front of you.
1531212212.content:
"You mean, more than you are now?" You tried to keep calm as you heard him speak, but the idea was a bit much for you. You were a little concerned for him, worried about how things might turn out, and you had to admit, you were a little excited at the idea. He seemed to only notice the last, giving an eager nod as he held tight against you.

"Yeah... I'm part of a... Well... I still can't say..." He shifted a little awkwardly, but you shook your head.

"It's okay. Just tell me what you can."

He smiled and nodded softly, giving you another small kiss as he held you. "Thanks... Anyways, part of it is... If I'm with you... If I really stay close to you... I'll grow more. I know it sounds crazy, but I've been growing so fast because... Well, partially because you've been so close and so kind to me..."

You shake your head as you give his arm a gentle squeeze. He jumped a little at the gesture, blushing as he tried to flex a little bit for you. You had to struggle a little to try to make it give, and he seemed to blush deeper as he watched you try. You couldn't help but smile when you settled on squeezing it firmly, holding against him. "Ciel... You've definitely earned this. You've always worked your tail off when it comes to this, and I'm always happy to help."

He shifted lightly as he held you in, blushing as his other arm rubbed down his body. "I'm really glad you like it... I know I wanted to get stronger, but... But I was afraid you'd think I was a freak, or that I was trying to be a jock or something..."

You gently squeeze him in, trying to reach around him. "Of course not. I know you're the same, sweet guy I've always known, at this or any size. I want you to be happy, Ciel. So, grow as big as you want to get..." You chuckle and give him a firm squeeze as your body presses to his, feeling him just shift and curl up a little. "I promise, I'll still find you handsome and wonderful every step of the way."

He just gave a firm nod as he snuggled in, holding you close as he curled up a little. His eyes were drifting off now, and it seemed as though he was moments away from sleep. You simply did your best to keep your arms around him, even as he stretched out a little. You smiled to yourself as you saw his hands shift up, knowing he was off in his dreams as you held around him.

"Good night, Ciel..." You gave one of his ears a gentle kiss as you held him through the night. You saw him smiling in his sleep, giving the slightest of twitches as you hold him. It wasn't the most comfortable spot to sleep, but with him tight in your arms, you couldn't complain.
__________

The next few days were a little awkward between the two of you. It certainly took some getting used to for him. Waking up in your arms was a whole new experience for him, and he always seemed hesitant to leave. You had considered getting up before him like you used to, but now that he knew, it simply seemed better to stay with him for as long as you could, enjoying the feeling of your fuzzy friend tight in your arms. You only left after he had risen in your arms, and had given you a firm squeeze.

You always took care of breakfast after you got out, but he seemed to take longer to get out. He seemed hesitant to leave the sheets, and would only manage to pull himself out after you were already done cooking. He ate rather quickly before the two of you had to leave, but you didn't mind too much.

After all, he was always there by the time you got back from work. He seemed fond of working out more than ever, and it was getting quite clear that he was growing at an incredible rate. You could swear he was visibly bigger each time, and when you checked the scale, he had gained another 8 pounds in a matter of days. He was easily up at 215 pounds by now, and would make quite an impression whenever someone saw him.

It did present its own challenges. You had heard that by now, even though he was acting a bit calmer, people were getting scared of him simply because of his size. It wasn't bad for anybody that knew him, but people he had met before were nervous of him, and that tended to put him in a bad mood. He had apparently broken a few things at work, and when he got back some days, he needed help cooling off.

Thankfully, nights were much better for you two. You would often be in bed first, and he would always try to get in a small workout before bed. As a result, every day, when you were about to drift off, he would lightly step in, and try to sneak in under your arms. Although he was quiet, you'd always find yourself wide awake when he entered, his body pressing and rubbing along yours. He didn't say a word, and simply let his hands hold your sides loosely. Even with his increasing bulk, he would always manage to find a way to curl up in your arms. And whenever you saw him sleep, you would always relax, glad that you were able to keep him close that way. He always seemed like a fluffy little rabbit whenever he was resting close to you.

Things finally seemed to settle down again after a while. Despite the oddities, both of you had gotten used to the new development, and were content with each other. However, another event would soon weigh on both of your minds...
1531212212.title: Growing Closer

choices: You stay home to try to take care of him, and he explains what happened.
Ciel says he'll be fine home by himself, but he's not really resting...
15312122121.content:
You thought it'd be another normal day when you set out. It certainly seemed like it when you woke up, Ciel right next to you with his eyes fluttering slowly. You had to chuckle as you saw him still deep asleep, shifting out to try not to wake him. It was breakfast, then class, then work. You had gotten into the routine quite well, and had even brought a bit of extra food back for Ciel this time.

However, when you arrived back at your place, he wasn't home. It felt a little bit odd to you, but you thought he might still be late at work or something. You had tried to give his phone a call, but it seemed as though it was either off, or couldn't get a signal. He usually just kept it on vibrate, so you couldn't help but worry a little bit.

You tried not to think too much about it while you ate, but you couldn't help worrying a bit. Ciel certainly hadn't been the best off when he was with other people, and unless he trusted them, he had gotten rather short-tempered. It was all you could do to hope that he would be back soon, and it was difficult to resist the urge to call again by the time you were done washing up the dishes.

You nearly jumped as you heard your phone ringing from your pocket. It only took a moment before you had checked the number calling, a relieved tone coming from your voice as you answered. "Ciel? That you?"

He seemed out of breath, but it was just good for you to hear his voice. "Yeah... I'm okay... Just stuck on campus... Do you think you could meet me out here?"

"Ciel? Is something wrong?"

He seemed hesitant to respond, but you could hear him speak after a little while. "I'm okay. I just... Got into a fight. P-please don't say anything right now... I-I'll talk to you after we get home, okay?"

"You what?" Your throat was a little dry as you heard it. You had to work hard not to shout, but you could practically hear him wincing over the phone. Swallowing your worries for the moment, you tried to speak. "O-okay... Where are you now?"

"I'm at the health station on campus. They already said there's nothing major... I just..."

"It's alright. I'll be there soon." You were already starting to run out the door by the time you had hung up. It was close to the same path that you travelled every day, but you had never made travelled the distance as fast as you had now. Even when you were late, it didn't have nearly the same urgency that Ciel did right now.

By the time you made it, you were exhausted and out of breath. Your legs were burning and your vision was a little blurry, but you kept pushing yourself to get there in time. You were trying to push through towards the door, and had almost missed Ciel, who was waiting near the entrance. You had nearly tripped into him, barely managing to stop your mad dash when you saw him.

"Y-you're here..." He was looking at the ground, trying to shift a little awkwardly. "S-sorry to bother you..."

"Ciel? What's wrong?" You were doing your best to catch your breath, your hands on your knees as you tried to relax. However, it only was a moment before you looked up at him, your hands slipping a little when you saw his face.

He was still in decent condition. There didn't seem to be anything broken, and he was still in one piece. However, he had numerous bruises against his body, and his fur was dirty and bloody in a couple of places, the mess showing through the tears in his clothing. He had gotten a black eye, and while it looked like he had tried to clean himself off a bit, he hadn't gotten the chance to do it very well.

"It's really not that big of a deal..." His voice seemed a little tired as he spoke, and it did seem shaky. However, he still managed to put out a small smile as he saw you. "They had a chance to look at me, and said my wounds were minor... I've got a couple of minor internal things, but I'll heal up fine in a couple of days..." He tried to sound convincing, but his voice was a little quiet, and neither of you really bought it.

"Maybe, but you sure can't work looking like that..." You sighed and shook your head a little. "I'm just glad you're in one piece. I was worried you couldn't walk home on your own or something."

"Nothing that serious. Just a little sore when I try to move. Little bit tired, too..." He tried to step towards you, his body still moving, but shaking a little. "I think I could probably make it if I tried, but..."


Your breathing finally calmed down as you held against his hand. He suddenly looked directly at you, and you managed to give him a small nod. "I'm just glad you're okay. The cuts and scrapes will heal alright, and we can get you cleaned up properly." You firmly squeezed his hand as you held on, before shifting him so he could lean on your shoulder. "Come on... Let's get you home."

You could see him blush out of the corner of your eyes, but you ignored it. He was probably nervous enough as it was, and the both of you knew you'd have to talk about the fight when you got back. You didn't see any reason to make it worse by saying something now. You just focused on moving forward, one step at a time. You tried your best not to rush, even as you felt his weight pressing into your shoulder.

"Sorry to make you do this..." He tried to speak as you moved, although it sounded like it was a little rough. "I think I was doing okay, but by the time you got here, the adrenalin had worn off... Just feel really off now..." He sighed a little bit as he kept moving steadily, leaning in against you. "Must seem ridiculous... Big guy like me, and I still have to ask you to help... I just didn't want anybody to see me in this shape..."

Now more than ever, you had realized just how much he had grown. His body was pushing firmly against you, and though he wasn't moving much, you could still feel his weight pushing you forwards and his body brushing into you. Though his fur cushioned him a little, it was still quite clear that under it all, he had gotten quite tough. But despite that, he was more worried about appearing weak.

"Don't be ridiculous. I'm always here to help you, Ciel. Always. And I'm glad you called. If you had tried walking back alone, I would've probably called the police by the time you got back." You shifted a little, trying to adjust his position a little bit. "Besides, being tired isn't being weak. I'd much rather do this for you than have you collapse in the middle of the street."

It had taken a while to try to walk back. You didn't want to force Ciel to move that fast, even with help. He had managed a decent pace, but he seemed like he wanted to keep you from seeing his face while he still had the massive bruise over his left eye. You didn't know what other people would think, watching you help your friend along as he leaned in against you. But you just wanted to get him home, safe and sound.

Your place was finally in sight when you felt his body pressed in against you. You had done your best to catch Ciel onto your back, a little surprised when it happened. "Ciel? You okay?" You asked, the concern clear in your voice as you tried to look at him.

"Fine... Just a little tired..." He tried to smile, but his face looked a little off. It looked as though even the walk had drained what little energy he still had left. You just gave a nod, and quickly made up your mind. With a bit of effort, you put your arms around him, giving a bit of a heave before pulling him onto your back. He gave a small gasp as he felt it, before trying to speak. "W-what are you-"

"Just let me do this, okay?" You turned to him, looking back into his clear eye as you held him. "We both know at the rate you're growing, I won't be able to lift you around that much longer. I want to help you every way I can, and right now, that means carrying you while I'm still able to." You managed to walk a little faster as you held him tight. It was certainly tough for you to keep a steady pace, but you didn't want to let Ciel slip from your grasp.

"N-no... I-I'm supposed to..." He blushed a little bit at the thought, shaking a little bit. You tried to adjust your grip to hold him steadily, but you could feel him shivering a little bit. "I... I want to be stronger so I can take care of you... You shouldn't have to do this... I don't want to keep doing this... I want to be strong enough so you don't have to keep protecting me..."

"I'll always be here to take care of you. I promise." You shifted a little to get your door open, having a bit of trouble keeping Ciel on your back. You could've placed him on the ground, but you didn't want to let him go until you had to. "No matter what, whether I need to or not... When you get too heavy for me to carry, you can still lean on me." You managed to swing the door open, gently climbing the steps into your place and moving to the bedroom. "And even when you get stronger... You could be the strongest guy in the world, and I'd still be here to help take care of you."

You finally managed to lean back into the bed, laying him down. You turned to see him, and while he had a light blush on his face, he was relaxed as he looked at you, closing his eyes. "I'd like that."

You sighed quietly as you saw him finally resting. His breathing seemed okay, and while he was worn out, he didn't seem to be in any danger. You just laid your arm against his body, giving him a soft rub as he relaxed. There were still things on your mind, but they could wait the night. It was better to let Ciel have a night of peace, first.
15312122121.title: Injuries

choices: You offer to help Ciel with his bath.
You try to call someone and find out about the fight while Ciel's busy.
153121221211.content:
"Morning, Ciel. Did you rest okay?"

"Yeah... I slept all right. How about you?"

"More or less the same." You smiled as you peeked at him through the doorway. He was still quite a mess after the last night, but he seemed to be doing a whole lot better after a night of sleep. A couple of the bruises were a bit lighter, and as you watched him stretch and yawn, it seemed as though his body was recovering nicely.

You saw him stretching and scratching at himself as he slowly pushed out of bed. His nose gave a small twitch as he moved, smiling a bit as he looked at you. "Do I smell breakfast?"

"Lunch. You slept in late." You saw him give a little jump, turning suddenly before you spoke again. "Relax. I already called the school and work for you. Considering the condition they saw you in, they didn't need much convincing to let you off."

"Oh..." He shifted a little bit, pulling at the tattered remains of his shirt. "Then... What are you doing here?" He blushed a little bit, trying to move a little as he tossed it into the laundry basket."

"I asked for some time off, too. And before you say anything, we both know you'd probably try to 'work off' this injury, with the way you've been acting. I'm here so someone's got their eye on you." His mouth didn't get to remain open for very long, but all he could do was give a feeble nod when he looked at you. "Come on. We can get some food, then get you into the bath."

He was halfway through changing his clothes when he realized that he was still a huge mess. He blushed and nodded as he started to walk out of the room. "Sounds good..." You chuckled as you took his hand, only lightly pulling him along as you helped him into his seat.

You chuckled as you watched him eat, only lightly munching on your own food. His meals had grown a fair size lately, and while it was manageable, you had gotten groceries a couple of extra times in the last few weeks. It was a little tricky trying to think of food that he'd be able to eat and still like, but he usually wasn't very picky. He was always a little noisy, and he had enough to go through that you could always take your time with your meals.

However, a few minutes in, you had to ask him. "So... What happened? I called the school and all, but they said that you had arrived with those injuries." He looked ready to answer, and his chewing slowed down for a moment, but his voice was quite clear when he finally swallowed and responded.

"Right... I told you before, I got into a fight. A couple of guys followed me after work." He took another bite from a bit of celery , taking his time to chew through it as you spoke.

"Why would a couple of guys pick a fight with you?"

"They didn't... Not exactly..." He gave a small sigh as he shook his head. "Okay. Originally, it wasn't bad. They recognized me from what I do, asked to see me pose a little, nothing too big." He gave a small smile at the idea, shaking his head a little. "They asked for a feel, and I let them see my arm. It seemed pretty good up to that point. After, they said that they knew someone bigger. Bit irritating to be compared, but nothing huge. I think I got a little loud, challenged the guy or something."

"You didn't say you'd fight him or something, would you?"

"Trust me, the thought had come up, but no." He took another bite, looking a little thoughtful as he looked back. "It was Jerik. You know, that one bear on the hockey team?"

You gave a small "tsk" as you nodded to him. Jerik was a heavy polar bear, and was fairly well known around school for being a bit rough, but as far as you knew, he had never done anything major. He didn't really seem to pay attention to anybody who wasn't already on a team, and you heard that he had his pick from a few girls on campus. However, this was the first time you've ever heard of him getting in a fight outside of a game.

"Well, met him. Wasn't too bad at first. Think he was surprised to see someone my size and not recognize me before. I think they were just joking around about everything, and we were just going to arm wrestle to prove it."

"That doesn't sound too bad... How'd it get to a fight from there?"

"Well, both of us were a little... rough." He seemed to flinch a little bit as he looked at you, half-expecting you to get upset when he mentioned it. "First couple of times, it was just back and forth, and neither of us really took it too seriously. But somewhere along the way, I think it escalated a bit. Neither of us really wanted to lose, and I think by the end of it, he had made a bet he really didn't want to pay up on. The end of it's pretty blurry for me. There was some shouting, and I'm really not sure which one of us threw the first punch. All I remember is that the other guys had decided to stay out of it, and it ended after the table we were wrestling on broke. The fall really hurt, and I think we sort of snapped out of it when we were both getting up. After that, I ran out before anything else happened. I made it out okay, and that's when the injuries really started to smart. And... Well... You remember how you found me."

You sighed gently as you saw him staring into his plate of food. He seemed a little nervous and shifted in place before taking another big bite of food. You weren't quite sure what to make of his story, but you were just glad he didn't snap at someone random. With the way things were, you were a little worried that it would've been the case. You were going to give him some time to finish eating before speaking, but he seemed to try to keep something in his mouth, trying to avoid the pressure of giving a response.

"Long as you're both okay... Honestly, after the last fight you were in, I'm just glad you're in one piece. I know it can get hectic sometimes, and... Well, I'm just glad you're okay."

He quickly swallowed, nearly choking as he tried to free up his mouth. "T-thanks..." He gave a small cough before shaking his head. "I know I've been a little... on edge lately. I think your name got mentioned somewhere, and I got a little worried. I don't even remember the whole thing now..." He shook a little bit, but you smiled and shook your head. "I just... I don't like it... Sometimes, people just..."

"It's alright." You didn't say another word, just letting him get the rest of his food down in silence. It took a couple of awkward minutes before you quietly stood up. "I'll get the tub ready for you, okay?" He seemed too distracted by his food to really realize what you had said, and simply nodded as you walked into the bathroom.
153121221211.title: Over Lunch

choices: He tries to cover himself the entire time, and you end up washing most of him.
He lets you see, and gets a little bit excited during the bath.
1531212212111.content:
"Water's ready, Ciel!" You yelled for him as you turned off the faucet, checking the tub to make sure that it was okay. It took him a couple of minutes to finish eating before he arrived. He was a little surprised to see you still in the room, shifting a little awkwardly.

"Thanks... I guess this'll keep me out of your hair for a little bit." He shifted a little bit, trying to move out of your sight at he started to remove the only bit of clothing he still had on. You smiled as you saw his tail wiggling a bit, trying to pull everything from the boxers he had on.

You stood for a moment, a little uncertain as you looked at him. Although he had his back turned to you, it was pretty clear that he was still a little nervous about exposing himself. Still, things weren't going to get any easier if you gave him more time. You just swallowed your fear as you asked him, "Ciel... Want me to help you wash?"

A rather loud rip sounded as you saw his hand slip, his boxers tearing clean off of his legs as he pulled them. You knew he might've gotten caught off-guard your comment, but this was certainly a new one. You saw him turn a little bit, and if he wasn't blushing before, he certainly was now. He did his best to awkwardly cover up a little as he only turned his head to you. "R-really?"

"Sure. I don't think you can really reach your back by now, and I don't mind helping." You were trying to sound cool about it, but your face felt a little flushed, and it wasn't hard for him to see that you were a little embarrassed by the idea, too.

"I-I'd like that..." He could only give a meek smile as he shifted a little bit, still trying to keep both of his hands firm over his crotch as he moved towards the tub.

"It's alright, Ciel... We're not in a rush or anything..." You smiled as you saw him move closer, most of his body exposed to you, his fur a little bit on-end as he did.

"Um... If y-you don't mind..." He seemed to blush deeper as he spoke, sitting on the rim of the tub as he looked at you. "I don't want to be the only one like this... I-I want to see you, too... You had come from a small family in the city, but it meant here were plenty of opportunities for you to train and learn. Many seemed to pass by, and your hometown, Ganecia, always seemed to be a busy hub for them. You got to see many stopping, some fresh out from their first days and others clearly more experienced and toughened. You heard their stories, and you couldn't help but dream about it as you were growing up.

You took every chance you had to try and train, as a result. A bit of swordsmanship here, a bit of archery there, some time out in the woods nearby... You had even managed to learn a small bit of magic from the mages who liked to show off. Although you couldn't do anything nearly as flashy as some of the people you had seen, you had gotten comfortable enough to do a few small tricks.

So, when you had come of age, one of the first things you did was set off on your own. Your parents had worried, of course, but you had made your mind up, so they chose to send you off well instead of having you run off on your own. As a result, when you had decided that you would start looking around at the list of jobs available to adventurers, you had their support. The one you picked was a few days away, and it was simply to investigate and report a possible group of unlawful slavers.

It didn't seem like that big of a job. It was purely investigation, and the reward for it was relatively small. However, it seemed to stick in your mind. While there was a small, legal trade for living creatures, the laws and regulations in it made it difficult to deal with. There was supposedly a much larger underground market, where even humans could be moved. Few people tended to worry about individuals suffering under it, and only traffickers had to worry a lot about it.

At least, that's what you had heard. Ganecia was large enough to be fairly well regulated, and you could never remember seeing anybody like that. However, even though all you ever heard were rumors, the idea of it always unsettled you. Now was a good chance for you to start looking into it, so you had decided to start traveling immediately.

You didn't have that much on you. It was only a bit of food and some traveling supplies, along with a small bag of coins. The only weapons you had on you were a light spear, a bow, and a hunting knife. They were the tools that you could afford to take with you, and while it wasn't much, you were comfortable with each of them.

The first few days were straightforward, and gave you plenty of time to get used to things. It was a fair amount of traveling, with a bit of hunting for small game when you had a chance. It really didn't seem like anything extraordinary, and quite honestly, by then, you were wondering how other adventurers passed their time like this. However, even though it felt a bit slow, you were happy to just be out on your own.

However, on the fourth day, you had made contact. It seemed as though the rumors were good. You had managed to catch a glance of something while you were trying to get dinner. You could hear a couple of quiet voices, and tried to take the opportunity to sneak in closer, listening in.

".... out of all of them. I mean, seriously? We were lucky enough to catch him, we should've gotten a better job. Instead, we're stuck out here, waiting for a guy that might take a week to show!" The voice seemed to come from a rather burly-looking man, hauling a heavy iron axe and only wearing a few light bits of armor. He didn't look like too much, and seemed more like a wood-cutter than a slaver.

However, the other man made the scene rather clear. "Quit whining. You're getting plenty to sit out here, aren't you?" He took a sip from a wineskin as he glanced around the area. His equipment was laying nearby, but he seemed to have numerous weapons within reach, and was wearing simple clothing to try to blend in with the area.

"Not for days!" You heard the clanging of a bit of metal, before the grainy-sounding voice spoke again. "I told you we'd be early. Why would you think it's a good idea for us to be stuck, waiting in the middle of nowhere for days with something this valuable?"

"You know you don't want to keep our buyer waiting." He responded in a slightly fearful tone. "We were lucky enough to catch this guy, and the buyer's known to be reliable. And we both know how he is with timing."

"Grr..." The sound of someone kicking at the ground passed through the forest. "Meanwhile, we have to keep an eye on him like a couple of sitting ducks. The sound of metal hitting metal rang out, and you managed to move enough to see a rather well-armored man kicking a cage.

Your eyes widened as you looked into the cage. You couldn't help muttering to yourself as you took a good look. "No way... A Krethid."

At first glance, you had thought that it was a hawk. The head certainly seemed to fit, and you could see a light brown, feathered coat moving down from his neck, stretching into a pair of wings. However, it was far too big to be a normal bird. As you tried to get a better look, you could see his arms coming in from his shoulders, his talons bound together tight on the end. His wings were draped over his body, but you could see his legs against the ground. Enough though many of his features were birdlike, the majority of his body was shaped like a human, though he seemed worn and weak. Some of the feathers flowing down from his arms seemed to be poking at odd angles, and he had a hard time moving them about.

You swallowed as the bird looked at the ground, trying to avoid his captors' gazes. He seemed to quietly glance around the area, but his eyes stopped moving when they moved into your direction. You tensed a little, and tried to mouth out a few words to him. However, before you had the chance to say any more...

"Hey! There's some guy over here!"

You nearly jumped as you heard one of the men shout. You tried to get free and pull at one of your weapons, just grabbing for whichever you could reach. However, the brush you were in caught against your arm, and it took you too long. By the time you had managed to get your bow out, the big guy had managed to get close, smashing it into two pieces with his axe before pinning you onto the ground.

"Hmmm... What have we here... Looks like a little kid decided to try to spy on us..." He had a rather amused grin as he sat onto you, holding you tight against the ground. "Who are you, little boy?" He asked with a condescending tone.

You shot him a quite glare, but you weren't going to say another word. There was no point in giving anything away to them. You gasped as you felt him giving your face a firm smack, knocking it against the dirt. "Idiot." He looked up at his companion, yelling a bit. "Hey, what should we do with him?"

"Toss him in the cage, too. We can deal with him after our sale."

You grunted as you felt him pulling you up, yanking your pack and weaponry from your body and tossing it onto the ground before moving. "Looks like he's only got cheap stuff... I doubt anybody will be looking for him..."

You swallowed as you saw him working on opening the cage door, trying to think of a plan. The avian was looking at the ground again, his talons bound by a few ropes and his wings awkwardly bent as he seemed to move a little bit.
1532.title: Adventurer's First Trial

choices: He wants to leave with you.
He wants to take care of the slavers first.
15322.content:
You're quickly bound, most of your body restrained before you're tossed in unceremoniously. You land with against the bird, giving a grunt of pain when you do. He seems to give something like a wince, but doesn't make any noise after. The cage door slams shut, and before you can move again, it gets locked as well.

"Easy. You don't want to damage the Krethid." The second man quietly watched the scene, taking another sip from his drink.

"Bah. He put up enough of a fight when we were netting him. He can stand having a kid tossed at him." The man grunted as he sat back down, glancing at the cage before looking around again. "Least it broke the monotony some. I was hoping the kid would put up a better fight, though."

The two continued their conversation for a while, but you only looked up at the bird. His eyes seemed faded, an odd shade of grey softly looking back at you. You tried to get up slowly, but only manage to roll off, stuck on the ground and looking back up at him. "Sorry about the rough landing..."

Although his eyes followed you, he didn't seem to speak. He just looked at you blankly as you spoke. You looked back at him, uncertain of how to react. However, neither of you could really say another word. He seemed to make a quiet, chirp-like noise, but you couldn't make heads or tails of it.

"I'll... figure something out. Try not to worry." You try to smile a little at him, though you have a bit of a time trying to convince yourself of that.

You swallowed as the hours seemed to pass by. With night falling in a matter of hours, and nothing of note happening, there didn't seem to be anything else you could do. You kept your eyes on the one confined with you, but tried to spare a glance at the slavers nearby. Your bindings were tight, and there didn't seem to be much you could do but wait and hope. As night fell, you saw the two of them starting a fire, before starting to drift off for the night...

"Both of them are sleeping at the same time?" You muttered quietly to your companion when you notice it, your heart starting to race. It was clear that one of them was enough to catch you, but if they didn't even bother posting a guard, then you might be able to get away. You were tied down pretty tightly, but if you were careful...

"Give me a hand." The Krethid quickly raised his head, looking for a moment before turning back to you. You try to roll a little, worried he would wake them when you moved on. However, he managed to remain completely silent as you shifted. You tried to raise your arms enough, his beak tapping against them. He seemed confused until his beak made contact with the ropes. His eyes widened, and he gave a sharp nod before starting to peck and bite, only taking a few moments to tear through them.

"Glad they didn't use anything stronger than that... Hold still." You quietly move, your hands able to work on the knots wrapped around his arms. While they were tight, you just worked quietly and eventually managed to pull his talons loose. From there, it only took a moment before he had slashed the rest off. "Okay... We're loose... Now for the cage..."

You see him raise his arm, ready to cut at the metal cage. However, you quickly grab his harm, shaking your head furiously. He seemed surprised by the gesture, and tried to follow through on his strike, but you held him tight. "You can't wake them," You hissed at him. Although he didn't seem to get it, you simply held him tight, preventing him from moving until he relaxed his arm. You sigh and nod. "I want to get out, too... Don't worry, okay? I've got another idea..."

You close your eyes as you move your hand to the lock, and mutter something quietly. You gently drag your fingertips along the hole in the lock, letting your mind relax. You muttered quietly under your breath, and slid your hand a little, almost shaking at it. You grinned as you heard something click, slowly swinging the cage door open.

"Good... Lock like this doesn't take much." You grin as you step out, glancing around for your things. It seemed they had just left them in the bushes where you were found, so you started to rush towards it. However, you paused as you moved, feeling the Krethid's talon catch on your arm. You paused to look at him, doing your best to figure out what he wanted. He only managed to convey it from where he was looking, but it seemed like...
15322.title: First Escape

choices: You finish packing up and wake him, planning on heading back to town.
You see if you can get any hunting done while he's asleep.
153221.content:
You could feel the creature pulling on your arm, a rather worried expression on his face. You gazed around for a bit, uncertain before you quietly looked at him. "Do you... Do you want to come with me?" You pointed at him, then at yourself, doing your best to indicate it. He gave a small nod, glancing back at his captors before his hands held tight to yours. You winced as you could feel his talons poking a bit at you, scratching you like fingernails as you moved. "Right... First things first. Let's just get out of here."

You carefully held on to his hand, holding it and pulling firmly as you picked up your things. Your bow was useless now, but it looked like most of your other things were intact. The two hadn't even bothered digging through your pack. You didn't have time to check, so you grabbed what you could before nodding to your companion. You firmly held on as you tried to lead him through the brush, hoping to get out fast.

Thankfully, you managed to get out of range. Your heartbeat was still a bit quick, and the stress of it had caused your breathing to get a little loud. However, you were out and away from the slavers.

"Thanks for your help." Your companion was still next to you, but he seemed oddly calm. He looked at you quietly, but gave a small nod to you when you stopped to try and catch your breath. "We should try to get far away enough that it's safe to rest... I don't think we can travel during the nighttime that well.

He looked at you with some momentary confusion, but seemed to wait for you to start moving again, quietly following along. You were a little nervous with the way he moved, and though he tried to keep his eyes out, he seemed to stare at you a fair length of the time. He made very little noise as you walked together, and it felt a little weird to try to guide him when it felt like he might take off at any moment.

After a few hours of traveling, you had finally just sat down and put your pack down. The Krethid seemed to catch the idea, stopping and looking at you.

"I'm going to try to get some rest, okay? I don't know about you, but I don't think I can do that much right now."

He seemed to vanish from your view when you began to set up your tent. You were a little disappointed at losing the company, but there wasn't that much to think about. Perhaps you had just misread his intentions, and he only wanted to get far away enough to be safe.

Whatever the case was, you didn't think too much about it. You quietly worked, trying to get a fire going and taking care of a few things. It didn't take too long, and you were already feeling like you might collapse. By the time you were ready, you simply took out your blankets and tossed them onto the ground. You didn't care too much about if it was comfortable, since you simply wanted to go to sleep.

As you turned and looked at the sky, you could barely catch the Krethid's body perched in one of the trees. He seemed to just be leaning back on a branch, his eyes half-asleep, but gazing quietly at your campfire. You smiled a little bit as you saw him watching, his expression a little lighter than it had been hours ago.
___________________

You gave a yawn and pushed off your blanket as you woke up. The sun was only beginning to peek out, and while it wasn't a full night of sleep, you were too used to getting up at the break of dawn. You looked around quietly, stretching out a bit as you did. It seemed as though the night had passed by without incident. You glanced around the area you packed up your blankets, and it seemed as though nobody else had been in the area during the night.

You glanced upwards at the tree that Krethid was still resting in. You had to smile as you saw him leaning back, the sun only starting to show. Now that things were a bit more peaceful, you had a chance to get a better look at him.

His arms were laying at his sides, his wings folded in as he slept. His body had a thick, feathery coat, and his muscles seemed to curve around, his build clearly stating that he was constantly active. His hands were pressed into the branches, a few yellow, extremely sharp nails held at his sides. His body was slouched over, and his legs seemed a bit thicker than you had expected. A few, thick talons topped off the ends of his legs, currently clinging against the branch as well. Most of his feathers were brown, but in the light of the rising sun, you could notice a few topped off with a bit of grey.

His head was tilted back against the trunk of the tree. His eyes were closed, but they seemed to flutter around in his sleep. His beak projected sharply from the lower half of his face. Even in his sleep, his expression seemed sharp and aware. His body seemed tense even as he tried to rest, and his feathers seemed to hold tight against him as a breeze caught the space you were in.
153221.title: Rest

choices: When they saw you, they thought the Krethid was your servant.
Your companion's very good at not getting seen by people.
1532211.content:
It didn't take too long for you to pack up your blankets, and pull a small bite of jerky from your pack. While "Hey! Wake up!" Without a moment's pause, he jerked away, even jumping onto a higher branch in the tree. It took him a few moments before he saw you and realized who had called for him. You waved at him before indicating the space you had camped in.

"I'm done packing up, and I'm about to head out. Are you okay with traveling again now?"

He gave you a confused look, but jumped down onto the ground quickly. A couple of feet before the ground, he gave a couple of quick flaps, landing without a scratch.

"W-wow... Guess you really are like a bird sometimes..." You nod as you pick up your pack and haul it on. He seemed to get the idea, following you quietly.

"Come on, then. I think the road is the fastest way back to town." You make your way towards it quietly, seeing him follow a short distance away. He seemed amazingly good at staying close to you, even through the rough terrain.

The morning of walking wasn't too bad for you. He seemed content to follow close by, glancing in every direction as he walked. He could've been a little bit paranoid, but after what he had been through, it was at least somewhat justified. You couldn't help turning back every minute or two, sometimes to keep an eye on him, and sometimes just to make sure that the slavers or something didn't catch you.

You nearly jumped when you heard a loud rumbling, and were fumbling for your spear as you looked around. However, all you noticed was the Krethid, holding his hand to his belly. He paused for a moment, but continued walking without a word. "W-wait a minute... You're hungry, right? You could just let me know..." You have to dash a little bit to catch up with him, trying to get your spear back into place before pulling your pack off of your back. You had packed enough extra for one extra day of traveling, so you could certainly spare a bit. You dug through, trying to figure out what he would be able to eat. "Hang on, let me get some food."

He slowed down a little when he heard you speak, but he was still walking fast enough that you couldn't really stop to think. Holding your pack as you moved made it incredibly awkward for you to try to stumble around, so you simply pulled out the first think you could, a piece of dried rabbit meat. "Here. Can you eat this?" You pushed your pack back on with a bit of effort, poking his hand with it. He seemed a little surprised when he noticed it. He pointed at it, then at himself.

"Yeah, it's for you. I've already eaten, and you've probably gone a lot longer than I have without any real food. Here." You place it in his hand, but before you could even blink, it was already in his beak as he tore at it quickly. You were amazed by how he had reacted to it, but were more impressed that you could now make out a real smile in his face, despite not really being used to his beak and expressions.

"W-wow. Guess you were hungry, huh?" You took up the lead, a little uncertain on how he would act after he was done. He continued walking behind you, his expression a bit stoic again, but you couldn't help but notice the slight spring in his step as he moved.

It was another few hours before he suddenly paused, quickly moving away from the road without warning. You wanted to speak to him about what he was doing, but suddenly stopped. A few merchants seemed to be traveling down the road in front of you, and were quickly approaching. He had clearly done his best to hide, but you weren't sure if it was soon enough.

"Hello, there, traveler!" One of them shouted and waved at you as you walked. There really wasn't much else for you to do but to return the greeting. The few coins you had left with you weren't very much, but it should've been enough for some extra food which you gladly paid for. It didn't take very long before you were on the road again, a new bit of information...
1532211.title: Small Things

choices: Months later, the two of you have started adventuring together.
One day, he manages to follow you into town.
15322112.content:
It was only a few minutes down the road before your companion had returned. He was back next to you without a word, and as you walked, the silence was starting to wear at you. You couldn't help but get a little nervous as you spoke, before turning, walking backwards and trying to figure out how to express what you wanted to say.

"Did you see that?" You took your fingers and pointed a couple of them at your eyes, before indicating the road he had traveled. He gave you a confused expression, shrugging his shoulders when he couldn't figure it out. "Never mind, then... I'll have to ask later." You sighed and shook your head as you re-packed your things.

The rest of the day went by uneventfully. It was simply a full day of travels, and while you walked, he followed. If there was any sign of anybody else, he would vanish within seconds, but he would always reappear after they were out of sight. You weren't really sure what he was planning on once you had reached the city, or if he had even thought about where you had lived. You had to try to get the point across somehow, before it was too late.
__________

The chance came in the evening, after you had already set up a fire and found a few fruits to eat. You had offered some to him, and though he didn't have the same reaction as on the road, he seemed grateful when he accepted them. He seemed to move towards a tree again when he finished, but you lightly held against his shoulder to try to stop him.

"Hang on a moment... I want to discuss something with you. Well, sort of." He looked at you in confusion, but paused and held in place when you let go of him.

You looked around before picking up a fallen branch, trying to draw something in the dirt. While you weren't exactly the most skilled, it didn't take too much for you to end up drawing a lot of buildings together.

"I'm heading to the city right now." You tried to prod the image as you spoke, repeating yourself as he looked at the image. "I know you wanted to come with me, but I don't think we can get you inside very easily." He looked at the image in confusion for a moment, before giving a clear nod. He quickly dug one of his talons into the dirt nearby, easily scratching out a few trees, trying to indicate something at you.

"Um.... I think so? There's a small bit of forest nearby, yes..." You draw an arrow between the two, doing your best to communicate it. He nodded, simply pointing at himself, then at the image he drew. "So, you'll just stay nearby, then... Okay, I guess that's something." He nodded, gave you another curious look, and quietly resumed climbing up into the tree. His talons gripped the trunk easily, and he pulled himself up within the minute. You had to wonder why he didn't simply fly up, but you just quietly prepped your bed, knowing you probably wouldn't get a response.
__________

By the time you had arrived back at Ganecia, things were a bit clearer. After all, when it had come into sight, the Krethid gave you a small pull. You only had to nod at him before he understood. He glanced around, looking for the woods that you had indicated before. Upon spotting them, you saw him make a dash towards the area.

"H-hey! Hang on!" You tried to follow, a little surprised by his speed. Except for the times you had met others on the road, he had always walked with you, and followed your pace. You had to be a bit impressed when he arrived, panting for breath and having a bit of trouble spotting him.

Even though you knew he hadn't gone very far in, it was still rough. He had left very few prints, and even though he wasn't done climbing, it was still difficult to make out his figure through the leaves and branches of the trees that obscured your sight. "Hey! You here?" he seemed to ignore you for a minute, heading to the top and just glancing around the area before descending again, carefully dropping through the branches before lightly landing on the ground. He gave you a swift nod, before scratching something into one of the higher branches of the tree.

"So, you're... marking that tree? Or claiming it? Something like that... You'll stay here, then?" You point at him, then at the tree. He gives a quiet nod, looking at you as you spoke. "Okay, then... I guess that'll cover things. I've got to head into town. I think I can turn in information regarding the slavers. I'll come back and bring a bit of food, okay?"

He only looked at you curiously, and you simply weren't sure what else you could say. You just tried to motion through, indicating yourself and the city nearby, before pointing to the ground afterwards. He nodded, and quietly moved back into the tree. You were about to turn away, when you heard a voice speaking, deep but quiet.

"Thanks."

You turned suddenly to try to look up at the creature, surprised by the sound of his voice. You had expected a chirp or a squawk like what you had heard earlier, but nothing like his voice, and certainly nothing in a language you could understand. "Y-you can speak?" He only looked at you with a slightly uncertain look, but you shook your head as you spoke. "Sorry... You probably don't know too many words... Erm... Something simple, then..." You just take a step closer, looking up right into your eyes. "My name is Fermik. What's yours?"

"Fermik?" He quietly looked at you, before nodding. "Name is Blit."
15322112.title: Return

choices: He was always right behind you, nocking another arrow on your bow.
He was always right beside to you, talons ripping through.
153221121.content:
You were prepared for a lot when you had decided to become an adventurer, but things certainly had taken a turn for the unexpected. When you had rescued Blit, you didn't think much about it. Even when he asked to follow you, you had assumed that he would wander off as soon as you got into town. However, it seemed that there were other things in store for the two of you.

The first few days after, you had done your best to try to visit and bring a bit of food with you. He certainly seemed to enjoy when you could bring him a bit of cooked meat, and though a good chunk of your first payment was spent repairing your bow, it seemed right to give him a little help. However, he seemed content to fend for himself. He was more than capable of getting his own food, and usually gathered or hunted something for himself. You were more than a little surprised the first time you had seen him chomping down on chunks of raw meat, and although he had offered you some, you had to pass on it or risk losing your lunch. He seemed to easily settle in at the spot he had found. While he didn't have anything with him, he was fine with just sleeping in the branches of his tree, even in the rain.

The first few days were okay, but by the time half a week had passed, money was running short. Since you didn't really feel the need to mention Blit, all you could report on was the slaver's appearances and equipment. As a result, it was considered a simple job completion as far as anybody else was concerned, and your payment was only enough for a couple of days. It didn't take too long before you started to consider taking another job.

After your encounter with the slavers, you were a bit more confident. Although you had been captured, you had managed to sneak out without notice. You had even managed to get their captive out. As a result, you felt like you could handle another similar job. It didn't seem too bad when all you had to do was make a report on one of the many wild goblin tribes nearby. All you had to do was keep an eye open, and try to see if they were gathering any equipment or the like. The payment was a good deal better, and the distance you had to travel wasn't that far. So, you packed enough for a couple of days, gave your parents a quick visit, and let Blit know you'd be going off.

In retrospect, you could've thought more about the job before you left. Before you even got close to their settlement, you had almost been discovered by a couple of patrols. It took you a good fifteen minutes to lose them. After that, when deciding to try and sneak in, you decided to leave most of your heavier equipment behind, hiding it in a tree before trying again. Even with a lightened load, it was difficult. It had been mid-afternoon when you originally arrived, but it was dark before you had managed to get close enough to really scout out their camp.

But even though you were close enough, the darkness wouldn't let you get a good look. You could barely make out things that were twenty feet in front of you, and while there was a little bit of starlight, it wasn't nearly enough. However, the goblins still seemed quite capable in the limited light, and it was only half an hour before you had been discovered. It was difficult to try to make your way out of the area, and you were quite worried that you'd end up getting captured again.

The only reason you made it out was because you had help again. You were as surprised as the goblins when you saw a few of them falling, taken out before there was any chance for retaliation. You could barely make anything out in the dark, but you could notice someone nearby...

"Blit!" You gasped out your surprise, too busy running to say any more than that. You could barely make out his figure, but you were confident that it was him. He seemed to follow you easily, moving between the trees and striking at the goblins before they realized what was going on.

It wasn't much of a chase after that. The numbers following you quickly died out, some taken down and others stopping in the confusion. In the end, you were a fair distance away, panting for breath, and looking around for where the Krethid had gone. "You need practice." You nearly jumped when you saw him above, giving your bag a nudge from the tree he was in.You fumbled a bit trying to catch it. It was difficult to read his expression, but you could only nod, a little annoyed but thankful for the help.

"I... know that..." Your words were punctuated by your gasps, doing your best to catch your breath as you looked at him. "Thanks for the help..."

"Welcome." He lightly slid down from the tree, landing next to you. "We even?" He tilted his head as he asked, looking at you even as you tried to pull yourself up, and as your breath slowly returned. It still took you a moment to understand him, and you had to pause and blink a couple of times, surprised that he had followed you just because he thought he owed you.

"Even? You never owed me a thing!" You shook your head as he listened, it taking a moment before he seemed to give a little look of surprise. "I only could escape early because you were there to help me with those ropes, and after, we just traveled together a lot."

He seemed to dig for the right words as he spoke, looking at you with curiosity. "But... Food?"

"You owe me for the food? Food's really not that big of an issue. You never really had anything expensive, and I just had a couple of small things for travel to begin with. That's not something I'd keep track of. Really, Blit. It's not a big deal."

He shook his head a little, confusion still lingering in his expression. "I see..."

"Yeah. Actually, I think I owe you dinner for saving me now... But I'll worry about that when we get back to town. I still have a job to do..."

"What job?" Blit tilted his head a little bit, glancing off towards the location you had just been at.

"Nothing too big. Supposedly, anyways. It's just scouting out the settlement and reporting on it. Just making sure there isn't any possible raid or attack planned. Check out their equipment, that sort of thing."

"That a job?" Blit glanced back in the direction the goblins were at, shrugging his shoulders nonchalantly. "I can do it, easy."

"Heh. Shame you couldn't just take the job, then..." You paused, doing your best to keep your eyes on him in the dark. "Or maybe... Blit? Do you mind partnering with me?"

"Partnering?"

"Yeah, on jobs and stuff. I mean, it's pretty clear you know what you're doing, and I'm still new to this... I could sure use the help, if you don't mind giving it. If you want, we can split the pay for it. I think it'd be worth it if I had your help."

He seemed to close his eyes, a little lost in thought as he tried to consider the idea. "So... Help each other?"

"If that's okay with you, yeah... I mean, I don't know how I can do, but I'd be happy to help you if I could."

Even with the trouble you had seeing him in the darkness, and with the difficulty you had reading his expression, it was clear that he was glad for the invitation. He nodded eagerly, moving close and nuzzling against your cheek for a moment before pulling back. "Okay!"

You jumped a tiny bit, but managed to hold still enough to avoid a scratch. Blit seemed puzzled by your startled reaction. "Did I do... odd thing?"

"Um... Sorta. Cultural thing, I guess... Just surprised. It's no big deal." You just shake your head as you sit down, reaching into your bag. "I guess we can try to scout tomorrow morning. For now, do you want some food?" Blit happily sat down next to you as he watched you dig through, nodding enthusiastically as you started to pull out food and settle for the night.
_____

That job ended up being much easier than you would've expected. Blit's eyesight was quite good, and although the two of you had trouble communicating, you had managed to get a full report down without getting too close. The reward for it was decent, and although you had offered to split your payment with Blit, he had you keep his share, not having any good means to carry it on his body.

It was one of those odd things that you had to get used to. After a couple of jobs, it became clearer and clearer that there was a large cultural gap between you two, even if language wasn't enough of a problem. For one, he tended to be a lot more hands-on with his greetings. You would get his beak pressing up against you or feel him patting your back fairly frequently. He was careful to never poke or scratch you, but it still took a little getting used to.

It also became clear why he couldn't carry anything with him. The one time you had brought him an old set of clothing to try on, the entire thing had been reduced to rags. His wings couldn't fit in, and with his talons always pushing around, Blit handling any fabric tended to result in rips and tears. You had managed to find a sturdy belt that would stay on him, and the pockets on it let him carry around a little, but it seemed impossible for him to wear much more than that.

There were still quite a number of things that you had to get used to, and the same went for him. However, as time passed, things were quickly growing more and more comfortable between the two of you. He had gotten a bit better at speaking, and you had grown used to the eccentrics that a Krethid might have. And, after the first few jobs you took together, even when combat was a relative certainty, you felt fairly secure knowing...
153221121.title: New Duo

choices: You find a few good jobs, but there's a lot of competition for them.
There aren't any good jobs, but Blit heard a rumor he wants to check out.
1532211211.content:
It was a little surprising for you to learn that when he had saved you, Blit had pulled your bow and quiver from the tree and taken out the goblins before they had gotten too close. It amazed you that he would still be able to shoot as he ran. Although you hadn't gotten a good view of it in the middle of the night, he was happy to demonstrate during the middle of the day.

He was good. Surprisingly so, considering the fact that your bow certainly wasn't designed for Krethids. He took a couple of seconds longer than you did handling the string and the arrows. It was understandable, since he had to be careful whenever he moved just to make sure his talons didn't snap anything. However, he was precise. Most of his shots hit their mark by a matter of inches, and even in the middle of a full-speed run, he didn't seem to lose any of his accuracy.

Of course, it helped that most times, your enemies didn't even realize he was there. Even though he had agreed to help you, he usually kept a fair distance away when anything major was about to happen. You could travel together and talk a bit, but the moment anybody else was nearby, he went a distance away, usually taking your bow with him. Even if you couldn't see him, it always felt like he was watching your back.

After the first few times, the two of you had grown rather confident together. Although you weren't the best in close combat, you could usually stall long enough for Blit to take someone out. The jobs you took never had too much serious combat, so you always managed to finish with no more wounds than a few scratches.

And as a result, for a new adventurer, you were doing extremely well. Your equipment was generally in good shape, you had gotten used to the constant travel, and you had enough to spare to get a bow and quiver made for Blit, along with some tweaks and to make it easier for him to carry.

Of course, Blit was quite surprised to find out that you had spent a bit on something like that. . "Are you sure this is okay?" He accepted the bow, but seemed to tilt his head on it.

"I think you could try it, anyways. I tried to get some minor magic on it, so it shouldn't interfere with your wings. It'll just sort of cling against you, so it shouldn't limit your mobility. I don't really understand why you don't want to carry around too much, but this shouldn't be a lot. I mean, I understand if it's too much, but-"

"No, I like it." Blit smiled as he tried to adjust himself, feeling the wood barely touching his back as he had it on. "I'm just ... surprised. Most Krethids rarely run into magic, but you don't really treat it like a big deal here."

"Right... I think Krethids generally aren't capable of using magic well, so it would seem rare to you... But around this area, there are a lot of travelers, and plenty of races who can perform it fairly easily. You can usually find some minor things for pretty cheap around here." You smile and glance at Blit, watching him adjust the quiver to easily be within reach. "I'm glad you like it, though. You've been a huge help, so it's the least I could do for you."

He nodded, his forehead touching yours as he gave your cheek a slight press. You had gotten used to it by now, and managed not to flinch. You shifted your hand, patting his back firmly before he pulled away.

"I'll let you get used to it for now. I'll let you know what jobs are available right now." He smiled and nodded at you, watching you start to move away. However, out of the corner of your eye, you could see as he took the bow quietly, tensing it gently and testing it out, grinning widely as he pulled out an arrow. It seemed to fit him well, and it only took him a second before the arrow embedded itself in the side of a tree.
1532211211.title: Eagle-Eyed Archer

choices: "It's in a dead magic zone. Without natural wings, it'd be impossible to leave."
"It's only known to Krethids. It's the reason I came here in the first place."
15322112112.content:
You couldn't help but feel a bit of disappointment on your way back to the forest. Although there were jobs available, nothing really seemed like a good fit. There were always a number of small jobs, but they were the equivalent of chores and the payment was rarely worth the effort. They were often used for people who were in desperate need of cash, but you were hardly at that point. Even after your recent expenses, you had more than a couple weeks worth left.

Unfortunately, all the other jobs were way over your head. There were always a couple of major ones that remained untouched, from things like demolishing an inhabited castle to retrieving a relic from a dragon's hoard. These always remained for the people brave or foolish enough to accept them, but throughout your life, you had only ever heard of one or two of them getting completed. It was certainly possible, but you weren't stupid enough to try something like that so soon.

So, when you went back, knowing it might be another couple of days before you had a task. Although you didn't think Blit would mind the rest, you still felt a little disappointed that you were heading out again.

"Fermik? Something wrong?" He spotted you long before you noticed him. The bow and quiver were now both firm on his back as he stood in his perch.

"You could tell?" You turned up to look at him, before shaking your head and smiling. "It's nothing big. I just couldn't find a good job for us. It's not too bad, though." You managed to keep cheerful as you saw Blit moving down, testing his arms as he let the bow remain against his back. It bounced around a little as he landed, but remained stuck against him. "I mean, after the last couple of times, we've got a fair bit extra."

"So, we have some time off?" He lightly shifted his shoulders, one of them bumping against the quiver. He seemed relieved that it was still on as he moved towards you.

"I guess you could say that, yeah." You shrugged a bit as he walked up, a little surprised when you saw him drop down onto his knees. "Blit? Something wrong?"

"If you have the time, I would like to ask for your help in a more personal matter." He nodded his head, bowing it down for a moment before looking back up at you.

"Erm... Is it serious? What is it, Blit?" You tried to keep steady, assuming it was something normal for Krethids. However, he kept his tone calm and clear as he spoke.

"If there are no official jobs available for us, then I would like to formally request your help in the investigation and possible acquisition of an artifact that may be held nearby."

"If you want my help, sure..." He seemed to grow a small, relieved smile when you answered, but he remained on his knees as he kept speaking.

"Thank you." He shifted a little before speaking again, his tone a little lighter, but still stiff. "I will try to fully explain the information I have. I have heard-"

"Um, Blit..." You cut him off, a little uncomfortable with his sudden shift in tone. "Just... Why were you being so formal?"

"Is it not proper procedure to be formal when asking for help?" He hesitated for a moment, almost staring as he spoke. "I mean, I understand there is an exception when you need to move fast, but for something like this, I thought it was proper." He hesitated for a moment, before getting off of his knees, standing up to look at you."

"Erm, I don't think it's necessary in this case... We're partners here, aren't we?"

"Yes, but I am not asking as your partner." He shook his head as he let go of you. "You have invited me to an equal position, and while working, we are equals. But right now, I am asking for help as someone who is unable to offer you anything in return, and I must-"

"Don't be ridiculous." You manage a small, awkward laugh before putting your hand on his shoulder. Although it felt a little weird to you, you bumped your nose in against his cheek, watching him visibly jump a couple of inches. "Blit, I don't care what the situation is. We're equals, okay? So if you want me to help, there's no need to jump through any hoops."

"If... If you say so." Blit seemed to stiffen for a moment before finally loosening up, sighing quietly as he looked at you.

"Blit, really. What are you so nervous about?" You smiled as you gave his shoulder a gentle squeeze. He shifted a little awkwardly before he spoke.

"Erm... It's sort of a habit. How to explain it..." He sighed again and looked at you. "You ever wondered why you've never seen me flying?"

You hesitate a bit. You knew that Krethids could fly. It was the reason they were always hard to catch, even on the odd instances when they were seen in open territory. However, out of concern, you've never asked. "Yeah... I've wondered."

"My... wings are a bit damaged."

"W-what? But I've seen you use them before..."

"They're not completely useless. I can sort of flap, and I can glide with them. They're just not..." He raised an arm, sighing as his wing gave a half-hearted flap. "They just don't work well enough for me to really fly on my own."

"Sorry, Blit..." You swallow, carefully giving his shoulder a gentle rub. "Couldn't you find a healer or something, though? I mean, if you've been injured, then-"

"It's not that simple." He sighed as he looked at you before his eyes slid closed. "It's something I've had from birth. I'm not too sure about the details, but as far as most healing magic is concerned, my damaged wings are 'normal'. Treating them would take something a lot more specialized, and there's no guarantee they'd stay fixed."

"I never knew..." You sighed as you held his shoulder. "So... So you've had trouble since birth?"

"Yeah. I've..." He hesitated before his eyes opened again, staring straight at you. "It means I've constantly had to ask for help whenever there was long-distance travel involved. It puts me in a weak spot whenever I'm dealing with anybody else." He gave a small sigh, his gaze turning down to the ground. His voice sounded a little bitter, but more depressed than anything else. "I've done my best to keep up, but it's rough. You already know that magic's a rarity for us, right? So, the only thing I could really do was improve my body and my skills. I can climb and run better than anybody else I've met. It's helped, but... it's not enough to let me keep up. It's... rather rough. " He seemed to try to figure out how what to say to you, but in his efforts, he silently stood there. It was after a minute of silence that you moved in a little closer, seeing him jump higher when he felt you nudge into him, your body close to his. "F-fermik?"

You smiled and lightly hugged him. Even when he was social, the two of you had never really gotten this close, even with his beak frequently brushing against you. But, at the moment, it seemed like the right thing to do. "Blit, that doesn't matter, okay? I really don't know too much about your species, so I don't know everything that you've been through, and I don't know what other Krethids might be capable of. But you're here as my adventuring partner. I don't really care if your wings are a little weird. You're still able to do a lot that I can't, and you're a reliable guy to have around." You let go of the hug, chuckling a little as you see his startled reaction. You smile as one of your hands remains on his shoulder, speaking firmly. "So, no matter what happens or what you want to ask for, we're equals with one another, okay? If you have something you need to ask me, go ahead and ask."

"Fermik... Thanks." He just smiled, doing his best to hug back against you.
