choices: "I'm probably gonna try and sleep early. I think I'll need it."
"But I'm doing okay. Good enough to eat and talk a bit tonight."
15331122.content:
"Say, I'm starving." His hand awkwardly pulls away from yours as he looks at you for a moment, before looking back to the ground, as if in shame. "I don't want to take advantage of your hospitality, but..." The sound of his stomach growling interrupted, making it quite clear that he had been holding his hunger for a while. You look up with a bit of a smile, but his gaze is now planted firmly towards the ground. He just stands there for a moment before speaking up again. "So... Um... You know. Do you have anything available to eat?"

With a small laugh, you just grab his hand again, tugging him towards the kitchen. He's a little surprised, but he doesn't seem to put up much resistance as you bring him over while you speak. "Should at least have enough for a few days, yeah. Any requests? Or am I just gonna have to dump a bag of birdseed onto the floor or something?"

"You know I can eat most foods just fine, right?" He paused for a moment before sighing and shaking his head as you lead him to a table. He pulls out the seat and lets his forehead lightly tap against the table. "Your humor. Right."

"You were asking for it, you know!" You just smile as you open your pantry, glancing in. "Afraid all I've got for now is a few fruits. That should let you settle in okay until I can cook something a bit more filling." You just grab a couple of apples, giving them a loose throw at the table. One lands near his head, but the other bounces off his shoulder before falling into his lap. The sudden bump makes him dart up and look around for a moment. However, he smiles slight when he notices what hit him, picking up the apple and munching into it quietly.

"I might be a bit too jumpy, if an apple's gonna make me panic..." He looks right at it, his eyes a little curious as he munches it down. "Hope a bit of rest does me some good."

You decide to take out a couple of small pieces of meat, getting the heat started as you spare him a glance. "Really, though. You feeling okay now?"

"Good enough." He leans back in his chair, munching away and managing a small smile at you as he eat. He's a bit distracted by his food, and you half expect him to have finished before you started cooking. However, whenever you glance at him, he doesn't seem to be too focused on his food, even if he's staring at it when he takes a bite.

In fact, can see him staring at you between bites. You can't help but feel a little awkward knowing his gaze was still on you. You try to break the silence as you begin cooking. "So... Any plans for the day? I mean, your recovery's going okay, but you might want to nap or something. Wouldn't want you getting any worse and have all your feathers fall out the next day, or however you bird handle a few scratches."

He blinks a few times before shrugging your odd comment off. "Might be a good idea. It's been... an odd day." He keeps staring at you even as he thinks, it a little disconcerting when he gazes at you and beyond you in his thought. You snap your fingers a few times to try to wake him from his slight trance. He shakes his head a little, before speaking again. "Right... Definitely a little bit out of it." 153311222.content:
It has been about 25 minutes since you started cooking the meat, which were a few fairly large pieces of T-bone steaks. Once the steaks were fully cooked, you turned off the stove and placed them on a large plate. You also stuck a fork into the one that was on the top of the pile. You turn with the plate in your hands, but stopped before even taking a second step. It was because you noticed Morgan, resting his head in his arms on the table. "He was resting this whole time, huh."

The smell of the cooked meat was starting to snake through the air, and soon ending up into Morgan's nostrils. Morgan's eyelids immediately rose up along with his head, "Whoa! Something smells good."

"Yep." You hold out the plate of meat, "I made steak." You set the plate on the table in front of Morgan's beak. Morgan blinked once, staring blankly at the plate of food for a moment. "? Is something wrong?"

"Uh...", Morgan places a hand over his head, "I guess I should've told you...that I'm a vegetarian."

You stare at Morgan with wide eyes, one of them twitching at the thought of Morgan's comment. "A-...are you serious?! I mean, I don't wanna be rude but, I kinda find that hard to believe! You're such a big guy! And I'm not just being kind, you just are! I mean, you've gotta be...", You looked at the expression on Morgan's face, which was of him with his hand still on his head, only he was chuckling a bit while trying to hold back a smile on his beak, "...kidding." Morgan sits up on his chair as he begins to laugh loudly. You stare at Morgan for a short time, then begin to pout. "... Hrm..."

Morgan let out a few more laughs, and then wiped a tear from his eye as he regained his composure. "Hey, you're not the only one who likes to mess with people."

You stare at Morgan, "..." You then turn and look away as you fold your arms, "Hmph. I'd take your food away, but I'm not that stubborn."

"Hey."

You glance at Morgan, "Hm?"

Morgan twirls the fork once in his hands. "Thanks for the grub."

"..." You stare at Morgan for a moment, as sounds of him chewing and gulping down the food was being heard. You think to yourself a bit, and then decide to sit at the table next to him. You were about to say something, but couldn't help but keep staring at Morgan and his table manners. He wasn't too messy, but he seemed too fixated on eating than talking. "Uh..."

Morgan stops, as if pausing for a moment. "Hm? You were gonna say something?"

"... Uh, actually, yes." You lower your head, and then glance up at him. "If you don't mind talking about this."

Morgan grins, raising the fork with some meat on it, "Sure. Shoot."

You're looking down at the table for a while. "Well...", the fork was nearing Morgan's mouth, "...I just wanted to know about what happened to you back there." Morgan's hand stopped right where it was. "..." Morgan closes his beak, and then lowers the fork on to the plate. "Uh, if you're not interested still, I'm not gonna force you to..." Morgan suddenly let out a loud belch. "Uh..."

Morgan pats his stomach, "Sorry. Kinda ate a bit too fast. But...", Morgan stares at you a bit provocatively for a moment. You back up a bit on your seat, "......do I have your word, that you won't speak a word of this to anyone?"

"Yes, of course! ..." You pull out a saw and hold it against your left arm. "I'll cut off an arm to prove it."

"No! No! God, please don't!" You set the saw down. Morgan sighs. "Okay, here's what happened. It started out one normal day. It was morning time, I didn't have work, and I had the day to myself. I also wasn't planning anything important, 'cept to go to the park and relax."

"Wow..."

Morgan looks at you, raising an eyebrow. "This is surprising to you?"

"Well, yeah. I mean, your lifestyle is so...normal. In fact it's a lot like mine. But please, go on."

Morgan stared blankly at the table for a moment, and then began scratching the back of his head, "... The next part is kind of hard to explain... I was walking down the street, as I said, then somebody taps me on the shoulder. Once I turned around, I suddenly get sprayed with knockout gas. I'm pretty sure it was knockout gas because I passed out right after."

"..." You stare at Morgan as he paused for a moment, tapping the fork against the edge of the plate. "...So, then what?"

"... I'm not, entirely sure how long I was out, but when I came to, I awoke in a cage. It was small, so I wasn't able to stand up on my knees. My wrists were tied and I had awoken in some sort of lab. I also realized I wasn't the only one there. It was me, a dalmatian, a dragon, a ferret, and a shark."

"No way......a shark?!"

"Yeah. They're around.", Morgan said.

You just answer with a slight grin on your face, "Kewl."

"So anyways, I was the last of them all to have woken up. We were caged up for over half an hour. During that time, we all got to know each other fondly, and mentioned how we ended up where are now. We realized we were each doing our regular activity when we each got gassed in the same way." Morgan begin to clench the fork in his fist even harder. "Then HE showed up."

"..." You stare at Morgan with a worried look on your face. Morgan begins to shiver a bit.

"Nng...that cold bastard...! I didn't know who they were, but they were both wearing labcoats. The dragon lost his cool once the guy came in with his assistant. He sounded furious, yelling loudly and making our eardrums pop. All of a sudden, he gets injected in the chest by a syringe filled with some sort of blue liquid. ... I don't know what's in it, but it seemed to have sedated our dragon pal. And then within a few seconds, he passes out." Morgan clenches the fork in his hand even harder, almost enough to bend it in half. Morgan was also starting to clench his teeth as he continued to speak, "Gih... The dragon was the biggest of all of us. Almost twice my size and I was the second biggest of everyone else. We didn't know what to think. If something like that was enough to completely sedate a dragon as big as him, what in the hell would happen to us!? Grr... Before we even had time to think, the dalmatian was the next to get injected! He falls flat on the ground within seconds! The ferret was terrified... I know because he backed away as far as he could, shaking hysterically. The man closed in on our ferret friend, injecting him with the same weird stuff in the leg. And with that...he passes out in a minute. So now it was just me and the shark. The scientist walked up to the shark, but the shark said he would bite the scientist's arm off before the syringe would even reach him. The scientist didn't care though. He wasn't even phased by what the shark said, as if it were an empty threat. He just...laughs... And then says, 'You sound like a worthy...test subject.' Both me and the shark's eyes widened. Why the hell were we being used as test subjects!? And what the hell was it for?! What the scientist said must've really stunned the shark. Because before he knew it, he was already injected with the said substance. I screamed out to the shark, but then, I look down...to see the scientist's assistant injecting me with the liquid. With that, the shark falls flat on the floor, and then passes out. As for me, I tried my hardest to say focused, but I was too sedated to even try hard enough...and fell towards the ground. The last thing I saw was the scientist...and his evil grin." Morgan was still shivering from his encounter as he paused for a moment. "I'm scared...but I'm mainly more pissed off! What...what the hell did he put inside me!?! !!"

Morgan's tone suddenly calmed right down. It was because you were holding Morgan's hand, to show that he was safe now. "......And then what happened?"

"..." Morgan closes his eyes, "Mm... Me and the others were suddenly awaken. This group of five anthros walked up to us, breaking open the cages and untying us. The group managed to get the four to safety, but I almost got caught. I yelled for the others to run away without me. As for me...I thought of a last resort. I saw the window to my left. And without thinking, I just went for it, running towards the window and jumping right through it." Morgan paused for a short moment. "As for the rest of the story, I'm pretty sure you've got it in memory. I don't know who that group were, but I hope to see them again someday, and thank them."

"Wow... That's some harsh stuff."

You and Morgan just sat in your seats for a while, staring intently towards the table. Morgan speaks up...

15331122222.content:
"You familiar with Washer National Forest?", you ask while placing a hand on Morgan's shoulder.

Morgan raised his head at you, "Washer? The world's largest forest that separates the humans side from the anthros?"

The world they live in is basically Earth, only with one huge continent on the North part of the planet, and Antarctica on the South. Think of it as the 7 major continents never breaking apart in the past. "Sure, why not?", you say with a straight face.

"How'd you even manage to build a house up here in the first place? I heard you'd have to get a special message from both sides in order to build a place up here."

"Oh. We did. The anthro side's mayor was more than happy to give us one and we were shunned by the human side for supporting the anthro side. So our mayor agreed by ordering us to stay up here.", you explain still with a straight face.

Morgan raises an eyebrow at you, "You still being 'shunned' by the community?"

You say with a smile, "Oh that was years ago. Most everyone's over it."

"'Most' everyone?", Morgan questions once again.

You begin scratching your cheek, "Well, I still receive hateful letters from people at least once a week. But it's nothing I can't handle."

Morgan still felt a little concerned. "Has it only been hateful letters? Or is it some other stuff too?"

"Boy, you sure sound concerned about my well-being."

"Dude, you helped carry me out of trouble, gave me a decent meal and am currently providing me a place to stay until I recover. Of course I'd be concerned about you. Urrrgh...!" Morgan clenched his stomach once again.

"Morgan, you don't sound well. Maybe you should get some rest." You stand up from the armrest of the couch, "I'm gonna go head upstairs. If there's anything ya need, just call."

"!" You were about to walk off, but Morgan grabbed ahold of your left wrist. "Allen, wait!"

You look at Morgan, "Huh?"

Morgan looked down at the ground, but then up at you. "Um, is it okay, if you sleep down here tonight?"

"?" You put your hands on your hips, "What are ya? A big ba-..." You realize and remember what Morgan has just been through. You felt now isn't as good a time anymore to be messing with him. It'd be nice for him to be with someone he can truly trust. That person especially being a human. "Uh, sure. Why not? I mean, I am feeling a little tired myself."

You look down into Morgan's eyes, which were staring happily back at you. "Thank you.", Morgan said with a smile.

"... S-sure, no problem."

A few hours later, it was already around midnight. Morgan had been asleep on the long couch, while you were sound asleep on the small couch. The light in the room was also still on since Morgan said he wasn't comfortable sleeping with in the dark just yet. Morgan remains sound asleep, his chest rising up and down with each breath. Suddenly, a dark hand with claws slowly crept up over Morgan's face, slowly closing in as its fingers crawled once. Just as it was about to grab Morgan's face, it instead reached down on to Morgan's shoulder, shifting Morgan from left to right to wake him up. The person whispers, "Hey, Morgan! You awake?"

After being shifted a few more times, Morgan's eyelids open right up, "!!" Morgan quickly grabs the unknown person's hand and quickly turns around to throw the guy to the ground, Morgan's other hand now clenching the guy's neck. "Oh no! You're not gonna perform anymore tests on me...! !" The person who was waking him up turned out to be the raccoon fellow from before. "Y-...you're..."

The raccoon sat up, "Yeah, one of the guys who helped saved your ass!"

"..." Morgan let go the raccoon's neck, and then helped him up. "Sorry 'bout that."

"Ah don't think nothing of it. You're just lucky you didn't break my back or anything.", the raccoon said with a grin.

Morgan began rubbing the back of his neck, "Oh, uh, I wanted to thank you properly for saving me back there, but I don't know your name."

The raccoon gestured a hand in front of his chest, "The name's Vince. Me and four others were a team on a mission to help save you guys from being kept in an experimental lab. Sadly though, we couldn't make it in time before you were all injected."

Morgan squinted his eyes as he stared towards the ground. "... Yeah..." Morgan looked up at Vince. "Would you guys happen to know what those bastards put inside us?"

"Sorry. Sad to say I can't. Least not yet. We currently have the others who were injected in a testing lab of our own. Just to see what we're dealing with."

Morgan shifted his hands up, "Please, I've had enough of labs already."

"I didn't say you have to be tested if you want to." Vince folds his arms, "Besides, it's gonna take a while to get you back to Anthroside."

"... Why is that?"

"Apparently, eversince we saved you guys, law enforcement has jacked up around here. Who knows!? They could be searching this entire mountain right now as we speak. It was a nice thing that kid did for you earlier, but I don't think staying here is such a good idea."

"! That's right!" Morgan turns towards you and whispers, "Allen! ..." Morgan just stared blankly towards you, seeing that you were wearing an eyemask and had cotton stuffed in your ears. "...... Boy, you sure went through a lot of trouble."

"Oh no, he was already wearing that. The kid sure likes his beauty sleep."

Morgan turns his attention towards Vince, "Hey, he's older than he looks. Okay?"

Vince blinks his eyes at Morgan, "Hm? Do you even trust this guy? I noticed you have been talking a lot since you were brought here."

"Of course I do." Vince was staring back at Morgan with an eyebrow raised and his arms still folded. "Well, okay, maybe not fully. But--"

"You barely met this guy about a few hours ago. You sure he's not plotting against you or anything like that?"

"Hey, he went through the trouble of bringing me up here, didn't he?" Morgan turns his head towards you, "I'm sure he'd have notified the police by now if he really didn't give a crap about me." Morgan said in a low voice, "And, it's strange, but, I think we're really connecting with each other in some sort of strange way..."

"What was that?"

"Uh--", Morgan looked back at Vince, "--n-nothing."

"Look, if I were you, I'd high-tail it right out of here while we have the chance."

"If you haven't noticed...", Morgan lifted up his injured arm, "I'm not in the best condi-...-tion..."

Vince was puzzled, "? What's up?"

Morgan looked at his arm, which was still wrapped in bandages. He curled his fingers a few times with ease. He then quickly tore off all the bandages that were wrapped around his supposedly injured arm. But after shifting his arm around, up and down, left and right, and even throwing a swift punch at the air in front of him...his arm had completely healed. Morgan took another close look at his once-injured arm, "My arm...it's all healed up!"

"Whoa whoa whoa! You mean to tell me you injured your arm after jumping out of that window, and it completely healed within a few hours?"

Morgan lifted his arm up a bit and flexed it, causing his bicep to peak and bulge out pretty good. "I...guess so."

Vince begins scratching his chin, "Interesting... Looks like whatever he injected you with causes you injures to heal within a few hours. Depending on the severity of your injury of course." Vince walked over to a nearby window. "Now come on. Since you're all better, let's make a hasty escape!"

"..." Morgan stared at Vince, and then turned his head towards you. "...I'm uh...I think I'll just stay here for the time being."

"What? Why?", Vince asked.

Morgan grinned, "I kinda like this kid. He's one of the first few humans I ever got to meet who doesn't end up wanting to kill me."

Vince stared at Morgan for a moment, and then sighed as he put his hands on his hips. "You sure about this?"

Morgan still had his attention on you, "Yeah. I'm sure."

Vince sighs again. "Fine. But here, take this." Vince pulls out what looks like a business card from his pocket. He hands it to Morgan. "It's a card with emergency contact numbers in case you're in trouble. Just call one of them and we'll arrive as soon as we can."

"Hm. Alright. I'll keep this in mind."

Vince opens up the window. "Well, good luck to ya--", Vince leapt out of the window, but ended up tripping on the window sill and falling to the ground, "Ack! Dammit!" Morgan stared towards where Vince once stood. "Uh, a little help?"

"Heh." Morgan started walking towards the window, "I'm coming."

The sun's already up and out by the time you start to awaken. You shift and turn, your blankets sprawled over the floor as you slowly pull off the mask you wear in your sleep. As your eyes opened, you jumped back, not expecting a beak right in front of you. “Gruh!”

“Morning, Allen. Scare you?” Morgan slowly pulled his head away, grinning widely as he sees your reaction. You reflexive throw the blanket at him, it falling in a bit of a pile as it lands on top of him. “What are you doing?”

“Sheesh... And I thought I woke up early enough... Didn't expect a bird in my face. Maybe one chirping on my windowsill, but not in front of my face.”You yawn a bit, stretching out as Morgan pulls the blanket off. “You sleep okay, though?”

Morgan looks back towards the window for a moment, before turning and chucking the blanket back over you. “Better than I thought. Couch was warm enough. Thanks, though. For keeping me company and all.” He looks a little shyly towards the ground, and you just smile, slowly standing up and stretching your arms out.

“No problem. How's your arm feeling? Didn't end up sleeping on it or something, did you?”

He hesitates again, before shaking his head a few times, shifting and nodding towards the bandages. “Bit stiff, but I think it's improved.

“Glad to hear it.” You smile and slowly stand up, reaching out and giving Morgan's good shoulder a small pat. He hesitates before rolling it a little and smiling back at you. “Come on, now. I'll make some breakfast. Unless you've already eaten some worms while I was still sleeping or something. Bit of an early bird, aren't you?”

You feel a hand place a slight slap against the back of your head. It doesn't do any more than catch your attention, and you can't help but chuckle as Morgan follows. “What?”

“I was thinking of trying to make breakfast for us today. I can at least do that much for you. But if you're gonna make jokes about it the entire time...”

“Hey, I can keep quiet when I need to.” You let him move forwards into your kitchen. “I just don't need to right now!”You grin before he turns, and you duck under another slight bop aimed your forehead. He grumbles a little as he resumes walking, but you can still spot the slight smile he has.

“Hope you don't mind if I end up raiding your pantry a bit. I'm not completely sure what you've got to cook with.”

“Little bit of everything, really. I don't make the trip to town too often, so I usually try to make sure I have a variety of food that'll last me a while.” You help pull open the pantry door for him as you watch him fumble for it with his uninjured arm. “You sure you can cook with one arm?”

“I'll manage something. Besides, I've got enough feeling back in my injured arm. I'm sure I can use it if I take it easy.” He gives a small nod, and while you're a bit concerned, you just step back and watch him starting to pull a few things out.

“Alright. Just don't break anything, okay? It's a pain to try to replace any of my pans, and it'll be even worse trying to replace your arm or something.”

“Mmm.” Morgan gives a small smile as he starts to work, speaking to you as he does. “So, you have any plans for today? I mean, I'm sort of just... here for now. Not sure what it is you usually do.”

“Hm? Well, originally, I was planning on going hiking today. Admittedly, there are only a handful of things that someone can really do to keep themselves entertained here.”

“Oh?” Morgan turned a little bit to look at you, the carton of milk in his hand slipping a little. He notices before it falls out, his attention going back to cooking again. Even so, he seems a little distracted when he hears you speak again.

“Well, yeah. It's part of why I ended up shopping yesterday. I was looking for some extra supplies before I went out. I guess it was a good thing, too, or else I would've probably run out of bandages halfway through treating you.” You pause a little at the thought, not sure what you would've done if that's the case.

“So, you're going to be heading out after you eat?” Morgan looks like he's struggling a little more trying to get a couple of slides of bacon into a pan properly. You just sigh and chuckle a little bit, moving up and holding the pan in place for him. He's a little surprised to see you next to him, but you give him a small nod.

“No need to overdo it trying to repay me or anything, alright?” He turns to look at you, before giving a small nod, smiling again as he looks at you. You start to move, helping him with the food before speaking again. “And as for today... Well...”

"..." You perk up your lower lip, and then say as you cross your arms, "Aw man. And I was really planning on spending an extended period of time on it today." You shrug your shoulders, "Oh well. If you say so."

"Hey Morgan, you, got something on your mind?"

You fold your arms on the table. "Morgan, if there's anything you'd like to talk about, you should talk about it now. I wouldn't want you still thinking about this and getting side-swiped by a low tree branch once we start scouring the forest."

Morgan was looking down again, but then he raises his head up to look at you. "... Alright. ...It's just...what happened the other day...it really got me thinking."

"Thinking, you say? About what?"

Morgan glances away, "It's just, what he did to me, and how he treated me...he, made feel weak. Like I'm, less of a person."

You place a hand on Morgan's, "Oh come now! I know you're much more strong-spirited than that."

Morgan raises his fists, "I am! I mean, I know I am!" Morgan lowers his fists, "I just, I want to get back at that guy. I don't want to be treated like that again. I want to be strong! And I don't mean just mentally, but physically! I also want to do for the others who were kidnapped like I was"

You look into Morgan's eyes, which seemed to be showing a lot of strength and courage in them. "So, is that why you want to go hiking?"

"..." Morgan calms down, looking at you, "Not really. But it's a start."

You stare at Morgan for a moment, and then grin, "Heh. Well whatever the case...", you place a hand on one of Morgan's palms. Morgan looks and stares down towards it, "...just be safe, alright?"

Morgan just kept staring at your palms, which were still touching each other. "......"

Realizing how long you two have been touching hands, you flinch and quickly pull yours away, "Oh! Uh, Yeah. Hahaha..." You get up from your chair, "I guess I'll um...pack both our bags."

You quickly speed off upstairs. Morgan grins, "Heh." Morgan continues eating, "Well...'Munch' 'Munch' 'Chew'...at least I got my appetite back."

Later, Allen prepared two hiking backpacks that were sitting on the couch. The last thing Allen had to pack were two water bottles, which he slipped into each backpack. You say as you zip them up, "Alright. That's it."

Morgan was standing behind you. "Oh. Okay, but uh..."

You interrupt him by holding up one of the backpacks in front of him, "Here. This is yours."

"Uh...", Morgan turns around, "...o-okay." You slip on the backpack on to Morgan's back. "But, shouldn't we be on the lookout or something?"

You grab your backpack and slip it right on. "Lookout for what?"

Morgan scratches the side of his head, "I mean, can we really just walk right out there and start hiking on our own?"

"Sure! I mean there are rarely any people hiking around here. Plus the only inhabitants seem to be a couple of forest animals." You walk over to the back window doors of your house and slide one of the doors open. "Alright. Let's go."

"Gih-!" Morgan holds out an arm, "Hang on! We're just gonna go!?"

You stop at the doorway to turn back at Morgan, "Hm? Yeah. What?"

"I just, I just don't think it's safe! What if something happens to you? And I'm kind of in hostile territory aren't I--", You suddenly place a finger on Morgan's beak, "--..."

"Hey, you said you wanted to be strong, right?" You set your arm down. "If something does happen, I'd just let it happen. Okay?", you say with a smile.

"..." Morgan stared at you for a moment, and then he thought to himself, "That's right. I had that whole spiel wanting to become stronger. And now...I wouldn't even step out of the house because of a slight possibility of being spotted... Okay, I guess it still is a bit much to take in."

Morgan suddenly felt your hand pushing against his back. "Come on. Let's go experience nature's...beauty." Morgan grins a bit, and then nods his head in agreement. You and Morgan walk out of the cabin, closing the door behind you. Suddenly, there were a few chimps screaming and yelling from outside. "By the way, there are a few chimps out here."

“Come on, then. Let's get going. We shouldn't waste time, now!” You chuckle as you quickly help Morgan adjust his backpack, before dashing ahead a little, the squeaks and squeals fading off a little bit. “Less I hear of these guys, the better!”

“H-hey!” He stumbles a little awkwardly before he starts to move after you, trying to catch up to your head start. “That's a bit more than a hike!”

“You're the one who said he wanted exercise!” You laugh as you slow down just enough to let him keep pace, your cabin quickly fading off as you move. “Come on, now, and stay close. Otherwise, you're gonna get lost out here!”

“Hey, I've got a decent sense of direction, you know!” He grunts and shifts his arm a little before picking up, catching up to you, the two of you slowing down when he does. You chuckle and just move your hand over his eyes, giving him a slight spin as you hold him carefully. He shakes his head, his beak brushing your hand off as you do.

“Okay, then, smart guy. Which way's the Cabin?”

He chuckles and just nods backwards towards it. “Oh, come on, now. You didn't even get me dizzy, and I can still see it from here.”

You turn and squint your eyes in the opposite direction, trying to take a look. “Really? Because I can still-” You suddenly feel him nudge into your head, pushing you an inch and tilting his head as he looks at you. “Oh, fine, fine. Spoilsport.”

He chuckles before nodding. “Nice try. But you'll want to find someone who's got a hawk's eyes before you try that one again.”

You squint your eyes back in the direction he indicated, barely able to spot your home. “No kidding... I can't even make it out from here. Guess it really is a bird thing.” You smile and take his hand before you start to move again. “Come on, let's get moving. Long as you stay close, we shouldn't have a problem with someone getting lost.”

“Mmmm.” He picks up the pace a little, glancing around the whole place as he moves. “I've never really been this deep in a forest before. Didn't even realize how many animals were here.” He turns a little as you hear the fluttering of wings, your head moving with his and just barely seeing a blur pass out of a nearby tree.

“Yeah. It's not a bad place. Most of the things here are protected, though. It's why I have to make runs to town. Only allowed to hunt a bit if you need to. Course, seeing as nobody ever really checks, I'm pretty sure I'd be able to get away with a few small things. Assuming I could catch them, at least. Too many squirrels have snuck into my place..." You grumble a little, but Morgan just chuckles as he hears it.

The two of you walked quietly, and you were happy to help guide him through the path. There was barely a dirt road, and the plant life seemed to be overwhelming the path every once in a while. It takes him a fair bit of effort to try to get around some of the denser parts with his arms still bandaged up. But you help him through, even holding his hand occasionally as you help him along.

“So, where are we going, anyways?” He tilts his head after about half an hour of walking. You're still in good shape, but it looks like he's the slightest bit out of breath. “I mean, I know we might be gone most of the day and stuff. But I'd like to know if we're going anywhere, or if we're just wandering for the heck of it.

“Aw, tired already?” You laugh quietly as he huffs a bit, doing his best to cross his arms in front of him. He just shuffles his good arm a little as you stop for him. “Take it easy, alright? It's already a lot for you to be walking around after yesterday.” You dig through your pack, just pulling out a bit of water and taking a sip of it. “But yeah, got a bit of a plan.” You move a little closer before pulling his hand from in front of him, tugging lightly and sitting down against a tree, pulling him onto the ground with you. “Actually...”

153311222221211.content:
Morgan stares at you. You stare back at him, picking your nose and flicking a tiny booger away. Morgan holds a hand up against his head. "So, you're telling me we're just exploring the forest, without any knowledge of where we'd be going?"

You pout, "Hey, don't look at me like that. I wasn't expecting to bring an injured hawk along you know."

"... Mm." Morgan crosses his arms, "So then where ARE we heading? Have you even pinpointed any area around here?"

"There is one place I go to all the time.", you say with a smile. You walk off, shifting you hand for Morgan to come along, "Come on. It's not too far from here." You and Morgan begin walking deeper into the force. After a few minutes of walking, you both were now walking through a less tree-filled part of the forest. Morgan couldn't help but take a look at the gorgeous scenery. The sun was glistening through the tries, blinding Morgan's view a bit, but it wasn't anything Morgan can't handle. You turn your head back a bit to glance back at Morgan, who was turning his head around a few times to take in all the beauty nature had to offer them. You grin and turn your head forward, "Heh. Hey, we're almost there."

Morgan turns his head forward, then slowly, his eyes widen. "......" What you and Morgan were walking towards was a large lake that seemed to be stretching out over 25 miles. Surrounding the back of the lake was a large mountain that stretched up to a hundred stories tall. "What is this place?"

You and Morgan come to a stop on the shore of the lake.. You then put your hands on your hips. "This my friend, is known as Riverbank Mountain." Morgan walks a few steps ahead of you. "It's the largest mountain here. Plus it supplies the largest lake here as well."

Morgan looked right up at the top of the mountain, where a waterfall was streaming and falling from. Morgan couldn't help but stare at the fantastic view, mouth agape a bit. "I...never knew there was such a beautiful place on this planet."

"Yep. It's got its sights. I'm one of the lucky ones, because I can experience this amazing site everyday. If I wanted to.", you say with a smile on your face.

You set your backpack down, and then start to slip your shirt off. Morgan glances at you, and then flinches, "What're you doing!?"

You look at Morgan, as if he asked a dumb question, "Uhhh, undressing."

Morgan straights his posture. "Oh." Morgan looks away, scratching the top part of his beak, "So, you swim here every so often?"

You sat on the ground and start to take off your shoes, "Well, about 2-3 times a week. Mainly so I can shower off a bit."

Morgan looks back at you, "What?"

You start to take off your pants, so you were now only wearing a pair of black shorts, "Yeah. One of the downsides of living in a log cabin is that you can't have your own waterline. So I pop by here to wash up."

Morgan's feathery cheeks started show a little red in them after looking at your almost naked frame. He quickly turns his head away, putting a hand on against the right side of his face, "I, was actually more concerned about you contaminating the water."

You walk up towards the edge of the water, running your hand into the water, "Oh no worries. Me and my dad used to shower here all the time too. He told me there's an underwater drainage hole that acts as a recycling system for the water." You look back at Morgan, "Besides, I don't think I alone am able to contaminate enough of this lake to deem it unsafe."

Morgan blinks once, "..." Morgan glances away, "Uh-huh."

"Care to take a swim?"

"..." Morgan slips off his backpack and sets it on the ground. "I guess. I could wash off a little after what I've been through." Morgan walked up besides you, and then rolled up his sleeves. Morgan was about to kneel down, but caught the unhappy look on your face before he did. "? What?"

"Come on Morgan. I'm pretty sure you need to wash off a little more than that."

Morgan blinked once again, "... What? You want me to strip for you or something?"

You smile without realizing it, "For me? I-I-I mean, you're just so dirty, and I just thought maybe, if you could undress a little more, you would be able to clean yourself off after a long day at work..." You stop yourself. You turn your head towards Morgan, who was staring back at you with a an awkward look on his face. You turn your head back towards the mountain. "I...think I just hit head against something. ......Just now. ...By some bug." Your face quickly turns red. "UGH!" You shield your face with your right arm, "I'm sorry! I don't know WHAT is wrong with me... I think there is seriously something wrong with me." You lower you head in shame, "Sorry if I completely weirded you out."

"Hey, Allen." You raise your head up and glance at Morgan. Your eyes widen. Morgan's tattered shirt and pants were set beside him on the ground. Morgan was kneeling on his left knee in only his red, white polka-dotted boxers. "I suppose taking a full-body swim wouldn't be so bad."

You stare intently at one part of Morgan's muscular form. "...Polka-dots...?"

"Is that really the only thing you notice?" You face quickly poofs red again. "Well it was either this or the one with heart-shaped polka-dots, but I don't think it matters." Morgan glances at you, "?" Your cheeks were still red, as you tried not to take another glance at Morgan's handsome form. Morgan reaches an arm around your shoulders, "Hey, snap out of it."

You turn your head to look up at Morgan, "Huh?"

Morgan suddenly leaps up into the air with you in his arms, "Come on! Let's go for a swim!"

"WAHHH!!"

“Gack!” You're laughing and coughing a bit as you try to resurface from the water. It only takes you a moment before your head makes its way above, the water flowing around your neck as you try to stand up steady. You can see the grin on Morgan's face as his head pops out in front of you. “You just had to jump, didn't you?”

“Hey, you were the one who insisted I get in here!” He grins as he splashes you a bit with his arms. The water drips off from his feathers as he gets you, and you grunt before trying to move, pushing at him playfully and nearly diving onto him. He twists away, laughing as he kicks through the water. You can't help but grin and stare a little, the water sliding off of his feathers as he gets a short distance away. With a quick stroke of your arms, you quickly catch up, doing your best to grab around his waist and keep him in place.

“Gonna get you for that!” You grin and take a quick breath before playfully pulling, managing to drag him under for a couple of moments before you feel him pushing his head back out, the two of you both trying to catch your breath. After a few moments, you grin at him and nod a few times. “Hehe. Thanks for coming in, though. I wouldn't want a stinky bird in my place.”

“Oh, shut it.” He just grins and gives you a push with both arms, you just laughing as you fall back, floating on the water for a few moments. You shake and shift a little, letting the water stream over your body. You tilt up a little to see Morgan working through his feathers, trying to get a bit of water in the tough-to-reach spaces. However, it takes you a few moments before something registers in your mind. “Hey, Morgan?”

“Hm? What is it?” He turns a little, a slight blush on his face as he glances over your body. You shift and try to stand back up, the water reaching up to your shoulders as you look at him.

“Is your arm okay? I mean, you almost picked me up with it earlier, and it looks like you're using it okay right now.” The bird blinks a couple of times, before letting off a couple of uncertain sounds. It takes a moment before he speaks again.

“Well, yeah... About that... It kind of... Healed last night.” He turns slowly and cautiously, tugging the bandages loose.

“Really? Let me see...” You move up close as you watch him loosen the bandage. He does his best to toss it back onto the land. He bends and turns his arm a few time as you examine it closely, trying to look for any trace of the cuts that he had. However, you can't find any sign that he had ever been injured, not even the slightest edge of a scar.

“I... Honestly, I have no idea what happened. It's weird...” He turns, lowering his arm and testing his hand a few times, opening and clenching it. He looks a little more distraught by it than you would've thought.

“Weird. Yeah, that's one word for it. Still, it's not like that's a bad thing, right? As long as you're feeling better now and all.” You smile and give his arm a light squeeze. You watch for his reaction, noticing that he doesn't wince or really react to it. He's more surprised that you're holding him as he shifts a little, blushing as he mutters out.

“Hey, come on, now. You trying to get a feel?” He chuckles and just playfully flexes his arm. You can't help but blush for a moment before just splashing a handful of water onto his head.

“Oh, shush, you. You aren't that big.” You grin as you give him another squeeze, a little surprised at how firm he felt. Still, you didn't really have that much to compare it to. You couldn't help but glance over his body again, admiring it a bit as you hold him. You're not sure how long you're holding him, but it must be a little bit too long. You hear a slight noise, almost a cough, coming from him, and you blush as you pull back suddenly.

“S-sorry. Just a little distracted. I mean, you look good is all. Better than I thought a wet bird would've looked, that's for sure.” You chuckle a few times, but he just nods and shifts a little bit.

“Really?” It's his turn to blush now. He looks down at his own body, shifting a little as he tried to scrub through a few more of his feathers, making contact with his chest. He pauses a little, almost looking slightly surprised before he turns back up, glancing right at you. “Um... Uh... T-thanks...”

“Yeah...” You just shake your head a few times before putting on the calmest smile you can manage. “Think you still look better dry, though.”

“I'll either need a towel or a bit of time sunbathing if you really want to see that.” He chuckles awkwardly before he dives under the water for a few moments. You see him almost jumping as he splashes back out. “Think I'm mostly set, though. You got yourself clean?”

“Well, good enough, I think.” You grin for a moment before diving back under the water for a moment. You do your best to stay under for a bit longer than usual, swimming as quickly as you can manage. You can almost hear him gasp when you pop up behind him, grinning as you're holding his shoulder. He flails a little before you just jump lightly onto his back, holding on tight. “Hehe! Gotcha!”

“Ack! What's the big idea!” His voice is a bit loud, but he doesn't sound upset at you. He's more panicked than anything else as you hold on tightly.

“Hehe. Just a thought. You said you wanted to be a bit stronger, right? And we're right here now. So...” You grin a little more, the edge of a blush noticeable from where you are. You're blushing a little as well, but you manage to keep your voice even as you make your suggestion.

However, as you packed a bit of luggage, you had a small smile on your face. It had been ages since Davur had contacted you, and you weren't going to risk losing contact with him again.

You hadn't heard from him every since the end of college, when he had signed up for some experiment or another. The entire thing had been very secretive, and you weren't sure about the details, but you weren't going to miss a chance to see the dragon. You were just glad for the chance to see your friend again.

It was surprising that the two of you had ever struck up a friendship. The only reason the two of you began talking to one another was because he had collided with you in the hallway while he was in a rush. It was quite something when you crashed into the biggest dragon at the school. It was a rather rough first impression for the two of you, and you weren't quite sure what to make of it when you saw the large red splotch on his white scales and light shirt. As you picked yourself up, you It only took the two of you a few moments to figure out that while there wasn't any serious injury, you had gotten a bit of a nosebleed. The mess had been enough to make him worry, and he had taken you back to his place until he was sure that you were okay.

You weren't even sure how things had progressed from that stage. Although he always had plenty of people surrounding him and talking to him, and he was always busy at the gym, the two of you just bumped into each other enough for things to start progressing. You had gotten into the habit of carrying a small snack with you, and he was always a voracious eater. From there on, whenever you bumped into one another, it always seemed like the two of you had a few minutes to sit down and chat while he ate.

That was hardly enough for a stable friendship. But during those few conversations, you learned a lot more about him. Of course, he was working towards being a bodybuilder, but how he was trying to get a degree in physics just because he wanted a backup. On how he was determined to go through the entire thing on his own cash, which made it tough for him to really go out around the town. Even on how he was the first one in his family to really be out on his own. It wasn't a whole lot that was unusual, but you listened, and he just seemed happy that he had someone who was listening.

Things had just kept moving on from there. He invited you over a couple of times, and even though all the two of you did was just chat or watch TV, you had gotten used to each other. You had even accompanied him to the gym a few times, though it was painfully clear that you would have a lot of difficulty keeping up with him. Even with that, he was satisfied with you just trying to help him out. He always had a few eyes on him when he worked out, and after a while, you were one of them. But despite that, it amazed you that despite there being much stronger people around, he usually asked you to help spot him or to keep an eye on him.

It was only a couple of years before two of you had become close friends. During your third year, the two of you had moved in together, and had taken care of one another. During that time, he seemed to work even harder. You didn't quite understand it. To you, he had always looked fine. He was easily the biggest person in the school, and everybody knew it. You had to admit that when you saw him coming back from a workout, or walking around without a shirt, he looked amazing. He had always laughed it off whenever he caught you looking, and though you were a little embarrassed, he had made sure that you were never intimidated.

Over the next couple of years, he kept working out and kept growing, and you were always the first to see it. Though he could easily get into almost every athletic team. Instead, he rejected them just to continue working on his body. He attracted plenty of attention, and you still remember hearing him talking about a few offers he had gotten once he had graduated. By then, the two of you had planned on being roommates if he was offered a job close to yours.

However, that changed right before graduation. He had suddenly gotten an offer from some secretive scientific clinic, and he accepted it without a second thought. You still remember his expression upon reading the offer. His grin easily stretched along the full length of his muzzle, and he looked like he'd punch a hole through the ceiling if he tried to jump for joy. The offer that he had received didn't pay as much, but something about it made him simply ecstatic.

You were a little disappointed that he'd be going away, but you weren't going to let that get in the way when he was that excited. The two of you had split off since then, and you had settled into your new office job. Things had been calm, and while it was difficult to bear it, you were satisfied with life in general.

But ever since that time, it was nearly impossible to get any details about him. He had only occasionally managed to get a couple of calls through to you, and they were always brief and vague. He couldn't ever talk about the details, and could only tell you not to worry. This time, however, things were different.

You weren't exactly sure what to make of it. Somehow, he had gotten you a chance to visit him. You weren't sure exactly what changed, but it was quite clear that something had changed. If there was anything out here, it clearly wasn't a place that many people visited.

However, you had to gape when you arrived. The building that you saw was an enormous, sturdy construction, and the place felt like there were room for thousands. There were a few security gates, and you couldn't easily get a good view into it. However, near the front, you could see a security camera hooked up near a speaker.

You weren't really certain what to do, so you simply parked the car and walked up near the front gate. You pressed the button, shifting a little awkwardly as you waited. However, you soon heard a fuzzy crackle from the speaker, followed by someone's voice.

“Pretret?”

You turned a little, looking at the camera, but giving a small nod. “Y-yes, that's me. I'm here to visit Davur... He arranged for everything, right?”

Your response was an awkward silence. But before you could speak again, you received a small confirmation from the speaker. “Someone will be there to escort you in.”

The gate opened slowly, making you swallow a little as you waited. You heard a slight rumble as the steel door pulled off to the side, a ferret in a lab coat nodding as he walked out.

“You can leave your things in the car for now. Come with me.” He only gave you a slight glance before starting to walk the other way, forcing you to run a little to catch up and keep pace. If he noticed, he didn't think much about it. He simply spoke as he walked onwards. “There are a few checkpoints to make sure that you wouldn't be a security risk. As you've probably guessed, this is a rather private facility. You're only here on Davur's request.”

You weren't sure exactly what that meant. Did Davur really become someone who had enough influence to get you into a place like this? You weren't sure what happened over the last couple of years, but there really wasn't anything for you to say at this stage. You figured you'd have to ask him yourself when you saw him. You had to wonder as you passed through all of the security and were guided down a few halls.

However, you would soon find out exactly what had happened to him...
1541.title: Visit

choices: "For some reason, I'm still growing. They want me happy to avoid trouble."
"The results are about to go public. I wanted you to be the first to see!"
15411.content:
"Here." You heard the ferret stop, in front of a solid steel door.

"H-here? Davur's in here?" You looked around a little, staring at the door. It seemed to have a rather secure bolt over it, with a keypad placed near the front. You glanced over, swallowing as you stared at it. You weren't sure why that type of security would be necessary. You jumped a little as you heard a few quiet beeps, noticing the ferret tap in a few numbers without a word.

"We'll be monitoring from another room, as Davur's bound to tell you."

"He'll... He's okay, right?" You heard a few quiet tones go off as the door slid loose and started to open.

"You can see for yourself." The ferret quietly placed his hand on his forehead and shook it a little as he stepped back, letting you try to peek your head in. You tried to look around the room, but the first thing you could really note was that the place was absolutely massive. It looked like the ceiling went up as high as the gymnasium at your college, and you weren't able to even glance over all of it before you heard a voice.

"Pret? That actually you?" You swallowed but gave a small nod. The voice was a deep, guttural growl, and it made you hesitate. However, you could recognize the slight, mild tint in it that made you relax.

"Davur... You're... You're here after all?" You tried to glance about for him, grinning widely and stepping into the room as you saw him. "That... you're..."

It looked like he had been in the middle of a few stretches when you had arrived. You could spot him sitting on the ground, but he was quickly picking himself up and rushing towards you. "It is you! I'm glad you managed to find this place!" You heard the door shutting behind you, a long beep holding for the moment as he approached.

However, as he did, you had grown a little uncertain. It was a bit more difficult to make out his figure at a distance, but as he approached, it didn't take you long to realize that he had visibly changed. His scales were still white, but they seemed to have an odd, gray tint that showed when he moved. His wings were visible as he moved to you, clearly a bit higher and wider than they would normally be. However, as he approached, something more obvious was foremost in your mind. You got a very good look as he quickly zoomed closer, it quite clear that he had at least four or five feet on you by now, and that every bit of him was looking pumped. He had the same familiar look that he always had when he was fresh off of a workout, but even his quick steps towards you made his body seem to shift and press out more. As he reached within a few feet of you, one of his hands were held up towards you, shifting out and clearly packed with strength. Before you could even get a good look at him, your feet were off the ground as he picked you up, his arm around your back and side and his expression ecstatic as he pulled you to eye level.

"It's good to see you again, Pret! It's been... What, half a year?"

"Yeah..." You shook yourself out of your stupor as you heard his voice, and broke into a wide grin. "Something like that, I think. It's been a while. I don't think phone calls are really the same as seeing you, though!"

"You're telling me! Been wanting a chance to meet for ages! It's been a bit of a pain to get permission, though!" He just gave a hearty chuckle as he held you, his hand lightly patting your back. "Work been going well for you?"

"More or less. It's been a pretty steady thing. Couple of coworkers are a pain, but it's not too tough. I'd ask the same for you, but... Well..."

"Yeah. Kind of obvious, isn't it?" He grinned widely, holding you steady with one hand as he casually threw a pose with the other. "I guess you can see why I wanted this job."

You just shook your head a little as he did, though you still kept your smile. "Just going to the gym wasn't enough for you, was it?"

He gave a powerful, rumbling laugh as he held you, your body shaking a little as he held you in and pulled you closer. "Hey, you should know that better than anybody!" He gave your head a light bop, and you just shook your head quietly. "I mean... A chance like this?"

"What exactly did you get yourself into, anyways?" You let your hand lightly rub where his hand had made contact, and you felt his grip release, your feet landing lightly on the floor."

"Come on, then. You should probably grab a seat while I explain this." He kept a grin on you as he started to walk away, and you had to keep at a slight run to keep up with him. You followed him with a bit of effort, glancing over the place as you did.

The place was definitely set up for him to live in. It looked like it had been set up as a studio, though everything was clearly set up for his use. The size of most of the furniture was a good deal larger than you were used to seeing, and it was rather clear that he was being monitored the entire time. You had managed to notice at least a few obvious cameras, though you thought you spotted a couple of smaller ones near the lights.

He had noticed you staring at one of them, and let off a small chuckle. "Yeah, they pretty much keep an eye on me almost all the time." He had a bit of amusement in his voice as he spoke. "I mean, I get that they want to make sure things are working okay, but they might be going for a bit of overkill here. Think they monitor what I eat, what time I wake up and back, what time I take a shower..."

You couldn't help but smile a bit as you heard the casual tone he took to all of it. "And here I thought you'd want people watching you all the time."

He grinned a bit, nodding towards one of the few normal-sized chairs sitting near a rather large couch. However, instead of sitting it, he sat against the floor and laid his back against it. You sat down next to him, his head just meeting yours as he spoke.

"Maaaaaaaaybe. I think they prod and poke at me enough without the cameras, though." He shook his head a little as he spoke. "I mean, they measured me twice a day, have to take blood tests, have an injection of the growth serum every week, take scans on every little thing... I'm pretty sure that if I bumped myself in my sleep, they'd notice before I woke up!"

"Wow... That's... quiet something. Still, I suppose they want to keep an eye on you..." You just quietly smiled and looked at him, though you couldn't help the nagging feeling in the back of your mind. "And... And it's okay for you to tell me this? I mean, after the cloak-and-dagger stuff that I went through to get here..."

"Trust me, it's fine! They had asked about if I was going to tell you. It's a whole bunch of red tape, but we're in the clear! I had to make sure that your visit was going to be smooth and all! And... Well, obviously, I'm not going to be able to keep this a secret if you see me!"

"Yeah... I mean, the ten foot dragon tends to be a bit of a giveaway." You just leaned back into your chair, watching him shift a bit, his legs kicking out, looking like they'd easily knock a hole in the ground if he sent them downwards. "So, what changed so suddenly? You've probably been eager to tell me this for months, haven't you?"

"Ever since the start! After all, I thought you'd be as eager to see this as I am!" He chuckled and nodded, shifting up slowly. His body seemed to press a bit against itself as he stood, his strength showing in his steps. He crouched a bit as he approached, his grin wide as his muzzle brushed up against your ear. "But... Well... Something's changed recently. They've stopped giving me the serum about a month ago, and..."

"And?" You weren't exactly sure what to say as you tried to turn, his body held inches away from you as he spoke. It was a bit of a distraction, but you heard his voice quite clearly as he gave you the news.
