155.title: Fish/Amphibian

choices: He seems to have healed enough. Let him out.
He doesn't seem to have healed enough. Keep him in.
1551.content:
Your eyes perk up. You awake in a dark and slightly messing room. Your bed cover was wrapped around your body after tossing and turning so much. You slowly sit up on your bed as you softly grumble to yourself. You turn your head down towards your left to stare at your floor, which had a few pairs of shoes and slippers scattered around the floor. You didn't really worry about it much. Suddenly, a glimmer of light suddenly peers from the window right beside you. You slowly raise up the shutters, your eyes more than half closed from the amount of sunlight barging in. Within a minute or two, your eyes manage to dilate and open wide. You were living in a two story humble home. Behind your home, you were in view of a large beach shore and the Pacific Ocean. You smile. "Always an eye opener."

Outside, the shore was being plowed by small waves of ocean water. You soon walk up to the shore as small waves start wetting your bare feet. It really only took you a couple minutes to come out dressed in your black and white surfer suit. Your hair was black and spiked down a bit. You were also carrying your yellow surfboard in your left arm and a pair of binoculars around your neck. You take a deep breathe, and then let it out, "Ahhh... It's always a great sunny morning.", you say with a smile. You position your self to run towards the water, "Well, here we go...", you quickly stop just as you held out your surfboard. "Huh?"

You stand up straight and take a look through you binoculars out towards the sea. Looking through binoculars in its current zoom you were able to make out something floating out on the open water. "What's that?" You zoom in closer. Once you zoomed in close enough you how now spotted what looked like a humanoid body. "Holy crap!" You take off your binoculars and throw it don on the wet sand. You immediately run and throw yourself onto the water with your surfboard underneath you. You quickly paddle through the water and small waves to get to the floating body. With each paddle, your breathing grows faster and faster. Within a minute or two, you reach the floating figure. You get off your surfboard and pick up the figure, laying him on his stomach on your surfboard. You hurry back towards the shore as fast as you could. It took less longer for your to swim back since you had a little help from the small rising waves.

Within a minute, you reach the shore. You quickly lay the figure on its back and hold out your arms to perform CPR, "!!" You take a closer look at the body, backing your hands away a bit. "......It's a shark." An male anthro shark with grey skin to be exact. He had a shark fin on the back of his head and a pretty muscular build. His nose was pointed and rounded on the end, and stuck out a bit. The ends of his fingers and toes were pretty clawed-like. The only patch of clothing he had was a pair of dark-blue shorts. You examine the shark's head for a moment as you sat up on the beach with your hands on your lap. "Wow... I've heard of these guys. Just never got to see one up close." You slowly skim down the shark's body. Examining a little more of him, until, "!!!" The shark had a deep and bloody gash on the left side of his abdomen. "Oh shoot!" You quickly feel the shark's neck with two left fingers. He was still breathing, but barely. "Crap! I'll, I'll be right back!"

You quickly run off towards your two-story abode. A few seconds later, the shark suddenly slowly opens his eyes. He was barely able to open his eyes halfway. The shark just stared up into the sky. The sky had a few patches of clouds slowly passing by. He just lays there, staring at the blue sky for the time being. "Mmph... Guess...this'll be the last time...I get to stare out at the sky... ...Mm..." The shark slowly closes his eyes, "...Least I was able to see out of the water...this time..." Just before he closed his eyes fully, he caught a glimpse of you on the corner of his left eye.

You stood beside him on your knees for a moment. And then you quickly unwrap a big roll of bandages. As you proceed to cover up the shark's wound you start to think to yourself, "He woke up...to stare at the sky. ... Hopefully this won't be the last time." You look at the shark's face. You yell out to him, "Hand in there! You're not gonna die! Just hold on! You hear me!?"

Everything around the shark soon fades black. In a matter of seconds, a small bunch of bubbles float up in front of him. After that, everything around him starts to turn clear blue. As more bubbles began floating upwards around him, he slowly opens his finally. "Mm..." Upon opening his eyes, the first thing he sees in a room. "Hm?" It was a fairly decorated room with a flat-screen TV, two couches, one bigger, one smaller, and brown floorboard. It looked more like someone's living room. "... Where am I?" The shark suddenly hears some tapping, "!?"

The shark turns to his right, spotting you in front of him. "Oh thank god! You're awake!"

"Gah!" The shark swims back, only to him the another wall of glass behind him, "Ow!"

"Oops! Sorry. I normally try not to tap the glass. You feelin' okay?", you ask.

The sharks starts to look around. "Okay, where the hell am I?"

"Oh. You're in my fish tank.", you say with a happy smile on your face.

The shark takes a look around. There was a lot of open space around him. "This is a fish tank?"

Your fish tank actually stretches across half of your living room and stretches up to the ceiling. You start to scratch the top of your head, "Oh. Yeah. I guess it's more of an aquarium than a fish tank."

"Am I the only one in here?"

"Oh no. Rick's in here too."

"Rick? Who's Rick?" A fairly large blue bass suddenly swims up in front of the shark, "?"

"He's my pet bass. Caught him about a month ago." You watch as the shark stares at the bass for a moment. "Heh. He's saying hello to you."

"Yeah..." The shark turns to you, "He also says it's lonely in here."
1551.title: Shark Tale

choices: "I'll...tell you what happened. Just promise to keep it between us."
"I...don't really trust you enough to tell you what happened."
15511.content:
The shark looks around some more to check inside of your house. "So uh, how exactly did I end up in here? Please don't tell me I'm being experimented on again..."

"Of course not... Wait, 'experimented' on? Well, I'll explain first. I found you afloat on the ocean. Swam as fast as I could to get to you and managed to pull you to shore. I didn't realize you were a shark until I was about to perform CPR on ya." You point at the shark's covered wound, "You had a pretty bad gash on the side of your abdomen, but I also managed to cover it up in time."

The shark looks down to it, "Oh. I see." He felt his wound with his right hand, which caused him to grunt a bit in pain. "Ah... Well, least it doesn't hurt as much anymore." The shark looks up at you, "Hey, ya think you can get me outta here? I mean I may be a shark, but I don't necessarily need water to keep me alive."

"Oh, sure! Here, hang on." You press a button under the glass. In a few seconds, the water starts to drain on its own. The shark watched as the water around him was being drained. He also saw Rick quickly swim to the bottom of the tank. After half a minute the water drains, leaving the shark to now be walking on the artificially colored rocks. The shark also saw Rick now swimming in a small water tank under the aquarium. "There you go!"

The shark looks up at you, "Huh? So, how do I get out?"

You point, "To your left. You can push the glass open."

The shark looks to his left. He walks up to the glass, and then pushes it open. "Ah! So this is how you clean your tank." The shark jumps out of the aquarium and on to the floor, but then grunts in pain, "Gah! Ah..."

You run to his side, "Whoa! Easy!" You hold on to the shark's right arm, "Here. Let me help you to the couch." You both slowly make your way towards your couch, the shark covering his wound with his left hand. You finally help the shark sit in the couch, "Here, sit down."

The shark lounges on the couch, still covering his wound, "Ahhh... Couch feels nice. Good thing too. I was feeling a little claustrophobic."

You go ahead and sit beside him. "So, why don't we introduce ourselves. My names Randy. What's yours?"

The shark glances at you, "?" He turns his head towards you, "Harmon. ... Hey, I think the massive blood loss has left me hungry. You wouldn't happen to have anything to eat, would you."

"Oh sure! Of course." You get off the couch and walk off into the kitchen. You take out a box from the freezer and put it in a microwave. After a minute, the microwave is finished. You walk back to Harmon with a plate of food and a fork. "Here. It's not much but it should fill you up for the time being.", you say with a smile.

"Uh, thank you." Harmon grabs the fork, but then just stares at the food. "Um, what is this?"

"It's mac & cheese. It tastes good. Trust me." Harmon looks back at the food, and then scoops some up with his fork. He holds it up to his mouth, and then finally eats it. He chews it a bit and then gulps it down. After that, Harmon blinks his eyes, and then starts eating up more of the food. Gulping it down. "Heh. Wow. You sure weren't kidding when you said you were hungry." You go and sit beside Harmon again. You watch as Harmon continues consuming more of his food. You also kept your attention of Harmon's right arm as he kept lowering and raising it to his mouth. Watching his muscles flex a little with each scoop. You quickly snap yourself out of it, turning your head away as you close your eyes. You think to yourself, "God Randy...! Snap OUT of it man!" All of a sudden you hear a loud burp. You turn your attention to Harmon, who was lounging back on the couch with the empty plate of food on his lap. "Uh..."

Harmon raises his head, "Oh!" He begins scratching the side of his head, "Excuse me."

You just smile. "Heh." You grab Harmon's plate and walk over to the kitchen, "You sure were hungry."

"Heh. Yeah." You place the food into the sink, "Hey Randy...", you turn your body back towards Harmon who says with a grin on his face, "...thanks for the food. And uh, thanks for saving my life."

You stare at Harmon for a moment, and then smile. "Yeah. Sure thing." After taking care of the plate, you wipe your hands and walk back over to sit next to Harmon. "So Harmon, what exactly happened to you? Were you attacked by a shark or something? And I don't mean like a shark of your kind, I, I mean like a regular shark or an orca or, somethin'?"

"I knew what you meant.", Harmon said with a grin. But that grin turned into a slight frown, "... Believe it or not, I was actually torpedoed."

"T-torpedoed!? You mean, like, torpedoed in your abdomen by something?"

"Just...torpedoed. You know. With one of those missiles from submarines."

You were pretty shocked to hear that. "R-really?! ... But, how is that even possible? I mean, I figure half your body would have been blown off! Uh... Just, just saying."

Harmon stares at you for a moment, but then just smiles about it as well. "Heh. Yeah. To be honest I was thinking the same thing." Harmon raises his left arm and winks as he flexes his bicep, "I guess I must be tougher than I thought."

You stare at Harmon's slightly pumped bicep. You then look back at Harmon, "Uh, so...if it's not too much of an uneasy topic to talk about...you mentioned being 'experimented on' earlier?"

"!" And with that, Harmon's expression quickly sank. He lowered his arm, looking straight down towards the floor with his arms on his lap. "...Yeah." You just sat there staring at Harmon, who still had his head down. After a moment of silence, Harmon says in a low tone...
15511.title: Shark out of Water

choices: ...alright. As you keep this to yourself of course!"
...I'd, rather move on to the end."
155111.content:
Harmon says softly, trying his best not to stutter, "... I'll...tell you what happened." Harmon clenches a fist, and then closes his face in front of yours, making you jump up. "Just promise to keep it between us."

You stare at Harmon, looking right into his yellow eyes. You gulp a little before you speak, "Yeah. Of, of course."

Harmon stares intently at you for a moment, and then backs his head away from yours. He sits in the same position with his arms on his lap as before, staring at the floor. After another long pause he finally speaks, "... I'm, still really shaken up about what happened to me." Harmon flashes back to when he was swimming along in the ocean. "It all started out when I was just swimming on the outskirts of Atlantica. That's the underwater city I originate from."

You interrupt Harmon, "Whoa! Cool!"

Harmon glances at you with a slight glare in his eyes, "......"

"Uh, sorry. Please continue."

Harmon continues with his flashback. "A-hem. As I was saying. I continued swimming through the ocean. No apparent reason. I just do it to get enough exercise each day. This day however, didn't turn out to be normal. The first reason being because I was able to sense the fish around me swimming away in one direction. I turned around to see what they were swimming from, and it turned out to be a large submarine. Normally subs weren't permitted near out territory unless they were allowed access. In this case, they weren't. I was going to swim up to try to communicate with them." A large fish net suddenly drops on Harmon in his flashback. "Instead, I was captured, and then electrocuted until I passed out."

Everything fades out. After a moment, everything fades in. Harmon was slowly starting to wake up. "Once I started to wake up, I found myself waking up in a cell. I know I was in the sub, because there were a few humans talking right in front of me. It seemed off because they were all wearing lab coats. Of course at the time, I didn't give a crap about that. I immediately demanded to them about what the hell I was doing there. That was what first got their attention. Two of the four scientists walked up to me while the other two walked away. One of them was a bald man wearing eyeglasses. The other was an orange-haired woman also wearing glasses."

"The bald guy knelt down to me, assuring me to stay calm and that they don't plan to hurt me. He then said that...they would like to use me for an 'experiment' of theirs. That, did NOT calm me down at all. All I remember after that was cursing them out and yelling to get me out of there. And that they had no right to capture me and treat me in such a way. What got me riled up even more...was the bald guy's f*cking smile. I kept screaming and growling, but he just stands there looking at me as if I was some sort of trapped rat! Then just as I was about to spit in his face...", Harmon's eyes widen, "...the woman pulls out a syringe that he hands to him."

{"What...the... You're not planning to poke me with that thing are you!?"}

{The bald scientist grabs a hold of Harmon's left arm and holds it out. "I told you. Just calm down. This is a simple serum I've been testing many other fish like you with. Once injected, one of two things'll happen. One, you'll feel much stronger and healthier than you normally are. Or two, you'll end up silently being put to sleep.}

{Harmon pulls his arm away from the scientist's grip. "You bastard!! You think I'd take a chance on that!?}

{The bald scientist stands up, handing the syringe to his female accomplice and sighs. "I told you to remain calm." He nods his head, "You fish scum are all the same."}

{"What!?! How DARE you!!" Harmon grabs a hold of the bars of the cage, scrunching them forcibly, "I'll kill you!!!--ah...!" Harmon was suddenly taken aback by a syringe that was thrown in to his left pectoral. "..." Harmon looks up at the female scientist, who was the one who threw it. She stands up straight, straightening her glasses as well. Harmon grabs a hold of the syringe and pulls it right out, "AH! Nng... Why...you... !!" Harmon was starting to feel dizzy, his vision starting to swirl around and see double. "Wha..."}

{The bald scientist straightens his glasses, "Alright Jessica. Let's go. The serum should make him drowsy, for now"}

{"Yes Mr. Stock."}

{Mr. Stock and Jessica turn away and start walking off. Harmon tries to make an attempt to run after them, "Hey...wait...! Don't...you...run......off...", Harmon says as he falls forward and passes out.}

"When I awoke, I didn't necessarily know how long I was out. All I knew was, my wrists and ankles were held down against a wall. I also found myself in some sort of large room. Sitting in front of me was some sort of cannon. I didn't know what the hell was going on at first, but I didn't have any time to think either. There was a loud boom, and a cannonball was shot out. Hitting me right in the middle of my chest. It hurt. Really bad. But then, it didn't. I looked down to where the cannonball struck me. Then all of a sudden, my muscles were starting to tense and expand around that area. Mainly my chest and upper abs. I couldn't believe what was happening to me, but I didn't have a chance to take it in either. They continued shooting more and more balls into various parts of my body, until each part of me got struck at least once. I was hurting A LOT, at first. But then, once I opened my eyes, I...just growled out very loudly.

It seemed pretty vague but I was able to feel my body just...explode. Each muscle in my body was starting to feel really warm. As if I was being worked to the core. All my muscles...pumping...throbbing...swelling out all at once... A-heh... I guess I did kind of enjoy it more than resisting it. But then, something hit me. I noticed the cuffs my wrists and ankles were shackled to were starting to break up from my growth. I looked up and noticed a couple windows of the sea as well. If I can break from my shackles, I can make a quick escape! I took one quick look at the lab-coated bastards. They seemed pretty preoccupied with the results. So with a quick flex, I managed rip my left arm out. The same goes for my right arm. Then my left leg, and then my right. I quickly climbed up a wall to get to the window. And with my brute strength, managed to punch an entire window out.

Water quickly filled that room of the sub, but I managed to swim out in time before the whole room filled up. I quickly swam off in one direction. I didn't want to concern myself about where I was going. I just wanted to get the hell away from that submarine!"

You inched closer to Harmon looking incredibly interested, "Wow! And, and then what?"

Harmon glances at you, "......" He starts to scratch the back of his head, "Um, well...I'm not sure if this part is really, ah-hem, important."

You just stare at Harmon, a little confused, "? What do you mean?"

"Well, you remember the part I brought up about me enjoying my growth than resisting it?" Harmon appeared to be blushing a tiny bit, "It's, kinda like that."

You continue to keep staring at Harmon. "... I, still don't completely understand." You smile, "Heh. But, unlucky for you I'm the type of guy who wants to hear about as much detail as possible about people's stories."

Harmon looks away, "... Well..."
155111.title: Keep this to Yourself. Or I Bite You!

choices: Harmon's starting to feel tired.
Harmon's still wide awake.
1551111.content:
You sit there on your couch staring at Harmon. Waiting patiently for him to continue his story. "Go on! I'm all ears.", you say with a grin.

Harmon is glancing at you, and then looks away blushing a little. "Uh, okay. It, uh, it, happened back after I had made my escape from the submarine." Everything flashes back to when Harmon was still swimming away from the submarine. "So...I didn't know exactly how long I had been swimming away. But I could tell I was swimming much faster than I used to. I soon came to a stop. I turned around to see how far the submarine was behind me. But when I did...the sub was nowhere in sight. I must have swam for miles, but I was just glad to be away from that thing. I let out a sigh of relief." {"!"} "And when I did, that was when I started getting a, better feel, of myself."

"By merely laying a hand on my stomach, I got a feel of my abs. I mean, they felt...hard. Like, I was feeling a brick wall. So firm, so thick, so...big. Eh-heh. I didn't exactly want to feel me while floating around. I looked around to see the ocean floor just a couple feet down, and immediately floated right down. The first thing I noticed were my arms. They were so large!" {Harmon clenched his fists}, "So immense! I flexed my right arm in front of my chest a few times. Watching my bicep swell up and down with each tensing flex. I then began feeling my right tricep area with my left hand. It felt like solid steel, when tightened hard enough."

"I looked down to my chest. I began pounding my pecs with my right fist a few times. It felt pretty exhilarating! I brought up my arms against my chest as I puffed it out. I swear, I almost could feel my pecs with my chin! ... After that, I, I was starting to feel a little weird. I just, I just couldn't stop flexing and tensing different parts of my body. And who could forget about my legs. I looked down and raised up one of my short legs to get a great view of my massive quads. I began to flex it a few times, especially with my large calves. Watching my legs shred with my rippling muscle...it made me smile...sinisterly."

"I began stomping my foot against the ocean floor. It didn't make a very loud sound, but I sensed just how much the floor shook below me. I then noticed a boulder covered in algae that lay against my foot. I picked it up and held it against my chest. I let out a toothy grin, and then let all the my strength from my arms and chest. They both tensed out impressively, enough to start straining the boulder in my arms. After a few rock crumbling seconds...", {'CRACK!"}, "...the boulder cracked into pieces. I watched as the pieces of rock floated to the underwater ground, and then...heh. I just let out a roar. Screaming at the top of my lungs!"

Everything flashed forward to you both sitting on the couch. "Heh. I guess I nearly lost it. I mean, not anything manic-like, but a very proud sort of way." Harmon glanced at you. But then he turns his head towards you, "?" You were staring at Harmon with a pretty scared look across your face. Plus your sitting a foot further away from him too. Harmon blinked his eyes, "Is my, is my story scaring you?"

You jump up, "Ah! Uh, w-well..." You look down, and then look back up with a faint smile, "Is this the real story, or are you just exaggerating a bit?"

Harmon blinked his eyes at you again. He then smiles, turning away, "Heh. Yep. It all really happened."

You turn away as well, "So, I presume weightlifting is your thing?"

"Heh. Bodybuilding is more like it." Harmon looks up, "I've been workin' out and pumpin' up for years. Wanting the be the best, the strongest, and the biggest! Man. What I wouldn't give to be that big again."

You turn your head to look at Harmon, "Huh? But, aren't you at the least concerned about the serum they injected you with? Or maybe even the possible side effects? I mean, you might end up turning into some kind of monster for all we know!"

"!" It took a bit for Harmon to absorb what you said. He lowers his head as he his expression saddens a bit, "Oh yeah... ...Right."

"..." You hold out a hand to Harmon, "Uh, didn't, mean to make you feel bad."

Harmon shifts a hand towards you, "No, no. It's alright. I sometimes tend to forget about what's important before going through with something actually."

You both pause for a moment. Then you break the silence, "Hey, why don't you finish up that story of yours. Were you near the end?"

Harmon glances at you, "Huh? Oh, yeah." Harmon let's out a slight smirk, "Heh." Everything flashes back to when Harmon was standing on the ocean floor. "So, after my proud roar...I, didn't really know what to do at that point. I was just standing on the ocean floor with some underwater rock pieces lying around me, away from danger. I looked around, but I didn't necessarily know where to go either. I even thought about swimming to the top and try to figure out my location out of the water. I was about to do just that, but then, a fairly large school of fish was starting to swim around me. Being able to communicate with fish, I overheard them talking about my newly earned physique. I'm actually a bit of a show-offy jackass, so I decided give them all a good show. I went ahead and started doing a couple bodybuilding poses. Flexing and pumping as many muscles as I could. All while holding a large snickering grin on my face. I could even hear them talk about how much they like my body."

You interrupt Harmon's flashback, "Boy, you sure weren't kindin' about wanting to be strong."

Harmon looked at you, only with a slight glare in his eyes. "Hrm..."

You bow your head down, "Eh-heh... Sorry, please go on."

"It's alright." You look up, staring at Harmon's smiling face. "I was nearing the end anyway." Harmon turns away, scratching the back of his head with one hand, "Although, I probably shouldn't even be grinning about this part." Everything flashes back to when Harmon was doing his last pose, which was a backwards double-bicep flex while kneeling on his right leg and stretching his left leg out. "I was finishing up my routine with the school of fish. Then all of a sudden, they all ran off." {"?"} "I wasn't sure if it was because I scared them off, or if something else scared them off. That was when I sensed something." {"!!"} "As soon as I turned around, a torpedo suddenly gets lodged right into the side of my stomach. I look up, and spotted the submarine closing in on me."

"... But before they got close, the torpedo that was lodged in me exploded. I screamed...I was jetted through the ocean at a high rate of speed. ......" Everything flashes back to normal. Harmon was staring down at the floor once again. "And, as for the rest. Well, you pretty much know."

"... Wow..."

Harmon turns his head towards you, cocking an eyebrow, "Hm? Is that all you have to say?"

"Well...it was both interesting and sad. I mean, what, what else would you expect me to say?"

Harmon crosses his arms, "Did you like it?"

You jump up straight, "Oh, yeah! Very much."

15511111.content:
Harmon lounges back on the couch with his arms folded behind his head. "So, that's pretty much it. 'Yaaawn'"

"Looks like that macaroni and cheese must have made you tired." You get off the couch, gesturing your hand on the couch, "Why don't you lie down?"

Harmon stares at you, "On here? I mean, you won't think it rude of me?"

"You're my guest. I'd feel it'd be rude if you didn't.", you said with a smile.

Harmon looks down and stares at your hand for a moment. He then let's out another long yawn. "Alright." Harmon merely lies down on his side, so that he was facing you. He let's out another yawn as he closes his eyes. You were about to walk off, "Hey Randy." You stop to turn back to Harmon, who smiles at you. "Thanks." You smile at Harmon, and then walk off. Harmon makes himself comfortable as he shifts his body around the couch a bit. Harmon yawns one more time, before slowly falling asleep. You walked over to the kitchen to set Harmon's plate in the sink, and then turned on the faucet. As Harmon was sleeping, we proceeded on into his dream. "Yes..."

In Harmon's dream, it was taking place on the ocean floor. There were a couple different species of fish swimming around on their own, minding their own. All of a sudden, a large fish net appears from underneath them, and traps all of the fish in one catch! Above them was a large fishing ship, which was slowly retracting the netted fish higher towards it. A purple seahorse manages to squeeze its head out from the ball of fish. "HEEELP!"

Harmon opens his eyes, "!". He was sitting with his legs crossed on the ocean floor. His entire body was also shaded.

The fishnet was starting to raise up higher and higher, until it was just a couple feet away from the ship. An eel yells out, "Who's going to save us?!"

A dolphin screams out, "I don't want to be fish food!"

The seahorse turns his head out towards the distance, "? Look!" A fairly large anthro shark was speeding its way towards the ship. He grabs the top of the fishnet, stopping the net from raising any higher. "It's Harmon!"

It was indeed Harmon, only every muscle on his body was rather bigger than his normal self. "Not worry my friends. I will save you!", he yells out heroically. He grabs the net with his other hand, and then he uses his fin on the back of his head to slice the net from the small space between his hands. He carries the end with the trapped fish and releases them all. Harmon then turns his attention to the large boat. He swims up and appears out of the water. "!" All of a sudden, a harpoon gets shot from the boat at a high rate of speed. Harmon smirks, "Heh." He holds out his muscular right arm, and then catches the harpoon with hardly any effort. Harmon grinned proudly as the tip of the harpoon was held less than half an inch away from Morgan's head, "Heh heh!"

Harmon then goes and throws the harpoon right back at them, puncturing into one side of the ship. Harmon dives back underwater and swims underneath the ship. He swims up to the ship and holds on to the bottom of the ship. Harmon takes a deep breathe, and then all muscles in his arms and shoulders pumped and swelled right out. He tried his best to lift up the boat, but it didn't seem to be enough. Harmon thinks to himself, "Come on body... You can do this!!" Harmon brings his head up as the muscles in his upper body start to flex and expand with his arms. His legs flexed and swelled out as well, which he uses to try and push himself AND the ship up and out of the water. He was slowly accomplishing this as he was starting the raise the ship higher and higher.

The freed fish that swam underneath him watched in awe. After a minute or two, Harmon slowly manages to pick up the ship until the top half of his muscular body was poking out of the open water, the muscles all over his body still tensed and flexed with life. As we zoom in to Harmon, he had a big and toothy grin on his face, which only got bigger as he said to himself, "Yes...!" With one twist of his entire body, he lets loose the large ship that was carried on his massive back. The ship was practically thrown a fourth of the world away as it disappears into the distance. Harmon sets his hands on his hips, standing his upper body up proudly. He yells out with a cocky smile, "Don't you dare come back to my ocean again!" He flexes both his arms down, making his back raise up as well to do a crab flex, "Or you'll have to deal with this!"

All of a sudden, something was shooting right through the top of the ocean at a high rate of speed. "!!" Harmon turns his attention towards it, which turned out to be the same missile that injured him from before. Harmon tried to defend himself, but he wasn't able to react in time as he thinks to himself, "CRAP!!" 'BOOOM'

"GAH!" Harmon wakes up from his dream, panting heavily as he sat up on the couch. He pants a little more as he says to himself, "Damn... Had to be the same missile from before." Harmon turns his head towards a window with the shutters down, "?" Harmon overhears a couple ocean waves coming from outside into the dark home. He gets up from the couch and walks up to the window, opening up the shutters with two fingers. He blinks his eyes once, "!" The first thing he sees is you. Only you were surfing on your own out on the open water. You were surfing through the waves like a pro! Doing a couple pro stunts too. Harmon was a tad speechless. He thinks to himself, "... Wow... I new he surfed because of his outfit. I never thought he was so good at it!"

"..." Harmon turns his head towards the front door. "... I could, go outside... But, what if those science freaks show up again?" He turns his attention back to you. "On one hand, I'll be able to experience Randy's moves up close. ... On the other...I might end up putting my life, and HIS, in danger..." Harmon blinks once again, "... "What should I do?"

155111111.content:
You continued surfing over small waves and a couple big ones. You were even able to surf through a large tunneling wave once or twice. As you swam up a large wave, you managed to get up to the top. Upon surfing the top of the large wave, you caught a glimpse of something off to the distance, "?" That something turned out to be a figure standing out on the beach shore. And that figure turned out to be Harmon, who has been watching you with his arms folded and a grin on his face. You think to yourself, "... Harmon? Ack!" All of a sudden, you lose your footing, and then end up toppling to the towards the water. "Gahhh!"

Harmon waited patiently with arms still crossed while staring towards your direction. The wave then ends up hitting the shore right in front of him, leaving you face first into the ground in front of Harmon's feet. What was left of the tide started to wash away. "...... So. That was some, how do you say, wipeout."

You bring your head up to look at Harmon, "What are you doing outside?"

"What do you mean?", Harmon asks

You get up on your own two feet, "I mean, don't you think it's a little dangerous to be out here at the open water if what to you is true?"

Harmon raises his head up a bit, "... Wait, you don't believe my story?"

You shift your hands up and down a few times, "Trust me, I WANT to believe you." You start scratching the side of your head, "It's just...it all seems a little exaggerated, don't you think?"

Harmon's says, his tone sounding a bit louder, "Exaggerated!?" He starts yelling out at you, "You think I'd fake a bruise like this just to be saved?!"

"I'm not saying your bruise was fake. I just think-"

"Hey! What I said happened to me REALLY happened to me! Okay! If you think I injured myself just to be saved by the likes of you, then you're sick! You're sick-minded, okay!?" You stare at Harmon, with a hurt look on your face. Harmon was looking back at you, but then his angry expression lessened upon staring at yours. "..."

You still stare at Harmon with that same hurt look, "...Harmon..."

Harmon was still staring at you too, "......"

Your eyes were starting to grow watery, "...I was just saying..." A tear runs down your cheek, "...But that kind of hurt..."

Harmon's eyes widen a bit, "..." He hold out a hand to you, "Randy...I... !!!"

Harmon spots a large wave line starting to form behind you. "Hm?" You turn around. Once you were facing the other way, the wave was already in the form of a tidal wave. And it was coming right at you! You were in a state of shock, staring scared stiff right at the oncoming tidal wave. "......"

Harmon throws an arm out to you, "RANDY!"

You think to yourself as the wave was about to plow you down, "Crap! I...", you close your eyes shut, "...I didn't prepare for this!"

-Everything fades to black. The sound of gurgling water echoes-

You start to open your eyes. "..." You blink, and then open your eyes wider, "... !" You were now wide awake. Lying on your couch with your forehead bandaged up. Your abdomen, left shoulder, and left knee were also wrapped in bandages. "...... Huh?"

"You're awake." You blink your eyes, turning your head to your left. Harmon was sitting on a sofa a few feet away from you. He put on a warming grin on his face. "I'm glad."

You blink your eyes, "... Wha-...what happened?"

"You...got wiped out again. Only by an even bigger tidal wave. And your surfboard.", Harmon explained.

"..." You feel your forehead with your left hand, only to receive a bit of pain in return, "Ow! ... You don't say... How did it all go down?"

Harmon grins again, "Heh. Well, it all started with your surfboard. Apparently you must have forgotten about it when you first wiped out. It was basically thrown with the tidal wave, knocking you out in a heartbeat. I ran out to you as fast I could, but the tide got between us first. I got washed away by the wave, but I managed to recover from it. I looked around as fast I could to try and found you. And I did. You were floating just a couple feet away from me. So I swam straight for you as fast I could. When I finally reached you, I grabbed you in my arms and swam straight for the top. Once I swam out of the water, you still cradled in my arms, I looked around see where your house was. I spotted it, and luckily it wasn't that far away. Upon swimming my towards the shore, I realized something. ... You weren't breathing. I quickly swam to the shore. I didn't know how long you haven't been breathing, but I didn't hesitate to perform CPR. After a minute or two of performing mouth-to-mouth and whatnot, I finally and miraculously get your heart beating again."

Harmon stops speaking for a moment. You wait patiently for him to speak again, but you speak up instead. "... Then, what happened next?"

Harmon raises his head a bit, not looking at you. And then he continues on with the story. "Heh. When I got your heart beating, you coughed up some water. Some of it got on me, but I didn't mind. You began to open your eyes a bit, but then, you seemed to go unconscious. You were pretty banged up also, but I sighed with relief seeing that you were okay." Harmon looks up at you, "And, well, here we are now." Harmon stares at you, and you just stare back at him. "You, do believe me, do you?"

"After what happened?" You smile Harmon, "I'm gonna have to."

Harmon smiles at you, but then hi expression drops a bit, "... Um, hey, about earlier... I'm, I'm sorry for snapping at you earlier. I didn't mean to hurt you like that. But, do you even believe my story at this point?"

"Harmon..." Harmon looks up at you. "I do believe you. I just can't not say I'm a still a bit skeptical about some parts of your story."

Harmon glances down towards the floor, "... I understand." He stares at the floor for a moment longer, and then he looks back at you. Ready to say something.
